With the loan of S/.2,000.00 ($725.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, Kolynos, toilet paper, boxes of soap and other products to supply her general store. She will also buy raw material to prepare snacks to be sold at her business. Doa Guldith is 39 years old, lives with her parents who she supports in all aspects, and they assist her in the development of the activities of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Guldith N. Rodrguez pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Sra. De la Paz vive en la Regin San Martn, Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio est ubicado en la Av. Micaela Bastidas N 335, donde tambin se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes bodega. La oportunidad de un prstamo en el Banco Comunal le permite desarrollar este negocio y generar un ingreso para poder ayudar a sus padres, paralelo a este negocio es docente en un centro educativo local, y cuando est ausente su mam se responsabiliza del negocio.

Con el crdito de S/. 2,000.00 el cual ser pagado en 6 meses, comprar sacos de arroz, azcar, Kolynos, papel higinico, jabones en cajas y otros productos para surtir su bodega , asimismo productos para producir un poco de bocaditos que los expende en su negocio. La seora Guldith tiene 39 aos, vive con sus padres a quienes apoya en todo aspecto y quienes le ayudan en el desarrollo de las actividades del negocio.

loan.use: Purchase products to expand business and improve sales.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Maria Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Mara Edith Navarro P. is a member of the Banco Comunal, Manos Unidas, she lives in the Region of San Martn, Province of San Martn, District of Tarapoto, her address is Jr. Sinchi Roca No. 430, where she also runs a business of renting rooms. She also teaches at an educational center of the town. The opportunity of a loan from Manuela Ramos will allow her to improve the infrastructure of the rooms for rent so she can offer better service. Her entire family supports this business.

With the loan of S/.3,000.00 ($1,100.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase cement, paint for the finish and housecleaning products to improve the infrastructure of the rooms for rent. Doa Mara Edith is 44 years old, has 2 children and lives with her husband and one of the children. Her family supports her by taking care of the cleaning of the rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Mara Edith Navarro P. pertenece al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas vive en la Regin San Martn, Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio est ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca N 430 donde tambin presta servicios de alquiler de cuartos, negocio al que se dedica paralelo a prestar servicios como profesora en un centro educativo de la ciudad. La oportunidad de un prstamo en Manuela Ramos le permite seguir mejorando la infraestructura de los cuartos que alquila para prestar un mejor servicio. En este negocio la apoya toda su familia.

Con el crdito de S/. 3,000.00 el cual ser pagado en 6 meses, comprar cemento, pintura para los acabados y otros materiales de limpieza para mejorar la infraestructura de los cuartos que alquila. La seora Maria Edith tiene 44 aos, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su esposo y uno de ellos, tiene el apoyo de su familia en el desarrollo de su negocio en cuanto a la limpieza de los cuartos.

loan.use: Purchase cement, paint and other products for maintenance of rooms for rent.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nimia P. A. is a member of the Banco Comunal, Nuestra Sra. de la Paz, she lives in the Region of San Martn, Province of San Martn, District of Tarapoto, her address is Jr. Ulises Retegui No. 235, where her business of groceries general store also is located. The loans from Banco Comunal have allowed her to implement her business and keep growing. Her husband and son support her and they have plans to pack coffee beans for the next season.

With the loan of S/.800.00 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks, and other products to supply her store. Doa Nimia is 56 years old, lives with her husband and she has 2 children, one of them lives with his parents and her husband and son help her organize the tasks at home and at the business which allows her time for her personal affairs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Nimia P. A. pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Sra. de la Paz vive en la Regin San Martn, Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio est ubicado en el Jr. Ulises Retegui N 235, donde tambin se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes bodega. Los prstamos del Banco Comunal le han permitido implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo, es apoyada por su esposo e hijo y tiene previsto asimismo en el prximo ciclo envasar caf de cereales.

Con el crdito de S/. 800.00 el cual ser pagado en 6 meses, comprar sacos de arroz, azcar, papel higinico, gaseosas y otros productos para surtir. La seora Nimia tiene 56 aos, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, slo vive con uno de ellos, su esposo e hijo le ayudan a organizar las tareas del hogar y del negocio por lo que ella tiene tiempo tambin para hacer sus cosas personales fuera de casa.

loan.use: Purchase products to supply general store and increase sales.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Dora Lisbet

texts.en:
Dora Lisbet Fevres M. owns a general store that she runs with her daughter in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She started the store 10 years ago with the help of her husband who has recently passed away.
Dora is 50 years old, healthy, happy to have her store and work with her daughter. She loves socializing with her clients and building relationships. Dora will continue to invest in her business and make her clients happy.
A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Dora is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She would like to use the extra capital to buy sugar, rice, sodas and everything else that she sells at her store.

loan.use: She would like to use the extra capital to buy sugar, rice, sodas and everything else that she sells at her store.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Angel

texts.es:
Mr. Angel Ramon A. is from the city of Santan. He is 36 years old and married to Mrs. Marlene Vergara, who is 30 years old. They have their own home and 1 school age son.

Angel is the owner of a bread bakery called "Panadera Marle" , a business he started 4 years ago. He currently has 6 employees. He has built a clientele thanks to the quality of his products. Angel tells us that the business is quite profitable and generates good earnings. Every day he begins his work in the very early hours of the morning in order to be able to have fresh bread prepared first thing in the morning.

He sells his products to business in the area as well as to neighboring cities. The distribution of his products extends to cities as far as 40 minutes from his own.

Angel is applying for a loan that he wishes to invest in the purchase of ingredients in large quantities, since buying wholesale he will obtain better discounts from his vendors.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Seor ngel Ramn A., es de la ciudad de Santan, compaa Tacuara, tiene 36 aos de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Marlene Vergara, de 30 aos de edad, tienen casa propia y 1 hijo, en edad escolar.

ngel es propietario de una Panadera llamada PANADERIA MARLE y que lleva ya 4 aos de funcionamiento. Actualmente tiene 6 empleados, y posee una clientela formada gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. ngel nos cuenta que el negocio es bastante rentable y le genera buenos ingresos, todos los das empieza su labor a muy tempranas horas de la madrugada para poder tener el pan fresco a primeras horas de la maana.

El provee sus productos a comercios de la zona y adems a ciudades aledaas, el reparte sus productos, inclusive llega a ciudades que quedan a 40 minutos de su ciudad.

ngel solicita un crdito que desea invertirlo en su negocio para la compra de ingredientes en grandes cantidades, ya que comprando de este modo el obtiene mejores descuentos de sus proveedores.

loan.use: Purchase flour in large bundles, plus sugar, salt, anise, eggs and milk, among other ingredients.

loan.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Giovanni G. G. sells beer and sodas in the city of Pucallpa. She started her business two years ago and now has many loyal customers. Giovanni enjoys building relationships with her customers and making friends.

Giovanni is 31 years old and a single mother. Her husband left her a few years ago, and she was forced to find a way to take care of her son. She loves her business and saves carefully so she always has money to reinvest. Educating her child is the most important priority in her life.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Giovanni is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 6 months. She would use the loan to increase her stock of beer and soda.

loan.use: To increase her stock of beer and soda

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
Cayetano R. Daz is from the Ycua Pai neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 59 years old with 2 children who are now grown and living independently. His wife, Rogelia Toledo, is 58 years old. She assures us that the happiest man in the world is living by her side.

Cayetano owns a convenience store where he now has a well developed clientele made up largely of people from the neighborhood who come to his store looking for convenience items. He and his wife are beloved in the community and thanks to their good client service the local people prefer to buy what they need in Cayetano's store.

One of his largest projects is the expansion of the room where he sells his products. The expansion would allow him to stock his store with a wider variety of merchandise for sale, including books, which are difficult to find in the neighborhood and would sell well with the large number of students living there. Cayetano and Rogelia are very hardworking people and much loved in the neighborhood.

Cayetano already has a small amount of money saved and he hopes to fulfill his dream of adding books to the store next year. At the moment, he is requesting a loan with which to stock more merchandise, such as sugar, meat, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cayetano R. Daz es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai, es casado, con 59 aos de edad, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente, su esposa se llama Rogelia Toledo tiene 58 aos de edad y asegura que la vida al lado de ella lo hace el hombre ms feliz del mundo.

Cayetano posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, donde ya cuenta con una clientela formada especialmente por vecinos del barrio que todos los das acuden a su despensa en busca de artculos de primera necesidad. Son personas muy queridas en el barrio y gracias a su buena atencin la gente prefiere comprar en su negocio.

Uno de sus proyectos mas grandes es la de ampliar su saln comercial y as poder surtir de ms variedad de artculos para la venta como los de librera, ya que en la zona hace mucha falta, por la cantidad de estudiantes que hay. Son personas muy trabajadoras, y muy queridas en su barrio.

Cayetano ya tiene un pequeo dinero ahorrado y espera cumplir su sueo para el prximo ao, en esta ocasin, solicita un crdito para surtir de ms mercaderas para su despensa tales como: azcar, carne, lcteos, panificados, productos enlatados, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de limpieza, etc.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise such as meat, dairy products, baked good, canned goods, soft drinks, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel R. R. serves food and runs a general store from her home in a rural suburb of Pucallpa. Neighbors and friends come to her home to eat and drink on her beautiful porch. In the morning Isabel serves sandwiches and juices. At lunch time, she serves home cooked Peruvian meals. At night she has a grill and cooks steak, chicken, and cow heart.

Isabel is 55 years old, has 3 children and is married. Her children are grown, and she is more than happy to help care for her grandchildren. Isabel wants to continue to work hard, save money and invest in her businesses.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Isabel is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital, Isabel will buy ingredients for her restaurant and restock her shelves. These ingredients include sugar, oil, rice, milk, meat and much more.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant and restock her shelves

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Mr. Hernn G. Gonzlez is from Jejui - Chore, a neighbor city to Santan. He is 25 years old. He is the father of a beautiful boy and is married to Mrs. Carmen Figueredo Lpez, who is 22 years old.

Hernn is very hardworking young man. Since he was very young he has worked and saved; he bought his own home through his own effort. He owns a business where he sells CD's, MP3's, DVD's and VCD's. The store has been functioning for more than 2 years now; he runs it from a rented space. In addition to the store Hernn and his wife also run, in the same space, a dining room where they serve food to the workers in the area. His wife works with him and together this young couple is seeking to move themselve ahead.

They have many projects. Hernn is a very enterprising man eager to progress. Despite the fact that he was not able to finish his studies he looks to get ahead through his hard work.

Today they are requesting a loan which they will invest in the business, especially in beverages such as soft drinks, juices, dairy products, and beer, along with meat, eggs, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El seor Hernn G. Gonzlez es de Jejui Chore una ciudad vecina de Santan, l tiene 25 aos, es padre de un hermoso nio y esta casado con la seora Carmen Figueredo Lpez de 22 aos de edad.

Hernn es un joven hombre muy trabajador, desde muy pequeo ha trabajado y ahorrado y hoy da ya ha adquirido su casa con su propio esfuerzo. El posee un negocio de ventas de cds, Mp3, dvds y vcds, el local est funcionando hace ya ms de dos aos y es alquilado. Adems de ello tambin habilitaron en el mismo un comedor en donde dan de comer a gente trabajadora de la zona. Su esposa trabaja con el l y juntos esta pareja joven busca salir adelante.

Ellos tienen muchos proyectos, Hernn es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de progresar, a pesar de que no pudo culminar sus estudios el busca salir adelante con arduo trabajo.

Hoy ellos solicitan un crdito que lo invertirn en el negocio especialmente bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, lcteos, cerveza, carne, huevos, leche, entre otros.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, dairy products, beer, meat, eggs and milk, among others.

loan.name: Lidia Victoria

texts.en:
Lidia Victoria S. C. has a business selling chicken in the city of Pucallpa. Lidia wakes up at 1 a.m. go to a market and buy live chickens from farmers. She then takes her poultry to her stand were she prepares them to sell. She has been selling chicken for many years and has plenty of loyal customers.

Lidia is 40 years old, has 5 children and is happily married. She is happy to have the support of her husband, unlike many other working women in her neighborhood. She often works side by side with these women, who all save money so their children can have more opportunities than they had.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Lidia is requesting a loan of $450 to repay over 6 months. She would use the loan to buy more chicken each day.

loan.use: To buy more chicken on a daily basis

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela T. A. has a business selling beauty products door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. Her products include earrings, necklaces, bracelets, perfumes and more.

Adela is 40 years old, has 5 children, and is happily married. She loves her business and making her own money. She enjoys getting out of the house, building relationships, and helping people feel better about themselves. Adela is charismatic, hardworking, and now has many loyal customers.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Adela is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more of her best selling products.

loan.use: To buy more popular products for her door-to-door business

loan.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.en:
Elizabeth Angilea S. R. owns a restaurant in the city of Pucallpa. She serves tasty meals of regional, Creole, and oriental origins. She has run the restaurant for eight years and it is always packed during lunch.

Elizabeth is 54 years old and happily married. She has 3 grown children and one of her daughters helps run the restaurant. Elizabeth started the restaurant because she loves to cook and she wanted to help her husband by earning money. Elizabeth loves serving the people of Pucallpa and has made lots of friends at the restaurant.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Elizabeth would like a loan of $400 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy sugar, oil, bananas, rice, salt, potatoes, and condiments.

loan.use: To buy sugar, oil, bananas, rice, salt, potatoes, and condiments

loan.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris O. M. has a general store in the city of Pucallpa. From this store, which she runs in her home, she sells many popular products. She started the business two years ago after deciding to leave a market she had worked in for many years.

Iris is 43 years old with 5 children and is happily married. She loves her business, particularly because she gets to work from home and can be with her family. She is very social and loves building relationships with her customers.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Iris is requesting a loan of $400 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, oil, and much more.

loan.use: To buy products for a general store, including: rice, sugar, toilet paper, oil, and much more

loan.name: Victor

texts.es:
Mr. Victor R. is 45 years old and has 2 children. He is married to Mrs. Mara Augusta Martnez, who is 48. Victor owns a convenience store that has been in business for 10 years and thanks to his efforts and savings he now has his own business premises in a very good location.

His wife works in Copaco, the company responsible for the telephone service in Paraguay. Thanks to her good sense of responsibility she has been promoted to Head of Administration.

Victor feels very happy and satisfied with his family and his work. He says that thanks for his good earnings he can give a good education to his children. The family is already saving for the children's university studies. One of his future projects is the set-up of a butcher shop in his convenience store, which will allow him to increase his clientele by offering a full range of basic necessities in his store.

Today Victor is requesting a loan he will invest in the purchase of a variety of merchandise for the store such as: fruit, vegetables, eggs, canned good, baked good, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El seor Vctor R. tiene 45 aos, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, l est casado con la seora Mara Augusta Martnez de 48 aos de edad. Vctor es propietario de una despensa con 10 aos de funcionamiento y gracias a esfuerzos y ahorros ya posee un local propio con una muy buena ubicacin.

Su esposa trabaja en Copaco la entidad encargada de las lneas telefnicas de pas. Gracias a su gran sentido de responsabilidad ya la han a Jefa Administrativa.

Vctor se siente muy feliz y satisfecho con su familia y trabajo, dice que gracias a sus buenos ingresos pueden dar una buena educacin a sus hijos y ya estn ahorrando para los estudios universitarios de ellos. Uno de los futuros proyectos que tiene es la de habilitar una carnicera en su despensa, de este modo podr aumentar su clientela surtiendo de todo lo bsico en su negocio.

Hoy Vctor solicita un crdito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderas varias para la despensa como: frutas, vegetales, huevos, productos enlatados y de limpieza, panificados, gaseosas, etc.

loan.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, eggs, canned goods, cleaning products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc.

loan.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina T. K. has a business selling clothing door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. She sells underwear, shirts, and pants for all ages. Karina has many loyal customers; she uses a credit system so her customers can pay over a week or month. This credit system works well because many people get paid monthly.

Karina is 29 years old with 3 children and is happily married. She enjoys working, helping her family and earning money. Karina never had the opportunity to study, so sending her children to school is very important to her.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Karina is requesting a loan of $450 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more clothing from the local distributor

loan.use: To buy more clothing from the local distributor

loan.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is 32 years old and has one son who goes to school. He is married to Ramona Leon. Luis has been selling clothes for women and children in the area of Santan for the past three years. He has steady clients thanks to the competitive pricing of his merchandise.

With a lot of effort he was able to get his own home where he lives with his wife and children. In the future he would like to build a commercial space in his house where he could open a a store and also sell his clothes.

Luis has in the past requested loans and he has always maintained a good record on his payments. Now he wants to obtain a new loan with which he will be able to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, shoes, and underwear, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

El seor Luis tiene 32 aos, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, y esta casado con la seora Ramona Len. Luis se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y nios, en toda la zona de Santan, desde hace 3 aos y ya cuenta con una buena clientela formada, gracias a los buenos precios de sus mercaderas.

Con mucho esfuerzo logr tener su casa propia en donde vive con sus hijos y esposa. Tiene proyectado en el futuro construir un saln comercial en su casa para abrir una despensa y una ropera.

Luis ya ha solicitado crditos anteriormente y ha mantenido siempre una buena referencia en sus pagos, hoy el desea solicitar un nuevo crdito para poder comprar mercaderas como remeras, camisas, jeans, shorts, zapatos, ropa interior, entre otros.

loan.use: To buy merchandise for his business (clothes for women and children)

loan.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha P. O. has a business selling shoes and small gifts door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. She also has a grill and barbeques chicken, steak, and Juane to sell in the evening.

Martha is 45 years old with 2 children and is happily married. She loves working and helping her family and community. Her children are young and she wants them both to go to school so they can become professionals. She will continue to save and invest in her businesses.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Martha is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish, oil, and beans.

loan.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, oil, and beans

loan.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is 46 years old, married to Santiago Mendoza (47 years old), and living in the city of San Estanislao. Marta sells beverages in her house and her husband works agriculture.

The couple makes many sacrifices, they begin the day very early in the morning, preparing greens that the husband grew in order to sell them in the market. Marta has a store in her house where she sells cold beverages and some fast foods. She also sells candy and cigarrettes.

They are very happy and wish to move on with their business. However, they need to cover expenses (house and food). SHe wishes to add more things to her maket, this way she will be able to increase her sales. She wishes to purchaes a breadmaking machine, canned goods, sugar, mate, coffee, flour, eggs, meat, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Marta tiene 46 aos de edad, ella esta casada con Santiago Mendoza de 47 aos de edad y viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao. La seora Marta vende bebidas en su domicilio y su marido trabaja en la agricultura.

Esta pareja es muy sacrificada, ellos empiezan su da a tempranas horas de la madrugada, preparando hortalizas que el seor Santiago cosecha para ir al mercado juntos a venderlas mientras que Marta realiza sus compras para la casa y algunas mercaderas para su tienda. Marta tiene un tienda donde vende bebidas fras y algunas comidas rpidas as como tambin golosinas y cigarrillos.

Ellos son muy felices y desean seguir adelante con su trabajo pues gracias a ello tienen para cubrir los gastos de la casa y los alimentos. Marta desea habilitar una despensa en su tienda de bebidas, de este modo incrementar los ingresos en las ventas, entre las mercaderas a ser adquiridas podemos citar: panificados, productos enlatados, azcar, yerba mate, caf, aceite, harina, frutas, huevos, carne, etc.

loan.use: Purchase of beverages

loan.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T. V. runs a general store in the city of Pucallpa. She started the store a year ago and it has grown quickly. She has a good location in Market #3 and always serves her clients with a smile.

Raquel is 43 years old, has 2 children, and is happily married. She is very hard working and only sleeps for a few hours each night so that she has time to take care of her many responsibilities. After she closes her shop in the afternoon, she goes home to cook and sell grilled meats to her neighbors.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Raquel is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. Raquel will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, eggs, oil, and other popular products for her store.

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice, eggs, oil, and other popular products for her store

loan.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Mr. Paulino Q. is 35 years old and married to Mrs. Isadora Ortega, who is 31. They have 1 son and live in their own home in a neighborhood of the city of Santan.

Paulino is a multifaceted man. He works selling clothing together with his wife. She stays at home to sell the merchandise in the small store they have set up in their home while Paulino travels the neighborhoods offering his products. In addition to his sales work, Paulino is a teacher and director of a small local school where children, especially those with scarce resources who work during the day, attend night school.

Paulino says that despite being a humble man he aspires to instill in his students the idea and the example, through his own life, that those who want to get ahead can. Working and studying is a reality for many children in Paraguay who come from poor families and who from a very young age must learn to earn a living just to eat. He wants his country to generate more sources of work for older people. He desires with all his heart that Paraguay progresses so that two year old childen no longer have to beg in the streets and children from 4 years old no longer have to go out to sell sweets and wash windows when they ought to be learning and playing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El seor Paulino Q. tiene 35 aos de edad, esta casado con la seora Isidora Ortega de 31 aos de edad, tienen 1 hijo y viven en su casa propia en un barrio de la ciudad de Santan.

El seor Paulino es un hombre multifactico, se dedica a la venta de ropas junto con su esposa, ella queda en la casa a vender las mercaderas en una pequea tienda que tienen ah mientras que Paulino recorre los barrios ofreciendo sus productos. Adems de sus ventas, Paulino es docente y director de un pequeo colegio de la zona en donde acuden especialmente nios de escasos recursos y que trabajan por las maanas y por las noches acuden a la escuela.

Paulino dice que a pesar de ser un hombre humilde, el desea inculcar a sus alumnos el ejemplo del que quiere puede superarse, trabajar y estudiar es una realidad de muchos nios de nuestro pas, que provienen de familias muy humildes y desde temprana edad deben aprender a ganarse el pan.

Paulino se dedica a la venta de ropas hace mas de dos aos y desea seguir progresando en las mismas, hoy el solicita un crdito que lo ayudar a comprar mercaderas en mayores cantidades, esto a su vez le ayuda a obtener mejores descuentos por sus compras al por mayor.

El desea que su pas genere ms fuentes de trabajos a personas mayores, desea de corazn que el pas salga adelante para evitar que nios de dos aos estn pidiendo limosnas en las calles y nios desde los 4 aos tengan que salir a vender golosinas y limpiar vidrios cuando deberan estar aprendiendo y jugando.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Victor

texts.es:
Vctor Nez Molas is from the city of Santan. He owns his own home, acquired through working and saving money. Vctor is married to his wife, Mabel, who is 23 years old. Together they are parents of a child who is just one year old.

Vctor is a confectioner dedicated to the production of sweet and salty candies. He works mornings in a bakery in the city and in the afternoons he makes sweet and salty candies at home. Victor is very well-liked in his area, and has very good sales as his products are in demand. Every day he produces large quantities of candies and sweet breads, which he sells out completely throughout the day. Already 4 years ago he was able to establish a mini bakery in his house, but he wishes in the future to be able to build a retail store in his home to be able to offer his products in addition to other products for sale.

He is now asking for a credit to be able to buy ingredients to prepare his candies, including flour, leavening, flavorings, vanilla, allowed colorantes, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer.

EL Seor Vctor Nez Molas es de la ciudad de Santan tiene una casa propia que pudo adquirirla gracias a su trabajo y ahorro. Vctor es casado, su esposa se llama Mabel y tiene 23 aos, ambos son padres de un pequeo de tan solo un ao.

Vctor es confitero, el se dedica a la produccin de confites dulces y salados y trabaja por las maanas en una panadera de la ciudad y por las tardes se dedica a hacer confites dulces y salados en su casa. Es un hombre muy querido en la zona, tiene muy buenas ventas ya que son muy demandados sus productos, todos los das produce grandes cantidades de confites y panes dulces y son vendidos en su totalidad en el da. Hace ya 4 aos que pudo montar una mini panadera en su casa, pero desea en el futuro desea poder montar un saln comercial en su casa para poder ofrecer sus productos adems de otros productos de despensa.

El esta solicitando hoy da un crdito para poder comprar insumos para preparar sus confites como harina, levadura, aromatizantes, vainilla, colorantes permitidos, huevos, leche, azcar, etc.

loan.use: Expansion of Home

loan.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosala P. P. is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Seora de la Paz". She lives in the department of San Martn, San Martn province, Tarapoto district. Her business is located at her own house at Jr. Bolognesi #1726. For 27 years, she has sold perfume and cosmetic items of different brands, such as ESIKA, AVON, and UNIQUE, which she sells via catalog and special order. Her main customers are workers of public and private companies. With a loan of $725 USD which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy various items such as: perfumes, lotions, shampoo, soaps, makeup, deodorant, and other products of these brands which go on sale at this time of year. This way she can have items in stock and will be able to offer product variety and satisfy the preferences of her customers. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband, 3 independent children and 1 son which she still financially supports so he can reach his goal. For this reason, she works with much preserverance day in and day out. Her wish is to be able to have her own shop someday to sell her products from.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Rosala P. P., es socia del Banco Comunal Nuestra Seora de la Paz vive en el departamento de San Martn, provincia de San Martn, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa en el jr: Bolognesi N 1726. Se dedica hace 27 aos a la venta de artculos de perfumera y cosmticos de diferentes marcas como ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, que lo vende a travs de pedidos y por catalogo, siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones pblicas y privadas. Con el crdito de S/. 2000.00 que ser devuelto en 6 meses, comprar diversos artculos como : perfumes, cremas, champs, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos ms, de estas marcas que salen en ofertas en esta temporada para tener en stock y variar sus productos para as satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes Tiene 50 aos vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos independientes y 1 hijo que todava lo esta apoyando en lograr sus meta, razn por el que da a da trabaja con mucha perseverancia, su anhelando es poder tener su propio local propio para ofrecer sus productos.

loan.use: With the loan, she will buy more products to have in stock.

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42745

loan.name: Ursula Milagros

texts.es:
Mr. Ursula Milagros Lpez Ramrez is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Seora de la Paz". She lives in the region of San Martn, in the San Martn province, Tarapoto district. Her business is located on Jr. Huayna Cpac #328 and she provides telephone booth services and also sells beauty products. She started with the sale of beauty products, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she was able to make her business succeed. Today, she also provides a telephone booth service, which she receives much support for from her husband. With a loan of $375 USD, which will be paid in 6 months, she will enhance her telephone booth business with equipment such as: fixed telephones, timers, and booths to service the community out of her own house. Mrs. Ursula is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and works tiredlessly to see results and to feel productive in live. She has much potential in the future and is thinking about expanding her telephone booth business without abandoning the sale of beauty products on the side.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Ursula Milagros Lpez Ramrez es socia del Banco Comunal Nuestra Seora de la Paz, vive en la regin San Martn, provincia San Martn y distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio est ubicado en Jr: Huayna Cpac N 328 y se dedica a brindar servicio en un Locutorio y tambin vende productos de belleza.. Ella se inicio con la venta de productos de belleza, y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacin pudo sacar su negocio adelante ahora cuenta con un servicio de locutorio es su esposo quien la apoyo. Con crdito de S/. 1,000.00, el cual ser devuelto en 6 meses, implementara el negocio del locutorio con equipos como: telfonos fijos, controladores de tiempo, y cabinas, del mismo que esta al servicio de la comunidad y esta ubicada en su misma casa. La seora Ursula tiene 28 aos, vive con su esposo, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse til en la vida con muchas perspectivas en el futuro y ms adelante esta pensando ampliar su locutorio sin dejar de lado la venta de productos de belleza.

loan.use: With the loan, she will buy equipment for her business

loan.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor D. Maria H. D. D., a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Seora D. la Paz", lives at department and province of San Martn, Tarapoto district. She sells domestic animals from her home, located on Jr. Leoncio Prado # 629 in the same district. She started in the business through her daughter, who has encouraged her to get ahead to this day. With the loan of $1,100 USD which will be paid in 6 installments, she will purchase domestic animals (a male and new females) such as ducks, hens, and turkeys, balanced food for growing and putting on weight, and medicines to prevent animal sickness. Flor D. Maria is 69 years old, and has 5 dependent children. She considers herself a strong woman, able to confront whichever difficulty, and with a great attituD. to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Flor D. Maria H. D. D., es socia del Banco Comunal Nuestra Seora D. la Paz, vive en el Departamento, Provincia D. San Martn, Distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. animales domsticos en su misma vivienda ubicada en el Jr: Leoncio Prado N 629 del mismo distrito. Se inicio en el negocio por su hija, quien la impulso e incentivo a que siga adelante hasta el da D. hoy Con el prstamo D. 3000.00 que ser cancelado en 6 cuotas lo invertir en la compra D. animales domsticos (un macho y nueve hembras) D. patos, gallinas, pavos, comida balanceada para crecimiento y engorD. y medicinas para prevenir las enfermedades D. los animales. Flor D. Maria tiene 69 aos D. edad, con 5 hijos independientes, se considera una mujer fuerte, capaz D. enfrentar cualquier dificultad, y con buen animo D. seguir adelante.

loan.use: With the loan, she will buy animals to sell

loan.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Mrs. Zoila M. Ramrez is member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Seora de la Paz". She lives in the department and province of San Martn, Tarapoto district. She sells condiments of all varieties; her shop is located at market #2 Tarapoto. She started in this business since she was very young. She would bring products from her small farm (bananas, yuca, cilantro, orange) to sell. Today, she sells condiments and does very well. She feels proud of what she does. With the loan of $375 USD which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy cumin and whole black pepper (2.2 lbs daily of each), garlic, cilantro, peppers of various species, coffee (11 lbs weekly approximately). These products will then pass through a grinding process in order to sell bags according the quantities needed by her customers. In addition, she will buy spices in boxes and packages to sell by bulk. She is 67 years old and has 3 dependent children. She tends to this business because she enjoys it and she distracts herself with her customers. She has always been known to be strong, preserverant, calm, and a fighter.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Zoila M. Ramrez, es socia del Banco Comunal Nuestra Seora de la Paz, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn y Distrito de Tarapoto se dedica a la venta de condimentos de todas las variedades, su puesto se ubica en el mercado n 2 Tarapoto. Se inicio en el negocio desde muy pequea, traa productos de su chacra de pan llevar (pltano, yuca, cilantro, naranja) par venderlo, ahora vende condimentos y le va muy bien, se siente orgullosa de lo que hace. Con el prstamo de 1000.00, que ser devuelto en 6 meses comprara: cominos y pimienta en granos (1.0 Kg. .diario de cada uno ), ajos, cilantro, ajes de diversas especies, caf (5.0 Kg. aproximadamente semanal ), para luego estos productos pasar por un proceso de licuado y as poder vender al menudeo en bolsitas segn la necesidad de su clientela. Adems compra sazonadores en cajas y paquetes para vender al por menor. Tiene 67 aos de edad, con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y as se distrae con su clientela. Siempre se caracteriz por ser fuerte, perseverante, tranquila y luchadora.

loan.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para su venta

loan.name: Irma

texts.es:
Mrs. Irma Garca Torrejn is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Seora de la Paz". She lives in the department and province of San Martn, Tarapoto district. Her seamstress workshop is based out of her own home, located at Jr. Circunvalacin #2308 in the same district. She started this business 33 years ago along with her mother; she was her inspiration and the person who constantly motivated her to become independent and get ahead in order to provide the best for her family. With the loan of $550 USD which will be paid in 6 months, she will purchase: threads of various colors, good quality fabrics of various materials (cotton, licra, broadcloth, dracon) with many designs in meters and bolts to satisfy her demanding customers and provide good service. Currently, she is 48 years old and has 3 independent children. She considers herself a woman that is happy about what she has accomplished. In the future, she is thinking about selling clothing for children, men and women out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Irma Garca Torrejn es socia del Banco Comunal Nuestra Seora de la Paz, vive en Departamento, Provincia de San Martn y Distrito de Tarapoto, su taller de costura esta ubicado en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr: Circunvalacin N 2308 del mismo distrito. Se inicio hace 33 aos en el negocio junto con su mam que ella fue su inspiracin y el ser constante le motivo a independizarse y seguir adelante para dar lo mejor a su familia. Con el prstamo de 1500.00 que ser pagado en 6 cuotas, comprara: hilos de colores variados, telas de diferentes materiales: Algodn, licra, popelina, dacron, en variados diseos y de buena calidad en metros y fardos para satisfacer a su exigente clientela un buen servicio. Actualmente tiene 48 aos de edad, con 3 hijos independientes, se considera una mujer feliz de lo que ha logrado en futuro piensa poner en su propia casa venta de ropas para nios, caballeros y damas.

loan.use: With the loan, she will buy materials for her business

loan.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Mrs. Keyla P. S. is a member of the Banco Comunal "La Esperanza". She lives in the San Martn Region, province of Mariscal Cceres, district of Juanjui. Her business is located on her own home, at Jirn Tomas Aguirre N 661 Barrio La Merced (661 Jiron Tomas Aguirre, La Merced neighborhood). She owns a general store where she sell general merchandise, basic medicine, candy, and other everyday products.

She has been enjoying and dedicating herself to this business since very young together with her husband who used to batter her, so she decided to file for separation and start her own business, which is going very well.

With the loan that she is requesting S/. 3000.00, which she will return in 6 installments, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers, vinifan (book wrapping plastic), glue, tape, and notions merchandise such as thread, ribbon, tape, blond lace, and clothing goods such as polo shirts and pants.

Mrs. Keyla P. S. is 32 years old, has two daughters and one son, is persistent and very optimistic, and is eager to go on working and see her dream of her children becoming professionals and to be useful to society come true, so she come feel totally fulfilled as a mother, a woman, and a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La seora Keyla P. S. , es socia del Banco Comunal La Esperanza vive en la Regin San Martn ,provincia de Mariscal Cceres , distrito de Juanjui su negocio est ubicado en su propia casa situada en el Jirn Tomas Aguirre N 661 Barrio La Merced, tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, medicinas bsicas, huevos, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Desde muy joven le gusto y se dedico al negocio junto a su esposo quien la maltrataba constantemente, razn por lo que decide separarse e instalar sola su negocio en la que le va muy bien. Con el prstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual ser devuelto en 6 cuotas, lo invertir en la compra de tiles escolares como: cuadernos, lpices, lapiceros, borradores, vinifan,(plstico para forrar cuadernos) gomas para pegar, maskentape, asimismo artculos de pasamanera como hilos, cintas, blondas, y prendas de vestir especialmente polos y pantalones. Ella tiene 32 aos de edad, 03 hijos, 02 mujer y 01 varones, es perseverante y optimista, con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y ver cristalizado su anhelo de ver profesiones a sus hijos y tiles a la sociedad y ella verse realizada con madre, mujer y negociante

loan.use: With this loan she will purchase more merchandise for her business

loan.name: Pasanqueri Group

texts.es:
The Pasanqueri group works with the Pro-Mujer Villa Exaltacin focal group in the Villa Exaltacin area of El Alto.

This particular women's group is new and is in its 2nd cycle. All are very excited and happy to start their own businesses so that they can support their families. They all have large families and need to help their spouses with the household costs, especially since the majority of them have children who are old enough for school, but they do not have the money to give them a proper education.

There are several types of businesses within the group. For example, Don Carlitos has a public taxi service. Also, members sell clothing, condiments, produce, and cosmetics. They sell these goods retail, and have to purchase them wholesale in order to sell them as street vendors.

The entire group needs a larger loan to be able to get the products wholesale and, thus, expand their businesses and increase their profits. With these improvements, they will be able to support their families and pay the loans back quicker.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

EL GRUPO "PASANQUERI" TRABAJA CON EL CENTRO FOCAL DE "VILLA EXALTACION DE" PRO-MUJER HUBICADO EN UNA VILLA DEL MISMO NOMBRE, EN LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO .

ESTE PARTICULAR GRUPO DE SEORAS, ES UN GRUPO NUEVO CUMPLIENDO ASI SU SEGUNDO CICLO. TODAS MUY EMOCIONADAS Y FELICES DE EMPRENDER NEGOCIOS PROPIOS CON EL UNICO FIN DE SUSTENTAR SUS HOGARES YA QUE EN GENERAL TODOS CENTAN CON FAMILIAS NUMEROSAS Y NECESITAN APOYAR A SUS PAREJAS CON LA ECONOMIA DE SUS FAMILIAS, YA QUE LA MAYORIA TIENEN HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y NO LES ALCANZA EL DINERO PARA OFRECERLES UNA EDUCACION DIGNA

EXISTEN DISTINTAS ACTIVIDADES DENTRO LA ASOCIACION COMO POR EJEMPLO DON CARLITOS TIENE UN TAXI DE SERVICIO PUBLICO, ADEMAS EXISTE LA VENTA DE ROPA, CONDIMEMTOS, VERDURAS, FRUTAS, COSMETICOS QUE GENERALMENTE SE LAS REALIZA AL POR MENOR, TENIENDO QUE ADQUIRIR ESTOS DISTINTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR PARA PODER LUEGO OFRECERLOS DE MANERA AMBULANTE AL POR MENOR.

TODO EL GRUPO AFIRMA QUE NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA PODER ADQUIRIR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR ASI LOS NEGOCOS CRECERIAN Y SUS GANANCIAS SERIAN MAYORES DE ESTA FORMA PODRIAN SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS Y PARALELAMNETE PODER PAGAR LOS CREDITOS DE MANERA MAS RAPIDA,

loan.use:
The group has expressed that they need more loans to be able to acquire wholesale products.

EL GRUPO AFIRMA QUE NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA PODER ADQUIRIR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR

loan.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Exaltacin zone of the Villa Exaltacin region where Pro-Mujer is located, you will find the "Siempre Alegres" or Always Happy association. This name is right on the mark since the group was unanimously happy upon meeting each other. They also say they are always happy because Pro-Mujer offers them a huge help with the services they grant to their members.

With the help of the service consultant, Sonia Aguayo Zeballos, they have been able to make a very well organized group. The group includes several small businesses, such as stores. Others are street vendors that sell artisan chocolates and crafts. The majority of them sell clothing they bring from the Desaguedero where prices are better. Therefore, they need to invest more capital to make trips to Desaguedero or other places where wholesale goods are sold. In this manner, the merchandise acquired will result in greater profits to be reinvested in expanding their businesses.

Moreover, they need to increase their incomes to support their families. Doa Lupe's husband has passed away, and she needs to take care of her family. She and her four children are trying to improve their economic situation despite the difficult times they are going through.

This is the associations 3rd cycle, and they hope to keep counting on these or larger loans so that they, too, can grow.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

EN LA ZONA DE VILLA EXALTACION FUNCINA EN CENTRO FOCAL DEL MISMO NOMBRE QUE PRETENECE A PRO-MUJER SE ENCUENTRA LA ASOCIACION DENOMINADA "SIEMPRE ALEGRES" DENOMINACION MUY ACERTADA YA QUE EL GRUPO MOSTRO UNA ALEGRIA GENERAL AL CONOCERLOS. ALEGAN ADEMAS ESTAR SIEMPRE ALEGRES PORQUE PRO-MUJER LES BRINDA UNA GRAN AYUDA CON TODOS LOS SERVICIOS QUE BRINDA A SUS SOCIOS Y CON LA AYUDA DE SU ASOSORA DE SERVICIOS SONIA AGUAYO ZEBALLOS LOGRAN FORMAR UN GRUPO MUY BIEN ORGANIZADO EL GRUO TIENE DISINTO NEGOCOS PEQUEOS COMO SE TIENDAS, OTROS VENDEN DE MANERA AMBULANTE CHOCOATES ARTESANALES, ARTESANIAS PERO LA MAYORIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA QUE LA TRAEN DESDE LA LOCALIDAD DEL DESAGUADERO DONDE LA ENCUENTRAN A UN PRECIO MENOR, ESTO IMPLICA QUE DEMANDAN INVERTIR MAYOR CAPITAL PARA REALIZAR VIAJES AL DESAGUEDERO U OTROS LUGARES DONDE PUEDAN ADQUIRIR PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR, DE ESTA FORMA LA MERCADERIA ADQUIRIDA LES PROPORCIONARIA MEJORES INGRESOS QUE IRIAN DESTINADOS POR LO GENERAL AL CRECIMIENTO DE SUS NEGOCIOS. ADEMAS TAMBIEN LOGRAR MAYORES GANANCIAS PARA CONTRIBUIR CON LA MANUTENCION DE SUS FAMILIAS TAL ES EL CASO DE DOA LUPE QUE TUBO LA MALA SUERTE DE QUEDAR VIUDA Y TENER QUE TOMAR LAS RIENDAS DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA JUNTO A SUS 4 HIJOS EN INTENTAN TENER UNA MEJOR SITUACION ECONOMICA PESE A LA DIFICIL SITUACION QUE ESTAN ATRAVESANDO. LA ASOCIACION YA ESTA EN SU TERCER CICLO CON LA ESPERANZA DE QUE ESTOS CREDITOS SE MANTENGAN Y SOBRE TODO CRESCAN PARA ASI TAMBIEN ELLOS PODER CRECER

loan.use:
They need to invest more capital to make trips to the Desaguedero or other places where they can purchase products wholesale.

DEMANDAN INVERTIR MAYOR CAPITAL PARA REALIZAR VIAJES AL DESAGUEDERO U OTROS LUGARES DONDE PUEDAN ADQUIRIR PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR,

loan.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Obregn is a single man who began his business 4 years ago. He began selling seasonal clothes because his salary was not enough to support his personal needs. This way he always has some kind of money and doesn't have to wait 'till payday.

This business has worked out because he is able to provide work clothes, people know him and are confident to place their orders with him. He delivers good quality clothes on a timely manner. He gets clients through recommendations and some of these clients purchase with credit.

He requests a loan for $475 which he will pay back in two months. This money will be used to purchase seasonal clothes. WIth your help Juan will be able to increase his business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Obregn es un hombre soltero quien emprendi un negocio hace 4 aos la venta de ropa de temporada, ya que no alcanzaba a costear su gastos personales solo con su sueldo, de esta manera siempre cuenta con efectivo y no tiene que esperar a la quincena por un pago. El negocio le ha funcionado porque le permite ofrecer la ropa en el trabajo y hay personas que lo conocen y saben que pueden hacer sus pedidos con toda confianza ya que el se las entrega sin ningn problema, es decir, a tiempo y de buena calidad. De esa manera busca que sus clientes lo vayan recomendando con otras personas que paguen a tiempo y as les puede ofrecer crdito para que paguen en plazos.

El solicita un crdito por US $475 que pagara en 2 meses para surtir mercanca de temporada. Con tu contribucin Juan seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase of clothes

loan.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz M. is a hardworking woman who once divorced assumed all the responsabilities in the raising of her son. At that moment she started working on her own in order to obtain money to cover all of her daily expenses as well as her son's studies. She started her business more than 12 years ago, and during this time she has learnt that you have to try everything in order to obtain earnings. There were times when one product would not sell well, and then she would have to try to sell another product so that she would not depend on the sales of one product only. Currently she sells menudo (a traditional soup), sausages, and beauty supplies. That way she can ensure that she will always have work and it also helps her keep active. On top of all these activities she also works at a laundromat where she has the opportunity to get more clients for her products.

She requires a $750 loan which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and also beauty supplies . With your help Maria can keep on working.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Ma. de la Luz Martnez es una mujer trabajadora y ejemplar al divorciarse asumi sola las responsabilidades de su hijo fue entonces que empez a trabajar por su cuenta para poder obtener dinero y solventar los gastos de su casa y tambin los estudios de su hijo. Su negocio comenz hace ms de 12 aos y a lo largo de este tiempo ha aprendido que se tiene que intentar de todo para poder obtener ingresos. Haba ocasiones en que no se venda un producto y haba que intentar con otro para no depender de la venta de un solo producto. Actualmente vende menudo, chorizo y tambin ofrece productos de belleza, de esa manera siempre tiene trabajo y se mantiene activa. Adems de todas estas actividades trabaja en una lavandera donde tiene la oportunidad de buscar ms clientes

Requiere un crdito por US $750 que liquidara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca y tambin algunos pedidos de productos de belleza que tiene pendientes por surtir. Con tus contribuciones Mara podr seguir trabajando.

loan.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loan.name: Nora Eneida

texts.es:
Ms. Nora Snchez lives in an area of common land near to Victoria city, Tamaulipas, since there are no job opportunities for women other than housekeeping in the area where she lives. The economic situation is difficult, and that's why she decided to open her own business, since she didn't have money, is a single mom, and needs to maintain her child. After giving it some thought, she decided to work on her own. She started her business 5 years ago and she sells used clothing and novelties. She started with very little amount of merchandise that she sold to her friends, until she increased her list of customers. Thanks to this business she earned money for her child's schooling and for her home.

Ms. Snchez is currently asking for a loan of US $575 that she will return in 6 months. This loan will help her to purchase merchandise since she already sold all the merchandise that she had and wasn't able to purchase more due to the lack of resources. Please help Nora so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Nora Snchez ella vive en un ejido cercano a ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, debido a que no hay oportunidades de trabajo para la mujer mas que el de la casa, y la situacin econmica es difcil, por esta razn se decidi a iniciar su propio negocio ya que no tenia dinero y ella estaba sola con su hijo y entonces tenia que obtener dinero para mantenerlo. Despus de un tiempo de estar pensando que poda hacer para mejorar su situacin, hasta que un da se le ocurri trabajar por su cuenta. Su negocio comenz hace 5 aos se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y novedades, al principio inicio con poca mercanca vendiendo entre amigas y poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientela. Gracias a esto obtuvo dinero para los gastos de escuela de su hijo y de su casa.

Ahora solicita un crdito por US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses, este la va a ayudar a surtir mercanca ya que vendi toda la que tena y debido a la falta de recursos no ha podido surtir ms. Contribuye con Nora para que pueda continuar su negocio.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito L. is a married man with 7 children who worked for many years as a driver. This job forced him to leave his family for long periods of time in order to travel outside of the city. In order to avoid such long absences, he made the decision to start his own business, looking to work close to his family and become independent. His wife, his father-in-law, and his brothers-in-law all work in the making and selling of sweets. Little by little Agapito learned this trade and finally made the decision to begin working on his own. He struggled at first, but thanks to the support of his wife he was able to get ahead, and later his father-in-law gave a snack shop to Agapitos wife. Currently two of Agapitos daughters help with the business.

Agapito needs a loan of $950 US that he will repay in one month in order to restock merchandise and to install a booth in a well-known expo in his city. With your help Don Agapito will be able to continue providing for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agapito L. es un hombre casado y con 7 hijos trabajaba como chofer motivo por el cual sala fuera de la ciudad dejando mucho tiempo a su familia, fue por eso que tomo la decisin de empezar un negocio por si mismo, buscando trabajar cerca de su familia e independizarse; su esposa, suegro y cuados se dedican a la elaboracin y venta de dulces, poco a poco aprendi este oficio hasta que tomo la decisin de empezar por cuenta propia batallando al principio pero gracias al apoyo de su esposa pudo salir adelante, posteriormente su suegro le dejo un snack a su esposa. Actualmente 2 de sus hijas les ayudan en el negocio

El requiere un crdito por US $ 950 que pagara en 1 mes para surtir mercanca e instalar locales en una conocida expo de su ciudad. Con tu ayuda Don Agapito podr seguir beneficiando a su familia.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise and install a store in a market

loan.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan F. is dedicated to providing transportation services by taking children from their homes to school and back. He began the business because his income from his other work was not sufficient, so he saw the transportation service as an option for sustaining his family.

He started the business 10 years ago as a complementary activity that he worked at part time, and today he does it full-time. He provides transportation to various schools and now he has two vehicles.

He is asking for your support because he needs $375 US, that he will repay in 4 months, in order to pay for driving permits and for the maintenance of his vans. With your support, Juan will continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan F. se dedica a dar servicio de transporte a los nios de su casa a la escuela y viceversa lo inicio dado que con el sueldo que perciba de su trabajo no le alcanzaba, entonces vio como una opcin el servicio de transporte escolar para poder mantener a su familia. Empez hace 10 aos, como una actividad complementaria que realizaba de medio tiempo y hoy en da lo hace de tiempo completo, dando servicio a varias escuelas actualmente cuenta con dos unidades.

El solicita de sus contribuciones ya que requiere US $375 que esta dispuesto a liquidar en 4 meses para poder pagar los permisos y el mantenimiento de las camionetas. Con tu apoyo Juan seguir desarrollando su negocio.

loan.use: To maintain his vehicles

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mara Elena Rancel started her business in order to cover school expenses for her three children. She was also struggling to cover family expenses, since her husband does not earn a fixed income, and she felt the need to contribute to the family earnings. For these reasons she began to sell shoes via catalogue to her relatives more than two years ago.

Now she is asking for a loan of $575 US that will be repaid in 6 months in order to purchase seasonal shoes and to expand her inventory so that she can further increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara Elena R. emprendi su negocio dada la necesidad de solventar los gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos y adems de no completar con el gasto familiar debido a que su esposo no tiene un ingreso fijo y ella senta la necesidad de contribuir con estos gastos. Fue as como inicio con la venta zapatos por catalogo entre sus familiares hace mas de 2 aos.

Ahora solicita un crdito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de temporada y aumentar el inventario para con ello poder incrementar mis ventas

loan.use: To purchase shoes

loan.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
Mara Eva Gonzlez is a married woman with 2 children. She began her business 9 years ago upon her husbands retirement. They needed to do something in order to earn sufficient income since the pension of Evas husband was not going to cover their expenses. They needed to look for an alternative way to make a living. They decided to open a grocery store, and thanks to this action they have prospered.

Now they need a loan of $950 US that they will repay in 6 months. They will use the money to restock merchandise and to purchase new products that their clients have requested. With your help, Eva and her family will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara Eva Gonzlez es una mujer casada y con 2 hijos, iniciaron su negocio hace 9 aos al darse la jubilacin de su esposo ya que necesitaban hacer algo para poder tener ingresos suficientes, debido a que con la pensin que le iban a dar a su marido no les alcanzaba para solventar los gastos, y necesitaban buscar una alternativa para tener un ingreso. Fue as que decidieron poner una tienda de abarrotes, gracias a esta han ido prosperando.

Ahora requieren un crdito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercanca y nuevos productos que les han solicitado sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Eva y su familia saldrn adelante.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Monsivis began her business 12 years ago, almost by chance, when her oldest daughter refused to continue studying. Martha was looking for an activity that would help her daughter continue to grow so that she wouldnt waste time and would be occupied with something. Martha decided to sell chips and soft drinks out of her home. Little by little she has invested in the business and it has grown so that now she has a grocery store. It has become a family business, since her husband now helps Martha run it.

Martha is requesting a loan of $675 US that she will repay in four months in order to restock the store and thus to be able to continue growing and getting ahead. Lets help Martha and her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Monsivis empez su negocio hace mas de 12 aos de manera fortuita, cuando su hija mayor no quiso seguir estudiando entonces buscando una actividad en la que se pudiera desarrollar para que no perdiera el tiempo y se ocupara de algo, fue que decidi vender frituras y refrescos en su casa, poco a poco han invertido al negocio y lo han hecho crecer hasta tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual se convirti en un negocio familiar ya que su esposo le ayuda a atenderla.

Ahora solicita un crdito por US $675 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mercanca para la tienda, y poder seguir creciendo as como salir adelante. Ayudemos a Martha y su familia a seguir adelante

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo N. began his fruit and vegetable selling business when he was 15 years old. He started with a street stand selling only fruit after his father, still living, gave him the post as part of his inheritance. Ricardo took over his fathers entire business when he found out that his girlfriend, now his wife, was pregnant and Ricardo needed to find a way to take care of expenses and face the situation. Now he has four children, two of whom help him with the business.

Ricardo would like to have a larger store and a better supply of products. For this reason his is requesting a loan of $950 US that he will repay in 6 months. He will use the money to expand his business and to offer a larger variety of products to his clients. Lets help Ricardo move forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo N. inicio en el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras cuando tenia 15 aos, empez con un puesto en la avenida vendiendo solo fruta, cuando su papa le heredo en vida el puesto, tomo al 100% el negocio cuando se entero que su novia, ahora esposa estaba embarazada y tenia que encontrar la manera de solventar estos gastos y enfrentar la situacin. Actualmente tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos le ayudan en el negocio.

El desea tener un local mas grande y mejor surtido, por esto solicita un crdito de US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio y as ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Apoyemos a Ricardo para que siga adelante con su negocio.

loan.use: To remodel his store and to purchase merchandise

loan.name: Alegria De Villa Flores Group

texts.en:
Maria is a 22 year-old lady working hard to improve the lives of her two young children. She and her husband have had a hard time making ends meet in their community of Pantoja, an impoverished area on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She is excited about taking out this loan because she believes it could be the extra bit of help she needs to begin to really change things.

Maria runs a small business selling a variety of vegetables and fruits to her community members; she is taking this loan out because she wants to begin providing a better variety and higher quality of produce. Through the business-training classes she was required to take before requesting her loan, she learned about how to market products effectively, and how quality really does make a big difference in overall salesshe is very anxious to apply these new skills to her business.

She dreams of being able to grow her business in steps, first renting her own small store, and eventually having enough money to buy her own store. By taking these measure, she hopes to proviD. the means to send her two children to college so they can become educated and professional members of society. For herself, she dreams of growing intellectually, and to be not just a good business woman, but a great one.

If she has a few moments of free time, Maria loves to read, keep her house clean, and participate in a womens club in her community that works together to keep their children and youth educated about HIV/AIDS and other issues that pose health issues to them.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Maria herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loan.use: To purchase a wider variety of fresh fruits & vegetables

loan.name: Secretos De Damas Group

texts.en:
Monica is a 37 year-old woman living with her husband and six children in a small and impoverished community on the far outskirts of the Santo Domingo capital area. From her home and the streets, she sells used clothing to her community members; in fact, she is requesting this loan so that she can finally buy sufficient inventory to meet the demand she faces every week.

With the money from the loan, she plans to go to one of the major marketplaces in the capital to buy her used clothing at bulk. Doing this will increase her profit margin and decrease expenses incurred in trips and higher inventory costs.

Monica hopes that with the increased profit made possible by this loan, she can continue expanding and developing her business and eventually return to school to become better educated. She wants to make certain that her children always have enough to eat and will be able to stay in school instead of quitting to help make money for the family. It is also the family's dream to have enough money to buy their own home and land. Monica's personal goals are to advance herself as a businesswoman, friend, and leader in her community.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Monica herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loan.use: To invest in bundles of used clothing

loan.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.en:
Denise P. is the president of her Bank of Hope in the small community of Imbert, on the north coast of Puerto Plata. 28 years old, she is married with one child. Denise sells new clothing out of a small store, and takes pride in the fact that she sells good quality clothing. She attends a Baptist church in the area, and enjoys reading her Bible in her spare time. Her favorite foods are rice and chicken, but she also likes the ducles that people are famous for in the Dominican Republic. She hopes that one day she can buy a house and a car because it would make her life much easier.

This is the first loan that this community has applied for, and they are all very excited to improve and start their businesses. Many of the women in this bank are Haitian, and have come to the Dominican Republic in hopes of a better life and future. Esperanza hopes that every single one of these women will experience success and begin the process of lifting themselves out of poverty.

Oh behalf of this entire group, and Esperanza thank you for your continued support and generosity!

loan.use: To invest in new clothing.

loan.name: Banco Maranatha Group

texts.en:
Maria M. is a 44 year-old woman who lives with her husband, Israel, and her three children (ages: 19, 20, 22). She runs a small grocery store that provides staple items for her community such as rice, toilet paper, water, and candy. We asked Maria to tell us something about herself, and she told us that her favorite food is pork, and during her free time she loves going to church. She is a vivacious and active woman who is looking forward to the opportunity of improving her business and helping her children live better lives.

This will be the first loan for this bank of women, and they have already developed a strong community environment and interdependence. On behalf of these women and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for contributing to this loan!

loan.use: To purchase food staples and household goods.

loan.name: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Higinia is a gracious 47 year-old woman who lives with her three children (ages: 25, 14, 5) and her husband, Manuel Jesus Ramirez.. She has lived in Puerto Plata her entire life, and has been the proud owner of a small colmado for seven years now. She carries items such as rice, beans, candy, and beverages, supplying them to her entire community. With this loan she wants to acquire a more extensive inventory of items and improve the appearance of her shop. She says that she has learned a great deal from the preliminary training Esperaza provides, and wants to put this new knowledge to good use! Higina thanks God that she doesnt have any huge problems in her family right now, and hopes that soon she and her husband will be able to build themselves a home for their family to live in.

This will be the first loan for the community of Los Limones, and they are all very excited about this opportunity. The next six months will not only provide financial support, but also the opportunity for many of these women to become very good friends and maintain life-long relationships. On behalf of Esperanza and the women of Los Limones, thank you for your support!

loan.use: To purchase food supplies and store renovation materials

loan.name: Ni Ketut Hudiani

texts.id:
Hudiani is a mother of 2. Her husband is a seasonal farm worker who does not have a permanent income. Therefore she helps to get extra income by raising piglets at the backyard of her house.

She has 7 piglets now which she feeds every 09.00 am. She can earn up to IDR 3.5 million from a 6 month period (around USD 393). She uses this money to send her children to school and to support her family daily needs.

She wants to use the loan money to buy more piglets and to build a permanent hut that she can use as cage for the piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Hudiani memberi makan 7 ekor babi peliharaannya.Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya. Kandang bambu yang sederhana dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Hudiani memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimiliki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 7 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp.3.500.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan sangat menunjang kehidupannya.Untuk kedepannya Hudiani akan membuat kandang yang permanen agar babi yang dipelihara semakin banyak.

loan.use: To buy pig feed and to build hut (Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang)

loan.name: Thi Van's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyn Th Vn, 36 years old, married with two school age children, is a village cadre. The family farm and weave bamboo baskets and other bamboo products like fences, trays. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 ng, that would be paid back in 25 weeks, T. buy bamboo and T. invest in their business. She hopes that the loan would help the familys economy. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyn Th Phng, 40 years old, applies for a loan T. buy rice for noodle production.
  • T Th Hip, 42 years old, applies for a loan T. buy pigs.
  • Nguyn Th Thanh, 61 years old, applies for a loan T. buy young cows.
  • Nguyn Th Thu, 50 years old, applies for a loan T. buy fruits for her fruit stand.
  • C. Th B, 43 years old, applies for a loan T. feed for poultry.
  • C. Th Ninh, 51 years old, applies for a loan T. replenish her clothing shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Nguyn Th Vn, 36 tui, l cn b ph n a phng. Ch sng cng chng v 2 con ang i hc. Ngai lm rung, gia nh ch cn an lt cc dng c bng na, tre, c bit l cc loi gin, phn phc v cc h sn xut m, v a nem, min trong thn. Ch tham gia chng trnh vi mc vn 2006000 ng trong 25 tun mua tre, na an lt. Ch mong rng mn vay ny s gip ch tit kim hn, thc y kinh t gia nh ch pht trin hn. Trong nhm ch cn c cc thnh vin khc: Ch Nguyn Th Phng, 40 tui, vay 2006000 ng mua go lm m. Ch T Th Hip, 42 tui vay 2006000 ng mua ln. Ch Nguyn Th Thanh, 61 tui, vay 1534000 ng thm tin mua b. Ch Nguyn Th Thu, 50 tui, vay 2006000 ng mua hoa qu bn. Ch C. Th B, 43 tui, vay 2006000 ng mua cm nui g tht. Ch C. Th Ninh, 51 tui, vay 2006000 ng thm vn bun bn qun o.

loan.use: Invest in businesses

loan.name: Thi Du's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Th D, 37 years old, married with three school age children, is an industrious woman. The family farm, raise pigs and run a farming general store. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 ng to invest in their businesses. She hopes that the loan would help the familys economy. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trn Th Thng, 30 years old, applies for a loan to buy construction materials
  • L Th Sm, 28 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for her egg laying chickens
  • Trn Th Hng, 41 years old, applies for a loan to buy rice for her noodL. production
  • Trn Th Su, applies for a loan to buy rice for her noodL. production
  • V Th Thm, 22 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her husbands wood shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch C. Th D, 37 tui, l ngi ph n rt chm ch. Ch sng cng chng v 3 con u ang i hc. Gia nh ch khng ch lm rung, chn nui nhiu ln tht m cn l ch ca hng kinh doanh cc sn phm phc v nng nghip nh phn m, ln, kali... v cc loi thuc bo v thc vt. Ch vay 2006000 ng b sung vn bn hng. Ch hy vng vic kinh doanh ca gia nh ngy cng tt hn. Cc thnh vin khc trong nhm gm: Ch Trn Th Thng, 30 tui, vay 2006000 ng thm vn mua gch, si. Ch L Th Sm, 28 tui, vay 2006000 ng thm vn mua cm cho g trng. Ch Trn Th Hng, 41 tui, v ch Trn Th Su vay tin mua go lm m. Ch V Th Thm, 22 tui, vay 2006000 ng cho chng thm vn lm ngh mc.

loan.use: Invest in businesses

loan.name: Thi Hai's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyn Th Hi, 26 years old, married with a small child, tends a small drug store. Her husband is a carpenter. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 ng, thatd paid off in 25 weeks, T. invest in her store. Shes never had a loan before. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyn Th Hng, 22 years old, applies for a loan T. invest in her clothing shop
  • Trn Th Vui, 26 years old, applies for a loan T. buy pigs
  • T Th Sinh applies for a loan T. invest in her fruit stand
  • Trn Th Hng, 25 years old, applies for a loan T. buy bamboo for her weaving material
  • o Th Thnh, 23 years old, applies for a loan T. buy rice for her noodle production

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Nguyn Th Hi, 26 tui, c 1 con nh. Ch l ch ca hng thuc nh, ngai ra, ca hng ch cn bn mt s dng, m phm... Chng ch lm th mc. Ch vay vn mua thuc, mt s mt hng bn. Ch cha tng vay vn u, nay tham gia chng trnh v thch c tit kim tr gp hng tun. Cc ch cn li trong nhm ch u vay mc 2006000 ng trong 25 tun. Ch Nguyn Th Hng, 22 tui, vay vn bun bn qun o. Ch Trn Th Vui, 26 tui, vay vn mua ln. Ch T Th Sinh vay vn i ch hoa qu. Ch Trn Th Hng, 25 tui, vay mua tre na an lt. Ch o Th Thnh, 23 tui, vay mua go lm m.

loan.use: Invest in various businesses

loan.name: Sre Ompel Ii Group

texts.en: Mr. Song S. is the Village Bank President of Sre Ompel II Village Bank, which consists of 28 members in the Kandal Province. He is 46 years old and is a subsistence farmer who usually works on a rice field. He is married with eight children, three of whom are working while the others are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Srey NE. Chhom, is a housewife and she normally helps her husband work in the field. Because his family is very poor and because he has an insufficient number of farm equipment and draft animals, he is hereby requesting a loan to hire a laborer with draft animals to plow his rice field. With the remaining loan proceeds, he would buy fertilizer for the field.

loan.use: To hire a laborer with an animal to plow the rice field and to purchase fertilizer.

loan.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thi Xuan, 50 years old, is living with her 2 children (one of which is working, and the other one is still going T. school), her husband and her father-in-law.
