loan.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widowed mother of five children (two daughters and three sons). She prepares pastries and sells plastic containers of all sorts. She is also expanding into certain popular clothing items such as fancy scarves. The proceeds of the loan will help her to start building up her inventory of these clothing items. It is her hope that she can begin to save to help pay for her childrens school fees.
Ama is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To purchase scarves and other clothing items

loan.name: Tendo .

texts.en:
A. is married with three children. He has encountered so many challenges in life such as the death of his father and mother who were very supportive to him. This made him not continue his education. He decided to do farming where he raised some money to provide for himself and the family.

However, with farming he suffers the lack of farm input like manure and fertilizer. This made him join GHAPE. He has managed and repaid loans with GHAPE up to two times.

Given the new loan he plans to expand his vegetable gardening and cultivation of other crops. Also, he would like to add another business of animal rearing like fowls and pigs. He is the main supplier of vegetables and other fruit to his community and the local market. He plans to repay the loan in 18months. His first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loan.use: Buying of seedlings, Piglets and fowl

loan.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is the widowed mother of eight children and she has six grandchildren. Four of her children are still in school, while four of them have completed their schooling and are raising families. She wants to use the proceeds from her business to begin saving to build a house to support her grandchildren. Afia sells cloth, scarves, and saucepans. She travels to Tema, Ghanas major port town, to purchase her products and then returns to her village of Akom.
Afia is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy more saucepans and cloth

loan.name: Merri

texts.en:
Merri is 51 years old and a mother of five children. She has been selling cloths and ladies bags for 10 years in Obuasi. Her working capital was low and and so she was not been able to buy good quality cloths and bags in wholesale quantities. Merri got a loan from Sinapi and was able to purchase quality products for her customers. She now wants to use her new loan to buy more bags as her stock has run out and also to rent a store to stop hawking (carrying her items on her head to sell) since she is growing old.
Merri is a member of the group called Gold. The group uses peer pressure principle on their members to re-pay the loan on time.

loan.use: To buy more inventory and rent a store

loan.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is the mother of four children. For the past two years, she has also taken care of two primary schools as a matron. A matron provides meals to school children during their breaks. The proceeds of this loan will help Yaa buy supplies to prepare food. The profits from her business will help her with her childrens school fees.

Yaa is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy food supplies

loan.name: Bih

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Elisabeth was forced to get married at 15. She married a man who was five times older than her because her parents were unable to pay her fees and carter for her basic needs. While in her marital house, she successfully gave birth to ten children four of which are below the age of fifteen. She is faced with several problems like the inability to carter for her family, and unable to pay school fees for her children. The fact that she needed business capital, and worst of all the loss of her first son's death and living in an incomplete house made her join GHAPE. She has successfully obtained and repaid loans from GHAPE three times.

Given a new loan, she plans to buy rice, beans, salt and seedlings for retail. She thinks her business will succeed because she has been doing this business for so long. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement

loan.use: Purchase of rice, beans, salt and seedlings.

loan.name: Fama

texts.fr:
Fama T., married with one child and responsible for four other girls, has been a member of the village bank of Diaob for three and a half years. She would like a loan to buy rice, oil, jumbo (bouillon cubes), vegetables, and meat in order to continue her catering business that she has been managing for ten years. The income earned from her business enables her to improve her family's well-being. This loan will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Fama T., marie, avec 01 enfants et 04 autres filles en charge est membre du banc villageois de Diaob depuis trois ans et demi. Elle veut un prt pour acheter du riz, de lhuile, du jumbo, des lgumes et de la viande pour poursuivre son activit de restauration quelle mne depuis dix ans. Les revenus tirs de son activit lui permettent damliorer le bien tre familial. Ce prt sollicit sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.

loan.use: To buy rice, oil, jumbo, vegetables, and meat for her restaurant

loan.name: Oondivepa Group

texts.es:
The Oondivepa (A Guarani word that means All together) committee, was established by several neighbours from the Villa La Conquista suburb in the town of Nemby, which is a neighbouring town of Villa Elisa in which the Fundacin Paraguaya regional offices are found.

At the beginning, this group had some problems with a few members who didn't comply responsibly with the collective agreement for credits: today this difficulty has been totally overcome and the continuing members are very responsible in their repayments.

Despite these difficulties, they haven't lost their enthusiasm for the programme and the women say that they have taken all possible advantage of it and have learnt a lot about saving and marketing techniques which they have successfully implemented in their microbusinesses.

All the members of the committee are also microbusiness enterpreneurs and hardworking, enterprising women. They are also all mothers and housekeepers, a fact which serves to make them all closer. In the photograph, you can see all the members of the committee. All the members have their own activities, although some also have formal jobs and develop their businesses in their spare time in order to increase their incomes. The committee knows how to work in a team and in harmony and they have demonstrated these skills on every occasion when they have organized activities collectively to obtain extra income for their savings.

,p>They are asking for a credit to invest in their microbusinesses, among the merchandise to be purchased are: drinks, sugar, flour, milk, coffee, oil, mean, fruit, vegetables, snacks, articles for hairdressing such as shampoo, nail polish, clothes, coal, cleaning products etc.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Comit Oondivepa palabra en guaran que significa Todas Juntas se form a partir de la unin de varias vecinas del barrio Villa La Conquista de la ciudad de emby, esta ciudad es vecina de la ciudad de Villa Elisa en donde se encuentra localizada una de las oficinas regionales de Fundacin Paraguaya.

En un principio, este grupo tuvo algunas dificultades con algunas integrantes que no cumplan responsablemente con el compromiso solidario en los crditos, hoy da esta dificultad est totalmente superada y las integrantes que siguen son personas muy cumplidoras en sus pagos.

A pesar de las dificultades, no perdieron el entusiasmo en el programa ya que ellas cuentan que el mismo les ha sido de mucho provecho, han aprendido mucho sobre el ahorro y tcnicas de marketing que implementan exitosas en sus microempresas.

Todas las integrantes del comit adems de ser microempresarias y mujeres emprendedoras, tambin son madres y amas de casa, por lo que esto las une an ms. En la fotografa tomada, se encuentran todas las integrantes del comit. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. El comit sabe trabajar en equipo y en forma armoniosa esto se ha demostrado en todas las ocasiones en que organizaron actividades en conjunto para obtener ingresos extras en sus ahorros.

Ellas solicitan el crdito para invertir en sus microempresas, entre las mercaderas a ser compradas son: bebidas, azcar, harina, leche, caf, aceite, carne, frutas, verduras, golosinas, artculos para peluquera como shampoo, esmalte para uas, ropas, carbn, productos de limpieza, etc.

loan.use: Purchase drinks, sugar, flour, milk, coffee, oil, mean, fruit, vegetables, snacks, articles for hairdressing such as shampoo, nail polish, clothes, coal, cleaning products etc.

loan.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 34 years old and a mother of two children. Juliana was selling only eggs when she got a loan from Sinapi three years ago. Since then, she prepares and sells various Ghanaian dishes [including fufu and banku (starchy accompanients to stews and sauces), rice balls, boiled yams, and red-red (boiled beans with palm oil)] to workers in Obuasi.

Juliana wants to use her new loan to purchase more ingredients--fresh yams, beans, palm oil, ripe plantain, bags of rice and bags of maize--to prepare her dishes. She plans to move her work space from her house to a place in the business center.

Juliana is a member of the group called Nyame Nhyira (meaning Gods Blessing). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To purchase fresh yams, bags of beans, gallons of palm oil, bags of rice, bags of maize, etc.

loan.name: Alexandre Ampamagne

texts.fr:
Alexandre Ampamagne M. is a young man who started off in poultry farming; he is highly experience in this business; with added customers, he would like to build up his poultry farm and is therefore requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Alexandre Ampamagne M. est un jeune qui s' est lance dans l' aviculture ; il est tres experimente dans l' activite ; avec l' augmentation de ses clients , il veut renforcer son exploitation avicole et sollicite ainsi un prt.

loan.use: To buy chicks to bolster his poultry farm

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Ngum

texts.en:
Born in 1968, C. is married and has no children. She regrets the fact that she is not having a baby. The loss of her brother and uncle greatly put her in hardship since they were so supportive to her. During this period of great emotional and economic hardship she heard about GHAPE. She was determined to help her sisters and other family members. With the profit she made from her past EC activities, she bought some kitchen utensils for herself and also paid the fees of her sister's child whom she took upon to stay with them. Given a loan she plans to expand her hair dressing saloon and also do trading and mixed farming.

She will repay her loan in 24months and her first installment repayment shall be done from the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loan.use: Purchase of salon equipment and seedlings

loan.name: Epifania's Group

texts.es:
Amanda, Silvia and Epifania have belonged to the Community Bank Despertar (Wake up!) for 8 months, 1 year and 1 year again respectively.

Amanda is married, she is 40 years old and has two children. Amanda sells food as an ambulatory seller in Nery Garcia Zarate market.

On the other hand Silvia is a co-habitee: she is 23 years old and has one son aged 4. Silvia, together with her partner, works as a walking salesperson selling sweatsuits in Santa Clara market: she buys her merchandise in Lima.

Meanwhile Epifania is a widow, she is sixty years old and has 4 children. Epifania sells wood from her house, a product which she acquires from people who deliver it to her house.

Amanda, Silvia and Epifania need loans of 600, 100 and 600 soles respectively, money which will be invested in the purchase of plates, larger pots, tracksuits, coats and wood.

The dreams of Amanda, Silvia and Epifania are to see their children become professionals, to improve their economic situation and to own a grocery store and build a house.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Amanda, Silvia y Epifana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 8 meses, 1 ao, 1 ao respectivamente.

Amanda es casada, tiene 40 aos y 2 hijos, Amanda vende comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery Garca Zarate.

Por otro lado Silvia es conviviente, tiene 23 aos y 1 hijo de 4 aos, Silvia junto a su esposo venden buzos de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, su mercadera lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Epifana es viuda, tiene 60 aos y 4 hijos, Epifana vende lea en su casa, producto que adquiere de personas que reparten a domicilio.

Amanda, Silvia y Epifana necesitan prstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de platos, ollas mas grandes, buzos, casacas y lea.

Los sueos de Amanda, Silvia y Epifana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su economa, tener una tienda de abarrotes y construir su casa.

loan.use: Amanda, Silvia y Epifana need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of plates, larger pots, tracksuits, coats and wood.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 44 years old and the mother of five children, all of whom are currently in school. She has been preparing and selling doughnuts to school children and her community folks for four years now. Florence fries her doughnuts from 5:30am to 8:00am for her customers. She then hawks (carries her goods on her head to sell) her pastry.

Florence wants to use her new loan to buy pastry flour, vegetable oil and spices to expand her operation.

Florence is a member of the trust group called Gold. Group members agree to guarantee for each other in re-paying the loan on time.

loan.use: To buy bakery ingredients.

loan.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is the mother of four children. She hawks (sells) cloth and blankets in the main market in Obuasi, as well as the surrounding community markets. Adwoa is requesting a loan to help buy more inventory as well as expand her stock to include both men's and womens clothing. Adwoa would like to use the profits from her business to start saving for her childrens school fees and for housekeeping purposes.

Adwoa is a member of the trust group Exodus. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy more inventory

loan.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 28 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She has been preparing and selling corn dough (prepared from maize and used in preparing kenkey, banku and porridge) and maize to her community folks for the past three and a half years. Fatis working capital is very small and therefore she wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of maize for the lean season. She plans to start saving for her childrens school fees.

Fati is a member of the trust group called Gold. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To purchase more bags of maize.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the mother of three children and grandmother of seven grandchildren. She has been selling maize, rice, palm nuts, bananas and charcoal for 10 years. With her loan, Mary hopes to begin buying maize and rice in larger quantities to avoid buying on credit and to guard against price inflation. In addition to using the profits of her business to expand her operations, she also wants to use the profits to begin saving for her grandchildrens school fees.

Mary is a member of the trust group Exodus. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy maize and rice in large quantities

loan.name: Jaharatu

texts.en:
Jaharatu is the mother of four children. Two are grown and out of school, while two remain in school. Jaharatu has been operating a stand in Akaporiso market for 13 years. She sells beans, maize and seeds from her stand. She buys the beans from Northern Ghana. This loan will finance the purchase of more beans as well as the travel costs to the North. The profits from her business are used to help with her childrens school fees.

Jaharatu is a member of the trust group Exodus. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy beans from Northern Ghana

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is the mother of seven children. She has been selling various items in Obuasi for the last three years. In addition to selling gari (fried cassava), cassava, and soda, she makes a type of strong laundry soap called Azuma Blow. (Azuma is the name of a famous Ghanaian boxer whose punches are legendary for their strength, hence an appropriate name for a laundry soap.)

Margaret plans to use the loan to buy additional products in Kumasi, the nearby large town. She will use the profits from her business to help pay for her childrens school fees.

Margaret is a member of the trust group Exodus. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy gari, cassava, and soda in Kumasi

loan.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara is forty years old and a widow with four children. She has been selling tomatoes, tilapia, onions, eggs, spices and maize for five years now. She has low working capital and sells from a table top.

Ajara wants to use her new loan to buy bags of maize, crates of eggs, crates of tomatoes and some spices to avoid price hikes during the lean season. She also wants to buy more tubers of fresh yams from the northern part of Ghana since she has run out of stock.

Ajara is a member of the group called Gold. The members use peer pressure to ensure repayment of the loan on time.

loan.use: To buy more foods for sale.

loan.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is the mother of two children. She operates a general store in the Akomprom area of Obuasi. She is a long-term (10-year) client with Sinapi and has been fortunate enough to build her own store, pictured here. Akua is now requesting an additional loan to expand her inventory of canned products and maintain her profits. She plans to use the profits from her business as a form of insurance in case she has trouble with repayments.
Akua is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy more canned products

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42886

loan.name: Aida Argentina

texts.en:
Aida Argentina is an elderly woman responsible for supporting her husband and two unemployed children. Shes a very active and many-sided businesswoman. Currently, Aida is operating a general store where people can get products such as sugar, boiled beans, ground corn, and some juices and alcoholic drinks.

Aida explains that her age cant be a barrier for her to do business. She explains that with her loan, shell buy many products that are running low in the store in order to keep satisfying her customers needs. Aida wants to maintain a comfortable life for her family.

loan.use: To acquire products in order to supply a grocery store.

loan.name: Migdonio

texts.es:
Migdonio V. is 49 years old and is a very active person. He is married to Adolfina Arias, who is also the housekeeper. The marriage has produced two sons, one aged 25 and the other aged 22 years, who from an early age learnt to be responsible as Migdonio always instilled this in them: they always helped their father in the workshop he owns and today the elder of his sons still works as a technician in the mechanic's area of a national petrol company.

Migdonio is very proud of his sons because they study and work, he remembers that when he was a teenager he came from a small village in the interior of the country looking for better opportunities. He worked for several years as an employee in a company and then after saving for several years he was able to open his own mechanic's workshop for vehicles in his house.

For a few years, Mogdonio closed his workshop and travelled to Argentina to work there as he had been offered an excellent job. For five years he lived and worked in Argentina and he returned to Paraguay with a good amount of money saved which today is being used to pay for his sons' university studies.

Today Migdonio continues to work in his mechanic's workshop and he is asking for a credit to invest in improving the infrastructure in the workshop.

The credits which the Foundation had previously authorised were used to acquire work tools, for which Migdonio is very grateful for the support given to the business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Migdonio V. tiene 49 aos, es una persona muy activa, l esta casado con la seora Adolfina Arias, la misma es ama de casa. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de 25 aos y el otro de 22 aos, los dos desde pequeos aprendieron a ser responsables pues Migdonio siempre les inculco ; ambos ayudaron siempre a su padre en el taller que l posee y hoy da el hijo mayor ya trabaja como tcnico en el rea automotriz en una empresa petrolera del pas.

Migdonio esta muy orgulloso de sus hijos porque estudian y trabajan, recuerda que cuando l era adolescente vino de un pueblo pequeo del interior del pas a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades. Trabajo como empleado varios aos en una empresa y luego de ahorrar por varios aos logr montar su propio taller mecnico para vehculos en su casa.

Durante unos aos, Migdonio cerr su taller pues viajo a la Argentina a trabajar luego de que se le presentara una excelente propuesta de trabajo. Durante cinco aos vivi y trabajo en Argentina y volvi a Paraguay con un buen dinero ahorrado que hoy da sirve para costear los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.

Hoy da Migdonio sigue trabajando en su taller y solicita un crdito para invertirlo en el mismo especialmente en la mejora de la infraestructura de su taller.

Los credito que le fueron otorgando la Fundacion fueron para adquirir herramientas de trabajo, el cual menciona su agradecimiento por la ayuda obtenida a la Empresa.

loan.use: Improve the workshop's infrastructure

loan.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
The Committee Responsible Women was established by several neighbours from the Villa Bonita suburb of the town of Villa Elisa. Its members are hardworking and enterprising women for despite being mothers, wives and in some cases having a formal job, develop their microbusinesses with the aim of obtaining extra income to help their husbands with the household expenses.

Among the activities they are developing we can name: clothes-sales, fruits and vegetables, kiosks, tailoring, some are recyclers, others sell chipa (a traditional Paraguayan food made from a base of starch, milk, cheese and egg), others sell fast food and others sweets and cakes.

In the photograph there are 17 members of the committee. The committee's relationship are harmonious, they are responsible in their payments, among other things in order to improve savings.

They want to continue developing the committee programme which Fundacin Paraguaya has devised as this has been a great help for them, both economically and personally, as the training courses which they organize have permitted them to improve their knowledge of sales, marketing, saving, budget-making etc. To begin a new cycle the women need a new credit to invest in their businesses, purchasing merchandise for their sales, ingredients to prepare their foods and some utensils or tools which they need to carry-out these labours.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Comit Mujeres Responsables se form a partir de la unin de vecinas del barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, sus integrantes son mujeres emprendedoras que a pesar de ser madres, esposas y en algunos casos posee un trabajo formal, desarrollan sus microempresas con la finalidad de obtener un ingreso extra para ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos de la casa.

Entre las actividades que desarrollan nombramos: venta de ropas, frutas y verduras, kioscos, costureras, algunas son recicladoras, otras venden chipa (una comida tradicional de Paraguay hecha a base de almidn, leche, queso y huevo), otras venden comidas rpidas y otras dulces y tortas.

En la fotografa tomada se encuentran las 17 integrantes del comit. El comit lleva una armoniosa relacin entre ellas, son responsables en sus pagos y se organizan siempre para realizar actividades juntas como hamburgueseadas, ferias de comidas, entre otras cosas para aumentar el ahorro.

Ellas desean continuar desarrollando el programa del comit que desarrolla la Fundacin Paraguaya pues para ellas es un gran apoyo, tanto econmico como personal, ya que las capacitaciones que se dictan les permite mejorar sus conocimientos en las ventas, el marketing, el ahorro, elaboracin de presupuestos, entre otras cosas. Para empezar un nuevo ciclo ellas necesitan un crdito nuevo para invertirlo en sus negocios comprando mercaderas para sus ventas, ingredientes para preparar sus comidas y algunos utensilios o herramientas que necesitan para desarrollar su labor.

loan.use: Compra de: carnes, bebidas, aceite, harina, golosinas, productos enlatados, arroz, pastas, huevo, queso, artculos para la casa, hilos, telas, botellas de plsticos, cartones, latas, etc. Purchase of : meats, drinks, oil, flour, snacks, canned products, rice, pasta, egg, cheese, household articles, threads, cloths, plastic bottles, cartons, tins etc.

loan.name: Madina NabakaS Group

texts.en:
Madina N., age 27, is the leader of this group. Madina is married with three children, ages3, 7, and 8. Two children are in school but at times she faces a challenge meeting their school fees.

Madina runs a small hotel in Nakulabye, a suburb outside of Kampala, where she also sells food. Her clients are mainly Boda-Boda cyclists, builders, and taxi drivers. Madina's main challenges in her hotel business are heavy rains that lead to the roof leaking, and too much demand for her services that she cannot fill, and limited capital. The loan will enable Madina to buy scholastic material for her children, pay hotel rent, provide a good diet for her family, and expand her business.

loan.use: Buy food to sell at the local hotel

loan.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, 38 years old, is very active and enterprising. She is married to Nicols Mora and together they have five school-aged children.
Norma recalls that, due to scarcity of work, she decided to help her husband with the familys finances. For the past three years she has dedicated herself to the sale of clothing, notions, and cosmetics throughout her neighborhood as working nearby makes it easier to continue to care for her children.
The credits obtained through the foundation helped her purchase more merchandise and augment her sales which, in turn, created better revenue. Her friends admire her greatly given she is a dedicated mother and wife, in addition to being good at sales.
Today she seeks a new loan to be able to buy a lot of merchandise that her suppliers offered her at a good price and she wishes to take advantage of this opportunity; in this way, she can offer her wares at competitive prices without affecting her returns.
Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.
Norma tiene 38 aos, es una persona muy activa y emprendedora, ella est casada con Nicols Mora. El matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, todos menores de edad, dos de ellos van recin a la escuela.
Norma cuenta que debido a la escasez de trabajo, ella decidi ayudar a su esposo con la economa familiar y desde hace 3 aos se dedica a la venta de ropas, merceras y cosmticos en forma independiente recorriendo el barrio de su casa, ya que tampoco desea abandonar a sus hijos y trabajando cerca de la casa le resulta ms fcil.
Los crditos obtenidos con la fundacin le ayudaron a comprar ms mercaderas y aumentar el volumen de ventas y con ello mejorar sus ingresos. Sus amigas la admiran bastante ya que Norma es una madre y esposa muy dedicada, adems de ser muy buena vendedora.
Hoy ella solicita un nuevo crdito para poder adquirir un lote de mercaderas que sus proveedores le ofertaron a buen precio y desea aprovecharlo; de este modo ella podr ofrecer buenos precios sin afectar sus ganancias.

loan.use: Notions and cosmetics.

loan.name: Juan Alonso

texts.es:
Juan Alonso G. set up a business to bring in more income since his wife is currently pregnant and he is father of two adolescent children. However, his wife was diagnosed with a high risk pregnancy, which requires them to be prepared financially given her health conditions. He has a grocery store and his 2 children help him out there.

Currently, he needs financial support of $950 which he will pay back in 6 months to buy more inventory, so he can attract larger customers. Since he lives in an area with tourist attractions, he is going to take advantage of coming vacation season to increase his sales. Juan can materialize his goals with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Juan Alonso G. emprendi un negocio para incrementar sus ingresos ya que el es padre de familia de dos adolescente y actualmente su esposa esta embaraza, pero desafortunadamente el embarazo de ella esta diagnosticado como de alto riesgo por lo requiere prepararse econmicamente por los problemas que se puedan presentar debido a la condicin de su mujer. El tiene un atienda de abarrotes la cual sus 2 hijos le ayudan a atender.

Actualmente el requiere un apoyo econmico por US $ 950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca y as poder atraer mayores clientes, as como aprovechar las prximas vacaciones para incrementar sus ventas ya que su municipio tiene diferentes atractivos tursticos. Con tu ayuda Juan podr concretar sus metas.

loan.use: buy merchandise

loan.name: Alma Gloria

texts.es:
Alma Gloria Dvalos is an exemplary and enterprising woman from the municipality of Garca, Nuevo Len. She has four children who are now grown and married, 40, 39, 36 and 32 years old.

After her divorce, Alma was left without a means of income given that her children do not support her financially. She was also responsible for her own mothers care, which requires income given that she has been infirm of late. Due to all this, she needed to start an enterprise that would generate substantial income to be able to cover her financial obligations. Thus, she began to sell American clothing which she purchases in packs so she can achieve greater profit upon resale.

She currently seeks a loan of $950USD to be repaid over a period of six months. She would invest in merchandise to be able to continue in her activities. With your help, Alma will be able to care for her mother as well as have an income on which to live on.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Gloria Dvalos, es una mujer emprendedora y ejemplar del municipio de Garca, Nuevo Len, tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya estn casados y son mayores, tienen 40, 39 ,36 Y32 aos.

Despus de su divorcio, Alma quedo sin un sustento econmico, ya que sus hijos no la apoyan econmicamente y adems de esto ella se hace cargo del cuidado de su madre as como de los gastos que generan darle atencin medica, ya que ha estado enferma ltimamente. Debido a todo esto ella necesitaba tener una actividad que le generara buenos ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos. Fue as que se inicio en la venta de ropa americana la cual compra por pacas y as puede obtener mayor ganancia al revenderla.

Ahora requiere un crdito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercanca y poder continuar con esta actividad. Con tu ayuda Alma podr seguir cuidando de su madre as como tener un ingreso para vivir.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Salustio

texts.es:
Salustio F. is and active and enterprising 64 year old. He lives with his wife, Leonarda Gimenez, and two grown daughters. Both his daughters work at the national hospital of Itaga, one of the largest in the country. Salustio is very proud of his daughters because, despite coming from such a humble family, they have not left their studies or stopped working in order to get ahead and help their parents.

Salustio devotes himself to the sale of charcoal and, as a result of his earnings from this activity as well as some loans, he was able to open a store in his home that his wife can manage and obtain additional income for the family. He reports to us that when he lost his job, the Fundacin Paraguaya was the only entity that granted him credit to start his small business. They provided help despite his inability to supply references or show evidence of a fixed source of income.

His general store is called San Cateyano (Saint Cateyano) who is their patron saint of abundance and work. They began by selling merchandise such as soda, beer, wine and whiskey. Later, they added to this baked goods, herbs, sugar, sweets, rice and noodles, among other items.

Salustio has not been able to carry out his charcoal selling activities over the last month because he is suffering from an infirmity that doesnt allow him to focus 100% on this effort. For this reason he wants to reinforce his sales at the general store as these are, for the moment, the primary means of income for the family other than the daughters small salaries which cannot support them.

The loan he is seeking would be used to better supply the store, since the neighbors in the area request certain types of products such as canned goods, cleaning supplies, meat, and fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Salustio F. tiene 64 aos, es una persona muy activa y emprendedora, vive con su esposa Leonarda Gimnez, y su dos hijas las cuales ya son mayores de edad, ambas trabajan en el Hospital Nacional de Itaga, uno de los ms grandes hospitales del Pas. Salustio se siente orgulloso de sus hijas, pues a pesar de que la familia es muy humilde ellas no han dejado de estudiar y trabajar para salir adelante y ayudar a sus padres.

Salustio se dedica a la venta de carbn y de las ganancias que le ha generado esta actividad ms algunos crditos tambin pudo montar una despensa en su hogar para que su esposa lo pueda administrar y obtener mayores ingresos a la familia. Cuenta que cuando quedo sin trabajo, la Fundacin Paraguaya fue la nica entidad que le otorgo los crditos para empezar su microempresa, ya que el no contaba con referencias ni ingresos fijos.

Su despensa lleva por nombre San Cayetano que es el santo patrono de la abundancia y el trabajo. Empezaron vendiendo mercaderas como gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, whiskys, luego fue agregando la venta de panificado, yerba, azcar, golosinas, arroz, fideos entre otros.

Salustiano no ha podido cumplir con sus ventas de carbn en el ltimo mes pues padece de una enfermedad que no le permite el 100% en la atencin de sus ventas y repartos de carbn. Por ello desean reforzar sus ventas de la despensa ya que es por el momento la principal fuente de ingresos de la familia adems del salario de sus hijas pero que no alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos de la casa y medicamentos del padre.

El crdito que solicita lo utilizar para surtir mejor sus mercaderas en la despensa, ya que los vecinos de la zona ya le solicitaron ciertas mercaderas que ellos desean como productos enlatados, artculos de limpieza para el hogar, carne, frutas y verduras.

loan.use: Purchase drinks such as soda, beer, wine, whiskey, as well as candy, charcoal, cookies, sugar and herbs.

loan.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
This committee has as its name Mujeres Trabajadoras (Hard-Working Women), and was formed thanks to the coming together of several enterprising ladies from the city of Ypan. This city is about 30 minutes from Villa Elisa, which is where the regional offices of Fundacin Paraguaya are located.

Mujeres Trabajadoras is one of the highest-qualifying groups in that citys offices; its members are very responsible and organized. All of the women are married and, despite having to fill the roles of both homemakers and mothers, they also manage their small businesses to earn additional income for their families.

They also conduct activities to increase their savings, and to help out any group members who may need assistance due to sickness or other challenges. A few months ago, the son of one member fell gravely ill and required very expensive medications. The group members decided to support her, helping to buy the needed medicines out of their own savings.

Fourteen of the seventeen total members can be found in the photograph taken of the group. They dedicate themselves to sales of items such as food/meals, natural remedies, beef, desserts and candy, poultry, metal crafts and charcoal.

They would like to obtain a loan to be able to invest in their small businesses, purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools for their activities as well as ingredients for their food preparation needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comit lleva por nombre Mujeres Trabajadoras, la misma se formo gracias a la unin de varias mujeres emprendedoras del 29 de Agosto de la ciudad de Ypan, esta ciudad queda a menos de 30 minutos de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, lugar en donde esta una de las oficinas regionales de la Fundacin Paraguaya.

Mujeres Trabajadoras es uno de los comits con mejor calificacin en la oficina de esa ciudad, las seoras son mujeres muy responsables y organizadas. Todas son mujeres casadas que a pesar de tener que cumplir con su rol de amas de casa y madres, tambin manejan sus microempresas para poder generar mayores ingresos en sus hogares.

Ellas adems realizan actividades para incrementar sus ahorros, tambin para ayudar a alguna de las integrantes que necesite en caso de enfermedad o alguna otra cosa. Hace unos meses el hijo de una de las integrantes estuvo gravemente enfermo y los medicamentos eran muy caros, por los que todas decidieron ayudarla y fueron solidarias con ella, comprndole los medicamentos con el ahorro que juntaron todas.

En la fotografa tomada, se encuentran las 14 de las 17 integrantes que conforman este comit. Ellas se dedican a los siguientes rubros: venta de comidas, despensas, venta de remedios naturales, venta de carnes, venta de tortas y dulces, venta de pollos, venta de artesanas en metales, venta de carbn, y venta de carbn.

Ellas desean adquirir un nuevo crdito para poder invertirlos en sus microempresas, comprando mercaderas para sus ventas, insumos y herramientas para realizar sus actividades e ingredientes para elaborar sus comidas.

loan.use: Purchase of meats, sugar, rice, vegetables, cheese, eggs, oil, noodles, charcoal, clothes, etc.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doa Juana is a very responsible mother of two children. Since she was young she has had to face many adversities in her life, and until now, with great diligence she has overcome them with the help of her beloved family. Since she separated from the father of her two children she has had to assume the sole responsibility of the home and her children. Thanks to the support of some friends she was able to open a space to sell sweets inside an educational center. This business has helped her finance the studies of her children and the household expenses, but it is still insufficient to cover all of the basic necessities. Her and her childrens desire is to run her business and increase the variety and stock of merchandise that she offers with the intention of elevating her standard of living and offering a good and complete service to their customers. With this objective in mind she comes to you asking for a loan. Whoever has the will has the power and Doa Juana will rapidly realize her project with both of those qualities.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C.Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Doa Juana, es una madre muy responsable, tiene dos hijos y desde muy joven tuvo que atravesar muchas adversidades en la vida y hasta ahora con mucha diligencia las viene sobrellevando con la ayuda de su querida familia. Desde que se separ del padre de sus hijos tuvo que asumir sola la gran responsabilidad de su hogar y de sus retoos, gracias al apoyo de algunas amistades pudo abrir al interior de un centro educativo un espacio de ventas de dulces, este negocio le ha ayudado a solventar los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos de su hogar, pero aun es insuficiente para cubrir todas sus necesidades.Su deseo y el de sus queridos hijos es implementar y aumentar mucho ms la variedad y stock de la mercadera que oferta con el propsito de elevar su nivel de vida y brindarles un buen y completo servicio a sus clientes, con este objetivo en mente recurre a ti para hacerte la peticin de un prstamo. Quien tiene la voluntad tiene la fuerza y doa Juana con esas dos cualidades podr concretar rpidamente su proyecto.

loan.use: An increase in capital to offer a greater quantity of cookies, soft drinks, candies and others

loan.name: Casilda

texts.es:
From the time she was very young, Casilda had the immense desire to contribute economically to her familys well-being. It was because of this that once she formed her own family she worked in various jobs so that her children would not be disadvantaged. When her husband decided to leave and abandon them, she sought refuge in her activity. Since she felt capable of moving forward together with her beloved sons, she decided to open her own grocery store and in her free hours, without wasting time, she dedicated herself to knitting with great patience beautiful traditional Peruvian sweaters, scarves, and underskirts, etc. to sell to her friends and neighbors, who are delighted by the beautiful work that she does. Her greatest wish is to provide higher education to her beloved children; it is for this that she works insistently because she considers education to be the best inheritance that she can provide to her children. With this goal she comes to you with the hope of receiving your help.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Casilda desde muy nia tuvo las inmensas ganas de colaborar econmicamente con el bienestar de su familia. Fue as que cuando form su propio hogar trabaj en diversas labores para que sus hijos no tengan inconvenientes, cuando su esposo decidi marcharse y abandonarlos para siempre se refugi en su actividad ya que se senta capaz de seguir adelante junto a sus queridos hijos, actualmente decidi abrir su tiendita de abarrotes y en sus horas libres sin perder el tiempo se dedica a tejer con suma paciencia hermosas chompas, chalinas, enaguas, etc.; para venderlas a sus amistades y vecinos que se sienten encantados por los bellos trabajos que realiza.Su deseo ms grande es brindarles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos, es por ello que trabaja insistentemente ya que considera que la educacin es la mejor herencia que puede brindarles a sus retoos, es con ese fin que recurre a tu persona con la esperanza de recibir tu ayuda.

loan.use: Increase of capital to strengthen her small store and buy a greater quantity of raw material

loan.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina, in partnership with her beloved sister, has stood out for her great work in a small cosmetology center. With much diligence and despite her economic limitations, little by little her small salon has grown in a shopping mall in the city of Juliaca, thanks to the excellent services that she offers, with the agility and skill that have always characterized her rapid increase in her customer base, thus increasing her income. In this opportunity to provide greater comfort to her customers, Florentina plans to expand her salon, with the goal of improving the presentation of her area and above all her services. With this proposal she humbly asks you for a loan to invest in her profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina, en compaa de su querida hermana ha destacado por su gran trabajo en su pequeo centro de cosmetologa.Con mucho empeo y a pesar de sus limitaciones econmicas poco a poco ha ido implementando su pequeo saln en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a los excelentes servicios que presta con la agilidad y la habilidad que la han caracterizado siempre est logrando incrementar rpidamente su cartera de clientes y por ende mejorando sus ingresos econmicos.En esta oportunidad para otorgarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes Florentina tiene pensado implementar y ampliar su saln, con el fin de mejorar la presentacin de su local y sobre todo sus servicios.Con este propsito recurre humildemente a ti persona para solicitarte un prstamo que invertir en su rentable negocio.

loan.use: Increase in capital to improve the facilities of her beauty salon

loan.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz Marina is 33 years old, always proving to be a woman of great strength and great plans for her future and that of her children. With this grand plan for life in mind she is arduously dedicated to selling garments in the different markets in her native city, Juliaca. In her free hours, as not to waste time, she is engaged in the art of fine craftsmanship, knitting beautiful sweaters and vests for her beloved sons and in other opportunities for her relatives and friends, from whom she obtains the needed income for her home. Her loved children feel very proud, content and thankful for the marvelous and exemplary mother that they have and for her they try to make good grades. The desire of this valiant mother is to see her children become successful professionals; it is for this that she wants to increase the stock of her merchandise with the goal of generating more income. Your generous heart will permit her to realize her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Marina de 33 aos de edad, siempre demostr ser una mujer con mucha fortaleza y grandes planes para su vida futura y la de sus hijos, con este gran proyecto de vida en mente se dedica arduamente a la comercializacin de prendas de vestir en las distintas ferias de su ciudad natal, Juliaca.En sus horas libres para no desaprovechar el tiempo se desempea en el bello oficio de la artesana, tejiendo hermosas chompas y chalecos para sus queridos hijos y en algunas oportunidades para sus familiares y amigos de los que obtiene indispensables ingresos econmicos para su hogar.Sus queridos retoos se sienten muy orgullosos, contentos y agradecidos por la maravillosa y ejemplar madre que tienen, es por ello que con sus buenas notas tratan de corresponderle. El deseo de esta valiosa madre es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de xito, es por ello que desea aumentar el stock de su mercadera con el fin de generar mayores ingresos econmicos. Tu generoso corazn permitir concretar sus planes.

loan.use: Increase in capital to offer a greater quantity of articles of clothing

loan.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
On one of streets farthest from the city of Juliaca you will encounter the small and humble residence of Doa Gregoria, a 39 year-old hard-working, happy and persevering mother. She is originally from the district of Saman and after five years she decided, together with her loved husband and children, to leave her native town in search of better opportunities. With the savings they have and the little land that they sold in their town they were able to build their house. Nowadays, her unselfish husband Teodoro leaves the house from the early hours of the morning accompanied by his only tool of work, his tricycle, with the goal of obtaining the daily sustenance of his loved family. In the meantime Doa Gregoria is in charge of caring for their three young children, but at the same time she manages their small store with the objective of generating extra income for the expenses of their home. After seeing the requests and convenience of her neighbors, she decided to increase the stock of her business. With this project in mind she reaches out to your heart, hoping to receive your prompt response.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

En una de las calles ms lejanas de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos el pequeo y humilde domicilio de Doa Gregoria, madre empeosa, alegre y muy perseverante de 39 aos de edad. Ella es natural del distrito de Saman y hace ms de 5 aos decidi junto a su querido esposo e hijos salir de su pueblo natal en busca de mejores oportunidades.Con el ahorro que tenan y el pequeo terreno que vendieron en su pueblo lograron construir su domicilio, actualmente su abnegado esposo, Teodoro, desde tempranas horas de la maana abandona su hogar acompaado de su nica herramienta de trabajo, su triciclo, con el fin ganar el sustento diario de su amada familia.En tanto Doa Gregoria se encarga del cuidado de sus 3 menores hijos, pero al mismo tiempo administra su pequea bodeguita con el objetivo de generar ingresos econmicos extras para los gastos indispensables de su hogar.Ahora viendo las solicitudes y comodidad de sus vecinos decidi aumentar el stock de su negocio, con ese proyecto en mente recurre a tu buen corazn, sin perder las esperanzas de recibir pronto tu respuesta.

loan.use: Increase in capital to offer a greater amount of products in her small grocery store

loan.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Cell phone service has become one of the most popular businesses and at the same time the most demanded among the population of Juliaquea . For this reason, without thinking twice, Maritza decided to buy cell phones and offer this service to the entire population. Everyday, after caring for her beloved son and hardworking husband, she leaves her home to make her way to one of the busiest avenues of the city of Juliaca. Additionally, in her free hours, this hardworking mother makes use of the time to make beautiful sweaters, shawls and Peruvian Andean hats that at the end of the month she offers at the very least to her friends, with the objective of supplying the basic necessities of her home. Maritiza wants to take this opportunity to acquire a greater quantity of raw material to make a wider variety of garments and in greater volume. With this project in mind reach inside your heart.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

El servicio de llamadas mviles de un tiempo a este se ha convertido en uno de los negocios ms populares y al mismo tiempo el de mayor demanda entre la poblacin Juliaquea, es por esa razn que Maritza sin pensarlo dos veces decidi comprar celulares y brindar este servicio a la poblacin entera.Ella todos los das despus de atender a su querido hijo y laborioso esposo, abandona su hogar para dirigirse a una de las avenidas ms concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, de manera adicional en sus horas libres sta laboriosa madre aprovecha el tiempo para confeccionar hermosas chompas, chalinas y chullos, que cada fin de mes oferta al por menor a sus amistades, con el objetivo de suplir las necesidades primordiales de su hogar.En esta oportunidad Maritza tiene pensado adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para confeccionar mayor variedad de prendas y en mayor volumen.Con ese proyecto en mente recurre a tu buen corazn.

loan.use: Increase of capital to buy a greater amount of raw material to make more articles of clothing

loan.name: Felcitas

texts.es:
More than 3 years ago, Felicitas decided to try her luck with her restaurant, since she constantly received praises for the excellent flavor of her stews. She started her work making few dishes and in a location not very suitable. As the days passed, she began to have regular customers and saw the necessity of expanding her place. Currently this restaurant has become one of the busiest in her city. Despite the fact that there are diverse restaurants around hers, the flavor that Felicitas has is incomparable and irresistible. Thinking about the comfort and peacefulness of her clients she had decided to buy furniture (chairs and tables) in order to offer a better stay to her diners with the earnings that she will obtain going to finishing paying for the university studies of her dear daughter Roxana. Your good heart will allow the plans of this generous mother to be realized.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ms D. 3 aos Felicitas, decidi probar suerte con su restaurante, ya que constantemente reciba halagos por la excelente sazn D. sus potajes. Inici su labor preparando pocos platillos y en un local poco adecuado, conforme transcurran los das fue teniendo asiduos comensales y se vio en la necesidad D. ampliar su local.Actualmente este restaurante se convirti en una D. los ms concurridos D. su localidad, pese a que existen diversos restaurantes a su alrededor, la sazn que Felicitas posee en las manos es incomparable e irresistible.En esta oportunidad pensando en la comodidad y la tranquilidad D. sus clientes ha decidido comprar muebles (sillas y mesas) para ofrecerle una mejor estada a sus comensales, D. esa manera con las ganancias que obtenga terminar D. brindarle estudios superiores a su querida hija, Roxana.Vuestro buen corazn permitir concretar los planes D. esta generosa madre.

loan.use: To buy chairs and tables to improve the environment of her restaurant

loan.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita, as her parents and relatives caringly call her, has always shown herself to be a very hardworking and capable person. Ever since she was married in her hometown Capachica, she had in mind getting ahead with her husband and little son Fernando. When her son was about to start elementary school she decided together with her husband to live in the city of Juliaca. They arrived with little money but with a lot of will to work and this will is reflected is each of their endeavors. Since the beginning, her husband started doing contract work in construction and Benita, for her part, puts to work her creativity, patience and ability in the making of beautiful garments of clothing in order to sell them in the local market.

This hard-working mother has plans of acquiring more raw material (wool) and a sewing machine in order to speed up and increase the volume of her production. Benita is thankful for the confidence that you place in her.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Benita, como cariosamente la llamaban sus padres y familiares en todo momento demostr ser una persona muy trabajadora y capaz. Desde que contrajo matrimonio en su ciudad natal, Capachica, tuvo en mente salir adelante junto a su esposo Jos y a su pequeo nio Fernando.Cuando su hijo ya estaba a punto de iniciar sus estudios primarios decidi junto a su esposo radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, llegaron a ella con poco dinero pero con mucha voluntad para el trabajo y actualmente esa voluntad se ve reflejada en cada una de las obras que realiza.Desde un principio su esposo inici su trabajo en las construcciones de obras por contratos, y doa Benita por su parte pone su creatividad, paciencia y habilidad en la confeccin de hermosas prendas de vestir, para comercializarlas en el mercado de su localidad. Esta trabajadora madre tiene pensado adquirir mayor materia prima (lana) y una mquina de coser para de esa manera agilizar y aumentar el volumen de su produccin.Benita agradece la confianza que pones en su persona.

loan.use: Inyeccin de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima y elevar su produccin.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
As a good father that has to care for the well-being and security of his family, Edilberto has found himself with the need to postpone his university studies and start working so that his dear, young wife and daughter not have economic difficulties. With the savings that he has and the money that his parents have given him, he decided to buy his work tool in order to provide transportation services to the population of Juliaca. Since his dear wife Celia, who cares for their baby, also wishes to help with the expenses of their new household she is planning on buying a weaving machine in order to make beautiful garments of clothing and generate extra income to cover the basic necessities of the household. Your contribution will help to make real the project of this young couple.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Como buen padre que tiene que velar por el bienestar y seguridad de su familia Edilberto se ha visto en la necesidad de postergar sus estudios superiores y ponerse a trabajar para que su querida y joven esposa e hija no pasen limitaciones econmicas.Con los ahorros que tena y el apoyo econmico que sus padres le brindaron decidi comprar su herramienta de trabajo para brindar servicios de movilidad urbana a la poblacin Juliaquea.En tanto su querida esposa, Celia, que se encarga del cuidado de su beb, desea tambin colaborar con los gastos de su nuevo hogar, es por ello que tiene pensado comprar una mquina de tejer, para confeccionar hermosas prendas de vestir y generar ingresos extras para cubrir las necesidades bsicas de su hoga; debido a que ambos poseen mucha habilidad para confeccionar prendas han decidio adquirir las herrameintas necesarias para poner en marcha su gran proyecto. Vuestro aporte permitir concretar el proyecto de esta joven pareja

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine to start a textile business

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
In her home Marcelina manages as mother and father to her 4 children, but this task isn't difficult for her since she has always shown herself to be a very dedicated and hard-working, and above all, responsible person. For several years she performed various jobs with the aim that her kids not have economic limitations and receive a good education. Now that her children are adolescents and very entrepreneurial they decided to open a restaurant in which they all work to provide good service to their clients. At first the investment they had made in the restaurant didn't seem to be worthwhile due to the inadequate location of the place but little by little, with patience, much dedication and diligence it became more popular. Currently, thanks to the economic benefits she is obtaining, she is managing to pay for the studies of her children and above all recovering the economic security that her family sometimes lacked.

In this occasion Marcelina asks you to open your heart to receive her request of a loan that she will use to buy the ingredients for her delicious stews at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina dentro de su hogar se desenvuelve como padre y madre para sus 4 hijos, esta labor no es difcil para ella, debido a que siempre demostr ser una persona muy dedicada, trabajadora y sobre todo responsable. Durante varios aos desempe diversas actividades con el fin de que sus retoos no pasen limitaciones econmicas y puedan recibir una buena educacin.Ahora que sus hijos son adolescentes y muy emprendedores decidieron abrir un restaurante en el que todos trabajan para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes; a principio la inversin que haban hecho en este restaurante no pareca ser muy rentable por la inadecuada ubicacin de su local pero poco a poco con paciencia, mucho empeo y diligencia fue hacindose muy popular.Actualmente gracias a los beneficios econmicos que obtiene est logrando pagar los estudios de sus hijos y sobre todo recobrando la tranquilidad econmica que en alguna oportunidad padeci su familia.En esta oportunidad doa Marcelina desea tocar la puerta de vuestro buen corazn para hacerte la peticin de un prstamo que invertir para adquirir insumos al por mayor para la preparacin de sus deliciosos potajes.

loan.use: Buying a larger quantity of non-perishible items for her stews

loan.name: Orfila

texts.es:
Orfila, who belongs to the community bank, Seor de los Milagros de Ciquian, has business selling groceries in the district of Chiquian, Bolognesi province, in the area of Ancash.

With a loan of S/. 1,200.00 soles ($450.00), Orfila would pay for 6 dues, would buy 2 bags of sugar, 2 containers of milk, 2 boxes of oil, 30 cheese moulds, 2 small boxes of soda , 3 containers of soda gas, and caramels and cookies.

Orfila is 52 years old, is married, and has 4 children, of which two are professionals. Her husband is a businessman, and together they manage the costs of the home and their children's educations.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Orfila, pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, tiene su bodega de venta de abarrotes, en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el prstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar 2 sacos de azcar, 2 calas de leche, 2 cajas de aceite, 30 moldes de queso, 2 cajas chicas de gaseosa, 3 paquetes de gaseosa de litro, caramelos y galletas.

Ella tiene 52 aos de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son profesionales, su esposo tambin se dedica al comercio y juntos afrontan los gastos de su hogar y la educacin de sus hijos.

loan.use: Items for grocery

loan.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
The making of various garments has become the principal activity of Leonarda, a young, enterprising mother that is very talented in weaving sweaters, vests, slips, etc. After putting together a good quantity, she sells them in the inside of the Laguna Temporal market in the city of Juliaca. Leonarda started this business 6 years ago when, together with her husband, they decided to leave their native Capachica to live in Juliaca. They currently live in a rented house, but with much dedication they are managing to save towards buying a piece of land and building a small house where they want to care for and educate their two small children, who are the reason for all of their efforts.

They would like to buy a larger quantity of raw material (different varieties of wool) in order to continue producing in large numbers their beautiful and colorful garments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La confeccin de variadas prendas de vestir se ha convertido en la actividad principal de Leonarda, madre joven emprendedora y muy talentosa para el tejido de hermosas chompas, chalecos, enaguas, etc.; luego de juntar una buena cantidad los oferta en el interior del mercado Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca.Leonarda inici esta labor hace 6 aos, cuando junto a su esposo decidieron salir de su pueblo natal Capachica para radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca. Actualmente viven en una vivienda alquilada pero con mucho empeo estn logrando ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir su pequea morada, lugar donde desean cuidar y educar a sus 2 pequeos nios, quienes son la razn de su esfuerzo.Desean comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima ( variedad de lana) para seguir produciendo en mayor volumen sus hermosas y coloridas prendas de vestir.

loan.use: Adquire a larger quantity of raw material for making garments

loan.name: Ludy

texts.es:
Ludy belongs to the community bank , Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, working as a grocer in the district of Chiquian, Bolgnesi province, in the Ancash area.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($375), she will be able to pay for 6 dues, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 bags of noodles, 2 boxes of fruit juice, 6 packs of toilet paper, 10 bags of caramels and 10 boxes of cookies.

Ludy is 42 years old, is a single mother of a little girl, and thanks to her business is able to educate her child and manage the costs of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Ludy, pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, cuenta con una bodega de venta de abarrotes, en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con este prstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azcar, 2 bolsas de fideos, 2 cajas de frugos de un litro, 6 paquetes de papel higinico, 10 bolsas de caramelo 10 cajas de galletas surtidas.

Ella tiene 42 aos de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, gracias a su negocio puede educar a su hija y afrontar los gastos de su hogar.

loan.use: Items for stocking her general store

loan.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia belongs to the community bank, Seor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, and is a liscensed veterinarian in the district of Chiquian, Bolognesi province, in the Ancash area.

With this loan of S/. 8,00.00 ($300), she will be able to pay for 6 dues, 5 boxes of vitamins, 5 antibitoics, 2 kilos of anti-parasite medications, 3 liters of another type of anti-parasite, and 8 kilos of fertilizer.

She is 50 years old, is married, has nine children, 2 of which are economically dependent upon her. Her other children are economically independent. Her husband supports her in the education of her children.

Tanslated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, tiene su veterinaria, en el distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este prstamo D. S/. 8,00.00, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar 5 cajas D. vitamina, 5 sobres D. antibiticos, 2 kilos antiparasitaR., 3 litros D. otro tipo D. antiparasitaR., abono foliar 8 kilos.

Ella tiene 50 aos D. edad, casada, tiene 9 hijos, dos D. ellos an dependen econmicamente D. ella, sus otros hijos son independientes su esposo la apoya en la educacin D. sus hijos.

loan.use: To buy products for use in the business

loan.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Selling firewood has become the most important source of income for Mrs. Pastora and her beloved family. This diligent mother is from the district of Conima. Since her children started college she decided, along with her husband Tefilo, to live in the city of Juliaca with the aim of being close to her kids and keeping the family together. Since that time this eager mother decided to sell firewood to help her dear husband with the household expenses as well as the cost of university for her children.

Now that she is observing the demand for her products she is thinking about increasing the amount of her merchandise and it's for that reason that she appeals to your good heart to request a loan. She plans to invest the loan in her business, allowing her to realize her dreams of seeing her children with a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de lea se ha convertido en el ingreso econmico ms importante de Doa Pastora y su amada familia, sta diligente madre es natural del distrito de Conima, desde que sus hijos emprendieron sus estudios superiores decidi junto a su esposo Tefilo radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca con el fin de estar ms cerca de sus retoos y conservar a su familia unida.Desde ese momento esta afanosa madre decidi dedicarse a la venta de lea y de esa manera apoyar a su querido esposo con los gastos del hogar y educacin de sus hijos, ahora observando la demanda de sus productos tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de su mercadera y es por ello que toca tu buen corazn para solicitarte un prstamo ya que tiene pensado invertir esta cantidad en su negocio, permitindole concretar sus sueos de ver a sus hijos con un futuro promisorio.

loan.use: Increasing capital to be able to offer larger quantities of firewood

loan.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, who belongs to the community bank, Seor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, sells candy and groceries, in the Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, in the area of Ancash.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 les ($375), Ana will be able to pay for 6 dues, two sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, a box of oil, one sack of salt, two packets of detergent, a box of apples, a box of oranges, a box of grapes, and a box of mangos.

She is 59 years old, is married, and has 3 children. One of her children is economically independent. Her husband works in agriculture, and both of them work to manage the costs of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Ana, pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y abarrotes, en el distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este prstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 les, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar 2 sacos D. arroz, 2 sacos D. azcar, una caja D. aceite, un saco D. sal, 2 paquetes D. detergente, una caja D. manzana, una caja D. naranja, una caja D. uva, una caja D. mango.

Ella tienen 59 aos D. edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos uno D. ellos es independiente, su esposo es agricultor y ambos se apoyan con los gastos D. su hogar.

loan.use: To buy products to sell at the general store

loan.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, who belongs to the community bank, Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, works in cheese sales in the Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, in the area of Ancash. She also sells at the Huaraz market and works in housekeeping.

With this loan of S/.1,800.00 ($675), she will be able to take care of six dues, and buy 180 cheese molds to sell to clients in Huaraz.

She is 40 years old, is married, and has 6 children. Her husband works in livestock farming and is a musician. The two of them work to support the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Betty, pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, se dedica ala venta de quesos, en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi departamento de Ancash. Tambin vende en el mercado de Huaraz y atiende pedidos a domicilio.

Con este prstamo de S/. 1,800.00, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar 180 moldes de queso, para venderlos en Huaraz a sus clientes.

Ella tiene 40 aos de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la ganadera y es msico, ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loan.use: Cheese molds to sell

loan.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene, who belongs to the community bank, Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, has a grocery store in the Chiquian district, Bolegnesi province, in the Ancash area.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($375), she will be able to pay for 6 dues, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 5 large boxes of soda, 2 sacks of potatoes, 2 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of eggs, 2 buckets of oil, and 2 bags of detergent.

Irene is 51 years old, is married, and has 5 children. Her husband is a chauffeur and together they share the costs of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian, tiene su bodega de abarrotes, en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi departamento de Ancash.

Con este prstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azcar, 5 paquetes de gaseosa grande, 2 sacos de papa, 2 cajas de leche, 2 cajas de huevo, 2 baldes de aceite, 2 bolsas grande de detergente.

Ella tiene 51 aos de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es chofer y ambos comparten los gastos de su hogar.

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice, and other supplied for the store

loan.name: Marlene Monica

texts.es:
R. belongs to Las Rosas de Yungay (The Roses of Yungay) Grupo Mientras Tanto (an interim group of borrowers not large enough to form a communal bank). For the past two years she has sold fruits at the local market in the district and province of Yungay in the state of Ancash. With this loan of $125, which she will repay in four months, she will buy three boxes of limes, two boxes of mangos, two boxes of apples, and three boxes of plums. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a chauffer with temporary employment; on his free days, he helps her with the business. La seora R., pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, desde hace dos aos se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Con este prstamo de S/. 300.00, el cual ser cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprar 3 cajas de lima, 2 cajas de mango, 2 cajas de manzana y 3 cajas de ciruela. Ella tiene 42 aos de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer y tiene trabajos eventuales, en sus das libres le apoya a su esposa en este negocio.

loan.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell at the local market.

loan.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda R. D. P. runs a family store selling spare motorcycle parts in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She opened the store six years ago with her husband. They have a great location on a main road connecting Pucallpa with the town of Yurmicucha.

Belinda is 51 years old with two children and is happily married. Before she opened the store, Belinda had a business renting motorcycles and scooters. She left the business because she was the victim of too many robberies and assaults. The change has been good, and she can now live more calmly.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Belinda is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to restock the products she sells that are in low supply and or are popular.

loan.use: To restock products for her motorcycle parts store

loan.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S. G. has a business selling ingredients to bake bread in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She has a stand in the market Mercado Micaela Bastidas Number 4, where she sells eggs, grains, butter, and more.

Teresa is 69 years old and has four children. Her husband died eight years ago, and her children live in Lima. Without her business she would have nothing; it keeps her going. She used to have a general store, but she didnt have the capital to keep it open after her husband died.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Teresa is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy more frijol canario, frijol ucayalinio, panamito, frijol castilla, and maiz morado.

loan.use: To buy more bread-making ingredients to sell

loan.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla R. P. sells chickens and roosters in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to go buy live chickens and roosters and take them to sell at the Micaela Bastidas Market Number 4. There she rents a stand where she prepares the poultry to sell.

Merla is 55 years old and is a widow with six children. She works very hard and is happy she has been able to help her family. Her hard work helped send her children to school and rewarded her with greater independence and decision making in her family.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Merla is requesting a loan of $725 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to invest in her business. She also owns some land and would some day like to raise her own poultry.

loan.use: To invest in her poultry-selling business

loan.name: Mirella

texts.en:
Mirella R. D. M. has a business selling bananas in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She rents a spot in the crowded Bellavista market, where she has sold her fruits for four years.

Mirella is 50 years old with three children, and she is happily married. She loves working and being able to help her family. Mirella loves sales and building relationships. She never had the opportunity to study, so her goal is to send all of her children to school so they can become professionals.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Mirella is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to increase her daily stock of fruit to sell to the population of Pucallpa.

loan.use: To increase her daily stock of fruit to sell in the market

loan.name: Zoila Licinda

texts.en:
Zoila Licinda C. M. sells regional food in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She makes dishes such as juane, caldo, steak, and escaveche. She has many loyal clients that come to visit her stand in the Bellavista market. She also sells bananas and coal when she has enough capital.

Zoila is 45 years old, has six children, and is divorced. She works very hard, and four of her children still depend on her. She loves to cook and build relationships, and she has many loyal customers.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Zoila is requesting a loan of $550 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy all the ingredients used to make her delicious meals.

loan.use: To buy all the ingredients used to make her delicious meals

loan.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelinas biggest wish is to see her four children become successful professionals. Thats why she and her husband Meliton are focusing their efforts on buying and selling sheep skins and alpaca fibers. They have been selling these products for 20 years and through their hard work they have managed to build a small house for raising their family. Now that their children are entering college, they are facing higher costs and financial limits. Therefore they would like to increase their investment capital and expand their market. With this goal in mind, Avelina is turning to you to ask for a loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El deseo ms grande de Avelina es observar convertidos en profesionales de xito a sus queridos 4 hijos, es por ello que junto a su esposo Meliton trata de poner su mayor empeo y prestancia en su noble labor de compra y venta de cuero de oveja y fibra de alpaca.Juntos vienen dedicndose a esta labor hace 20 aos, gracias a su excelente desempeo han logrado construir su pequeo domicilio y brindarle tranquilidad a su familia, ahora que todos sus hijos se encuentran cursando estudios superiores tienen mayores gastos y limitaciones econmicas, es por ello que tienen pensado aumentar su capital de inversin y expandir su mercado, con ese proyecto en mente recurre a ti para hacerte la peticin de un prstamo.

loan.use: Injection of capital to offer more leather and alpaca fibers to support their family

loan.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena R. D. R. owns on beautiful restaurant in the city of Pucallpa, department of Ucayali. She started the business three years ago and now has many loyal customers. Customers come to enjoy lunch, drink a beer, or eat dinner. They enjoy the warm and contemporary environment.
Milena is a 49 years old widow with two children. She decided to open the restaurant because she loves to cook food and proviD. a service she can be proud of. She is creative and smart.
