She used the internet to find and good design for her bar and came up for the theme of the atmosphere herself. She works hard so she can send her youngest son to university and she has no one else to rely on.
A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Milena is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments

loan.use: She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments

loan.name: Brgida

texts.es:
Brgida has always proved to be very hard-working, dedicated and enterprising. Now that she and her husband Rogelio have established a family, she has decided to make clothes, a skill she learned from her parents and, with hard work and diligence, has continued to develop. Her work helps ensure the financial security and stability of her family and her three-year-old son Kevin. To generate additional income, Brgida has begun to sell wool. Through this work, along with making clothes, she and her family aim to improve their quality of life. Brgida would like to increase her working capital to be able to offer a greater number of products.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Brgida siempre demostr ser una muchacha muy trabajadora, dedicada y emprendedora, ahora que acaba de formar su familia junto a su esposo Rogelio decidi dedicarse a la confeccin de prendas de vestir, labor que aprendi y hered de sus queridos padres y que ahora con mucho empeo y diligencia vienen desarrollando eficientemente con el fin de brindarle seguridad y tranquilidad econmica a su pequeo nio Kevin de 3 aitos de edad; del mismo modo para generar ingresos extras esta joven madre decidi dedicarse a la venta de lea, con estas dos actividades estn buscando mejorar su calidad de vida.Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para ofertar en mayor volumen sus productos.

loan.use: Injection of capital to offer greater number of products

loan.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma M. S. owns land where she plants various crops near the city of Pucallpa in the department of Ucayali. On the land she plans to plant cilantro, peppers, corn, and sugar cain. Irma has a lifetime of experience farming and harvesting in the Peruvian Amazon Basis.
Irma is 66 years old, has 4 children and is happily married. She loves working and helping her family. In the future she plans on investing in the business and increasing production. The family currently only uses a small percentage of their land.
A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Irma is requesting a loan of s/3000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy seeds to plant all of her future crops.

loan.use: She will use the loan to buy seeds to plant all of her future crops.

loan.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony and her aunt Thania make the perfect team for making crafts and sewing. Both are originally from Arequipa, but currently live in Juliaca for academic and professional reasons. Since Jhony was a little girl, her aunt Thania has taught her this wonderful craft and, with lots of patience and diligence, has cultivated her talents. The two of them have decided to offer classes to anyone who wants to learn the art of crafts. Jhony is able to pay for her college studies doing this work and Thania uses the income to support her household. They both hope to continue making their beautiful and distinctive crafts. To to do this, they are applying for a loan which they will use to purchase the materials they require for their work. With the essential support you provide, Jhony and her aunt will continue on the road to progress.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Jhony y su querida ta Thania son el equipo perfecto para las manualidades y la costura, ambas son naturales del departamento de Arequipa, por cuestiones de estudio y trabajo radican en la ciudad de Juliaca.Desde muy pequea Jhony aprendi este bello oficio de su querida ta, quien con mucha paciencia y diligencia cultiv sus conocimientos en ella, y ahora ambas en sociedad decidieron ofrecer cursos de manualidades a todas aquellas personas que desean aprender este hermoso arte.Gracias a este trabajo Jhony logra cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de sus estudios superiores y por su parte su querida ta cubre plenamente las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de ambas es seguir realizando sus hermosos y distintivos trabajos, es por ello que solicitan un prstamo que invertirn en la compra de indispensables materiales para su trabajo.Con tu imprescindible apoyo Jhony y su querida ta seguirn por el camino del progreso.

loan.use: Purchase of greater number of raw materials to continue craftmaking and sewing

loan.name: Vicki

texts.es:
Vicki is a happy mother with a generous heart. Despite her economic condition she has always tried to help her family get ahead and improve their quality of life. She is originally from Cuzco but for family reasons now lives in Juliaca. Since she moved to Juliaca she has worked as a vendor of seasonal items. A few months ago Vicki started selling wholesale Christmas cards and postcards. She is very proud and satisfied with her success. During the coming school year she would like to sell books to students in primary and secondary schools. She is sure she can achieve her goal with hard work and dedication.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Vicki, es una alegre madre con un generoso corazn, pese a su condicin econmica siempre trata de apoyar a los suyos a salir adelante y mejorar su condicin de vida. Ella es natural del departamento de Cuzco y por cuestiones familiares radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que vive en dicha ciudad se dedica a la venta de artculos por campaas y hace algunos meses atrs se ha dedicado a la venta de tarjetas y postales navideas al por mayor, se siente muy orgullosa y contenta por los resultados que ha obtenido con su desempeo.Ahora por esta temporada escolar desea ofertar libros para estudiantes de nivel primario y secundario, est segura que con voluntad y mucha dedicacin conseguir su propsito.

loan.use: Injection of capital to sell books in the school fair

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja is from the district of Vilquechico. She has always proved to be a courageous woman who is determined to get ahead. Since her husbands death, she has looked for work that will help her and her 4 children get ahead. Currently she sells ropes and bags and, with tremendous hard work and persistence, has managed to build a small house in Juliaca, where she and her family have been living for 4 years. A dedicated mother, Maruja sells her goods in the San Jose market in Juliaca and at fairs in her region. Her biggest wish is to see her children become successful professionals. Recognizing the need for resources to achieve this goal, she decided to increase the variety of her merchandise and is turning to you for this loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Maruja, es natural del distrito de Vilquechico, y siempre ha demostrado ser una mujer con mucho coraje y empeo para salir adelante, desde que su querido esposo falleci slo tuvo en mente la bsqueda de alguna actividad para salir adelante junto a sus 4 hijos. Actualmente con su negocio de compra y venta de sogas y bolsas, con mucho empeo y constancia ha logrado construir su pequea y humilde vivienda en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde radica hace 4 aos en compaa de su familia.sta empeosa madre ofrece sus productos en el mercado San Jos de la ciudad de Juliaca y en las ferias de los distintos distrito de su localidad; el deseo ms grande que tiene es ver convertidos en profesionales de xito a sus hijos.En esta oportunidad viendo la necesidad econmica de su familia decidi aumentar la variedad de su mercadera, con ese propsito recurre a vosotros.

loan.use: Injection of capital to offer a greater number of goods

loan.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Selling food from her cart has become the greatest source of income for Luzmilas family. A dependable, diligent and dedicated mother, Luzmila has found, through her work, the means to pay for her household needs. In addition to her day-to-day chores, she gets up early in the morning to sell polos and sweatshirts at the San Jose market in Juliaca. At noon she prepares her delicious vegetable stews which she sells to the merchants at the market. With income from these two business activities she is able to cover her household expenses. She would like to add seats, tables and umbrellas to her food cart to make her customers more comfortable. As such, she is turning to you and applying for this loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La venta de comida en forma ambulatoria se ha convertido en el ingreso econmico ms importante de la familia de Doa Luzmila, madre empeosa diligente y muy dedicada, encontr en este noble oficio la manera de cubrir las necesidades bsicas de su hogar.Esta diligente madre adicionalmente a su desempeo diario desde tempranas horas de la maana se dedica a la venta de polos y polares al por mayor dentro del mercado San Jos de la ciudad de Juliaca y al medio da prepara sus deliciosos potajes para venderlos a los comerciantes de dicho mercado.Con estas 2 actividades est logrando cubrir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar, y tambin ahora desea brindarles comodidad a sus clientes, para ello tiene pensado comprar sillas, mesas y sombrillas, con ese propsito recurre a tu buen corazn y te hace la peticin de un prstamo.

loan.use: Purchase of chairs, tables and umbrellas

loan.name: Maisa

texts.es:
Maisa is a very pleasant and persevering 23 year old woman. Originally from the town of Cuzco, she has lived in the city of Juliaca for the last two years. She finished secondary school and immediately sought to work to earn her own income and to pay for her higher qualifications. After saving enough money, she decided to open a small soft drinks outlet as the space available for this purpose was located in a very strategic and commercial city of Juliaca.

The desire of this young woman is to increase the stock of her merchandise, with the aim of substantially increasing her sales and to continue her current business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Maisa, es una muchacha muy alegre y perseverante de 23 aos de edad, natural del departamento de Cuzco, hace 2 aos radica en al ciudad de Juliaca, termin sus estudios secundarios e inmediatamente busc trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y as lograr cubrir sus estudios superiores, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de dinero decidi abrir una pequea tiende de bebidas gaseosas y refrescos, ya que el espacio que dispona para este fin se encontraba ubicada en un lugar estratgico y muy comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca. El deseo de esta empeosa muchacha es aumentar el stock de su mercadera, con el fin de incrementar sustancialmente sus ventas y poder mantener activo su negocio.

loan.use: Additional capital to purchase stock and to offer a greater variety of soft drinks

loan.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. G. is a client of LEON 2000 who has already received 4 loans and with this opportunity he will he will increase the products that he offers to give his community better service. When he received his first loan he sold general merchandise in a limited way and with the loan he was able to expand his business and to establish a grocery store in his home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El sr. G. es un cliente deLEON 2000 que ha sido financiado anteriormente con 4 prestamos y en esta oportunidad el ampliara la oferta de productos para brindar un mejor servicio a la comunidad, en su primer credito el tenia la venta de mercaderia en general de forma limitada y ha logrado ampliar su negocio asi como establecer en su casa un negocio de pulperia

loan.use: Purchase of basic grains and cosmetics

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a very affectionate and responsible granddaughter. Since childhood, she has always sought ways to earn her own income and to contribute to the cost of running her familys humble home. She is currently pursuing her higher education and to pay her own way, she decided to engage in various business activities such as selling cosmetics and beauty products, cellular phones, childrens overcoats, and woollen ponchos, that in many cases she weaves herself with great patience and creativity. With all these activities she is achieving her aims and above all she provides peace and well being to her grandparents who always supported and looked after her.

Nancys desire is to have more capital to invest in her business selling cosmetics and beauty products; a desire that relies on the goodness of your heart.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy, es una nieta muy cariosa y responsable, desde pequea siempre ha buscado la manera de generar sus propios ingresos econmicos y aportar con los gastos de su humilde hogar, actualmente viene cursando estudios superiores y para cubrir sus gastos decidi dedicarse a diversas actividades tales como: la venta de cosmticos de belleza, celulares, abrigos para nios y ponchos de lana que en muchos casos los teje personalmente con suma paciencia y creatividad.Con estas labores est logrando su propsito y sobre todo est brindndoles tranquilidad y bienestar a sus queridos abuelitos quienes son las personas que siempre la apoyaron y velaron por ella.El deseo de Nancy es contar con mayor capital para invertir en su negocio venta de cosmticos de belleza, con ese plan recurre a tu solidario corazn.

loan.use: Additional capital to purchase stock and to offer a greater variety of beauty products

loan.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina is a very affectionate and loving mother and despite her advanced age she is still eager to improve her beloved familys quality of life. Since her husbands death, Ricardina has been both a mother and a father to her children. She has worked tirelessly to ensure they do not suffer financially. Now that the children are older and independent she feels very proud, happy, and fulfilled as a mother.

With persistence and single-mindedness, Ricardina has succeeded in building a small house in one of the new housing estates in the city of Juliaca, within which she has also adapted an area to open her own small grocery store. Ricardina wishes to complete the fitting of her her small shop and to increase its stock.

She believes that this investment will help her achieve higher income from her small shop and proviD. her with better security and peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Ricardina es una madre muy cariosa y amorosa, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su amada familia; desD. que su esposo falleci ha desempeado las funciones D. padre y madre para sus hijos, trabajando incansablemente para que no pasen limitaciones econmicas, ahora que ya son independientes se siente muy orgullosa, feliz y realizada como madre.Actualmente con mucho empeo y firmeza logr construir su casita en una D. las urbanizaciones nuevas D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, lugar donD. tambin adecu un espacio para abrir su bodeguita. El deseo D. Ricardina es terminar D. implementar y aumentar el stock D. su tiendita, considera que haciendo esta inversin lograr obtener mayores ingresos econmicos y se sentir mucho ms tranquila y segura.

loan.use: Capital injection to increase the number of items for sale in her new and small grocery store

loan.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a woman who, with great tenacity and effort, is succeeding in improving her standard of living. Financial and family problems prevented Luisa from completing her high school education but she found ways of improving her family situation. She is a dedicated woman and from early in the morning she is busy preparing delicious stews to sell as a street vendor in one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. As soon as this finishes, she heads for one of the passenger terminals in her city to sell bus tickets to Arequipa and Cuzco. She earns a commission for every ticket she sells. Both activities provide indispensable income for her family.

Luisa plans to purchase the basic ingredients for her stews in larger quantities and at wholesale prices as this would increase her profit margin. With your generous heart she can succeed in her plan.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Luisa, es una mujer que con mucho tesn y esfuerzo est logrando mejorar su condicin de vida, por problemas familiares y econmicos no logr concluir sus estudios superiores pero si encontr la manera de mejorar su situacin familiar.Esta empeosa mujer desde tempranas horas de la maana se dedica a preparar deliciosos potajes para venderlos en forma ambulatoria en una de las avenidas ms concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de concluir con este negocio inmediatamente se dirige a uno de los terminales nterdepartamentales de su ciudad para ofrecer boletos hacia los departamentos de Arequipa y Cuzco, por cada boleto vendido logra obtener un determinado porcentaje de ganancias, ambas actividades le otorgan ingresos indispensables para sus gastos familiares.El deseo de Raquel es comprar insumos de primera necesidad, considera que adquiriendo estos productos al por mayor la preparacin de sus potajes le resultar mucho ms econmico.Con tu generoso corazn podr concretar sus proyectos.

loan.use: Purchase of non-perishable items in larger quantities to continue preparing her delicious stews.

loan.name: "costeitas Ii" Group

texts.es:
The Villa Adela zone is the primary focus area of Pro Mujer, to which the group Costeitas II belongs. It is comprised of a lovely collection of women who, along with Ruth Gutierrez their credit assistant, work hard to make their businesses a success. They are pleased because they have an opportunity to qualify for investments as well as loan funds that are offered through this entity. A majority of the members are married and have an average of five children. Some, like Mrs. Malena, cannot count on any help from a partner/spouse. She was abandoned by her husband, leaving her as sole provider for their four minor children who do their best to help their mother while she works as a street vendor selling fruit. There is a variety of activities within the group. We were able to observe that commerce/sales is the primary enterprise and the members sell clothes, in-season fruits, food, tableware, school supplies and other items. Some offer their products at retail from fixed locations, and others work as street vendors. It is certain that with additional capital they would be able to buy their merchandise at wholesale. This would allow them to obtain greater profits which would, in turn, help their small businesses to prosper and provide a higher standard of living for their families.

Note: There are some camera-shy members within the organization, which is why they are not very visible in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

EN LA ZONA DE VILLA ADELA FUNCIONA EL CENTRO FOCAL DEL MISMO DE NOMBRE DE PRO-MUJER, A ESTE PRETENECE LA ASOCIACION "COSTEITAS II" UN LINDO GRUPO DE SEORAS QUE CON LA AYUDA DE SU ASISTENTE DE CREDITOS RUTH GUTIERREZ TRABAJAN INTENSAMENTE PARA QUE SUS NEGOCIOS PROSPEREN. ADEMAS ELLAS ESTAN MUY CONTENTAS PORQUE TIENEN LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CAPACITARSE SOBRE INVERSIONES ADEMAS DE OBTENER LOS CREDITOS QUE LA ENTIDAD OFRECE. EN EL GRUPO LA MAYORIA SON CASADAS CON UN PROMEDIO DE 5 HIJOS, ALGUNAS DE ELLAS NO CUENTAN CON LA AYUDA DE SU PAREJA, POR EJEMPLO A DOA MALENA SU ESPOSO LA ABANDONO, TENIENDO ELLA QUE HACERSE CARGO DE SUS CUATRO HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES INTENTAN AYUDAR A SU MAMA EN LA VENTA DE FRUTAS DE MANERA AMBULANTE. EXISTEN DISTINTOS TIPOS DE ACTIVIDADES DENTRO DEL GRUPO,PUDIMOS OBSERVAR QUE EL COMERCIO ES LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL, ELLAS OFRECEN LA VENTA DE ROPA, FRUTAS DE LA TEMPORADA, COMIDA, VAJILLAS, MATERIAL ESCOLAR Y OTROS ENCERES. PRODUCTOS QUE LOS OFRECEN AL POR MENOR ALGUNAS EN PUESTOS FIJOS COMO TAMBIEN DE FORMA AMBULANTE. TIENEN LA CERTEZA QUE CON UN MAYOR CAPITAL PODRIAN COMPRAR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR PARA ASI OBTENER UNA MAYOR GANANCIA Y DE ESTA FORMA PROSPEREN SUS PEQUEOS NEGOCIOS PARA BRINDAR A SUS FAMILIAS UNA MEJOR FORMA DE VIDA. NOTA -->:DENTRO LA ASOCIACION EXISTEN ALGUNAS PERSONAS UN POCO TIMIDAS A LAS CAMARAS. MOTIVO POR EL CUAL NO ESTAN MUY VISIBLES.

loan.use: With additional capital, they would be able to buy their merchandise at wholesale and obtain greater profits.

loan.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Since leaving his hometown of Cuzco with his beloved parents as a teenager to live in the city of Juliaca, Hilario and his parents had been engaged in various activities to support themselves financially. But despite their great efforts their income continued to be inadequate. Using their initiative, they decided to begin making clothes hangers. Initially they did not put much emphasis on this work because it did not generate sufficient income. But gradually, as they decided to make the hangers in larger quantities and distribute them wholesale, the situation improved.

Hilario has his own family now and is the father of two small children, whom he adores and are his motivation. That is why this enterprising father plans to produce a variety of clothes hangers in different sizes and models. With your important contribution, his plans would be realized.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Desde adolescente Hilario y sus queridos padres decidieron salir de su ciudad natal, Cuzco, para radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que viven en dicha ciudad se han dedicado a diversas actividades para cubrir sus gastos familiares pero an con mucho esfuerzo segua siendo insuficiente, es as que con mucha creatividad y habilidad han ido fabricando colgadores para ropas, en un principio no le dieron mucha importancia a esta labor porque no les generaba ingresos econmicos sustanciales pero poco a poco conforme fabricaban en mayores cantidades y los distribuan al por mayor las cosas fueron cambiando.Actualmente Hilario ya form su propia familia y es padre de 2 pequeos nios, quienes son su mayor adoracin y el motivo de su esfuerzo, es por ello que este emprendedor padre tiene pensado seguir fabricando variedad de colgadores y en diversos modelos y tamaos.Con tu importante aporte obtendr concretar sus planes

loan.use: Capital injection to purchase larger quantities of raw materials for making finished products

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo was trained as a mechanic in a public institute in the city of Juliaca. For the last ten years, he has been providing his mechanical repair services to the people of the town of Juliaquea. Initially, he began working from premises not entirely suitable. Now, thanks to his skill, knowledge, ability, and excellent service, Hugos customers have trebled and his workshop has become one of the busiest workshops in town. He has expanded his premises and has hired more staff.

To continue to offer his customers excellent service, Hugo is in urgent need of reconditioning his equipment. Through his efforts and diligence, this enterprising father has maintained his beloved wife and son financially and they fully support him in his activities.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 10 aos el seor Hugo, se dedica a brindar sus servicios de mecnico a la poblacin Juliaquea, Hugo estudi la carrera tcnica de mecnica de produccin en un instituto pblico de la ciudad de Juliaca, ahora gracias a su destreza, conocimientos y habilidad est logrando obtener ms clientes.En principio inici su labor en un local no muy apropiado, pero conforme brindaba un buen servicio sus clientes fueron triplicndose y se vio en la necesidad de ampliar su local y contratar a ms personal, actualmente es uno de los talleres ms solicitados de esta localidad, es por ello se ve en la urgente necesidad de renovar sus herramientas de trabajo con el fin de continuar brindando a sus clientes un servicio de alta calidad.Este emprendedor padre con su esfuerzo y diligencia est logrando tambin mantener sin limitaciones econmicas a su querida esposa e hijo quienes no dudan en apoyarlo en la actividad que realiza.

loan.use: Reconditioning of Workshop Tools and Equipment

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 24-year-old, very happy and persistent young lady. Despite her young age, Norma is already the owner of a cap making studio. It has been six years since Norma with the support of her parents, undertook this business. During this time she managed to transform her studio into a big factory. Norma has already entered the markets of the cities of Arequipa, Cuzco and Puno, and her goal is to expand her business activity to other locations and provide people with the opportunity of a job. With this purpose in mind, Norma hopes that you help her to obtain the quantity that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una muchachita muy alegre y perseverante de 24 aos, a pesar de su corta edad ya es propietaria de un taller de confeccin de gorros, ella con el apoyo de sus padres emprendi este negocio hace 6 aos, en ese tiempo logr implementar poco a poco su taller hasta convertirla en una gran fbrica de confeccin de gorras.. Actualmente ya incursionaron en el mercado de las ciudades de Arequipa, Cuzco y Puno, el deseo que tiene es ampliar su taller y darles una oportunidad de trabajo a otros muchachos que se encuentran desocupados, con ese propsito en mente rene sus esperanzas en vosotros para obtener la cantidad que solicita.

loan.use: To obtain captial in order to expand business activities to other locations

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is a woman that in every moment is concerned with the welfare and education of her 3 beloved children. She has always shown to be a mother with a lot of perseverance and will to work. Since the divorced with her husband, she worked in innumerable jobs in order to cover the needs she had at home. Currently, Betty lives with her children in a rented residence, where she decided to designate small space to sell a variety of beverages. This business activity has helped Betty generate additional income, and is because of this that she is thinking about expanding the business. Your contribution will help Betty provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty es una mujer que en todo momento vel por el bienestar y educacin de sus 3 queridos hijos, siempre ha demostrado ser una madre con mucha voluntad de trabajo y perseverancia, desde que se divorci de su esposo trabaj en innumerables labores para ganarse el pan de cada da y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.Actualmente vive junto a sus hijos en un domicilio alquilado, lugar en donde decidi adecuar un pequeo espacio para vender variedad de bebidas, este negocio le viene generando buenos ingresos econmicos, es por ello que tiene pensado ampliar su negocio, con ese proyecto en mente toca tu buen corazn para que le brindes la oportunidad de salir adelante junto a sus queridos hijos.

loan.use: To increase business space in order to service more customers

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Roxana

texts.es:
In one of the most concurred avenues of the city of Juliaca we find a very happy and laborious lady named Roxana, a 33-year-old, offering departmental transport service tickets to the population of her city. Roxana is a young lady who has a very low income, but this fact has not discourage her to succeed in life and to try to do well next to her elderly parents. Besides offering transportation tickets, Roxana has a small store selling basic supplies and groceries. Roxanas mother takes care of the store while she works during the day. Roxana would like to purchase more merchandise in order to expand her business and increase her profits and in this manner offer her parents a better living. "Your important contribution will help Roxana attain her goals."

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

En una de las avenidas ms concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos muy contenta y afanosa a Roxana de 33 aos de edad, ofreciendo sus boletos de servicio de transporte departamental a la poblacin de su ciudad.Roxana es una joven de bajos recursos econmicos, pero este hecho no la amilan para esforzarse en la vida y tratar de salir adelante junto a sus ancianos padres, ahora adicionalmente de ofrecer boletos de transporte tiene una pequea tienda de insumos de primera necesidad, tiendita que atiende su querida madre mientras Roxana desde tempranas horas de la maana se va a ofrecer los boletos.El deseo de Roxana es aumentar el stock de mercadera de su bodeguita con el fin de obtener mayores beneficios econmicos para ofrecerles tranquilidad y seguridad a sus queridos padres.Vuestra importante colaboracin concretar los anhelos de Roxana

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase textiles and fabrics

loan.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Hernndez was preoccupied by his family's financial difficulty. She decided to increase her income since two of her three children are at college. She resolved to set up a home business and started selling various gift items. Subsequently, she rented a space to sell her goods and was able to increase sales. It has been 5 years she has started her business.

Now, she seeks a loan of $475 which she will repay in 6 months so she can continue to buy inventory and offer a variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Alma Hernndez preocupada por la situacin econmica de su familia y decidida a aumentar las entradas de dinero, debido a que dos de sus tres hijos estaban en la universidad resolvi poner un negocio en la sala de su casa. Empez vendiendo regalitos, posteriormente rento un local y surti con artculos de papelera aumentando las ventas del negocio todo esto principi hace 5 aos,

Ahora solicita un apoyo econmico por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para seguir comprar mercanca y ofrecer ms variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loan.use: to buy inventory

loan.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Mara H. is married to Francisco de la Isla Mrquez, an independent mason, and they have 4 children ages 10, 11, 15 and 16 years old. 3 years ago Rosa began her business due to the lack of money as her husbands job does not provide a steady income. She began her business when she realized that around her house there was not a candy store and there were many children. So she decided to start a business herself with only a table and a few candies, putting the table outside of her home because many children passed by on their way to school.

Now she needs a loan for US$250 which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase merchandise such as drinks and frozen products in addition to increasing the variety of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Mara H. esta casada con Francisco de la Isla Mrquez quien es albail, y trabaja de manera independiente, ellos tienen 4 hijos de 10, 11, 15 y 16 aos, hace 3 aos Rosa inicio el negocio debido a la falta de dinero ya que el trabajo de su marido no los provee de un sueldo seguro, ella empez su negocio cuando se dio cuenta que por su casa no hay dulceras y hay muchos nios, as que decidi emprender un negocio inicio solo con una mesa y pocos dulces, la mesa la coloco afuera de su casa porque por ah pasan muchos nios que van a la escuela.

Ahora requiere un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca como bebidas y productos congelados adems de incrementar la variedad de dulces.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roco S. is an enterprising woman and unmarried. She began her business 10 years ago after much effort in buying her home and seeing that the income she earned at the hospital wasnt enough to pay her household expenses so she decided to sell medical equipment.

Now she needs a loan for US$1125, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy medical materials that will enable her to increase her services to her patients. With your support Roco will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Roco S. es una mujer emprendedora es soltera y empez su negocio hace 10 aos, despus de que con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar su casa y vio que el ingreso que reciba en el hospital era insuficiente para solventar sus gastos familiares por lo que se dedico a la venta de equipo medico.

Ahora requiere un crdito por US $ 1125 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de material medico lo que le permitir aumentar el servicio a sus pacientes. Con tu apoyo Roco podr hacer crecer su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase medical equipment

loan.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Nohem Ramrez buys and sells shoes by catalog. She is married and her husband works as a laborer in a business. They have four children ages 10, 8, 5 and 2. She began her business five years ago, as her husbands wages were low so she began the business to increase their household income. She obtained a loan to buy the catalogs and she began to sell to her friends.

Now she needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and complete her waiting orders. Lets help Nohem so that she may be able to continue to economically support her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Nohem Ramrez se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos por catalogo, es casada su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa y tienen 4 hijos de 10, 8,5 y 2 aos empez el negocio hace cinco aos, debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es bajo entonces ella empez el negocio para aumentar los ingresos del hogar consigui un prstamo para comprar los catlogos y empez a vender entre sus amistades.

Ahora necesita un apoyo econmico por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca y surtir pedidos pendientes. Ayudemos a Nohem para que siga apoyando econmicamente a su esposo.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia N. is an enterprising woman, married to Alejandro Domnguez Crdoba. They have 2 children, ages 9 and 10. She began her business 5 years ago, selling shoes by catalog to her friends and acquaintances. The motivation behind her business was the need to have additional income to meet her household expenses.

Today she needs a loan of US$250, which will be repaid in 6 months, as she has many orders to fill and with this money she will buy the shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Leticia N. es una mujer emprendedora esta casada con Alejandro Domnguez Crdoba quien trabaja como minero tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 10 aos. Su negocio lo empez hace cinco aos vendiendo zapatos por catalogo a sus familiares. Su principal motivacin fue la necesidad fue tener ingresos adicionales para los gastos de su casa.

Actualmente requiere un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses tengo muchos pedidos para surtir y con ese dinero comprare los zapatos.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina P. is married to Victor Manuel fajardo carreo who is in the business of buying and selling cattle. She has children whom are 9 and 11 years old. He started his business 15 years ago, and is known for selling clothes and shoes. Currently, her husband does not have a job and she has started a business to help her husband and to pay the bills of her family.

She needs a loan of $250 to pay back in 6 months in order to buy spring-summer clothing. She will use this loan to help support her family.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Josefina P. esta casada con Vctor Manuel fajardo carrero quien se dedica a la compra y venta ganado, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 11 aos. Su negocio comenz hace 15 aos, ya que conoci a una persona que le dejo en consignacin ropa y zapatos en ese momento su esposo no tenia trabajo y empez con el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo movida por la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su familia.

Ella requiere un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada primavera-verano. Con este crdito ella podr seguir apoyando a su familia.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a single mother of a four year old son. She needed to increase her income without neglecting her child who was very small. She did not have a job that provided for childcare and could not pay a private party nor had anyone that could take care of him. That is when she started to sell lingerie on her own. She started in 2004. Her friend was doing the same and shared with her the information of the stores where she could purchase inventory in Guadalajara. She started her business selling to her neighbors. Thanks to this she has been able to cover the costs of her little one.

She now needs financial help of USD $575 which she will repay in six months, to update her inventory and purchase merchandise of the season. With your help Luisa will be able to give her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Ma Luisa es madre soltera de un nio de 4 aos debido a esto necesitaba incrementar sus ingresos sin descuidar a su hijo quien estaba muy pequeo y no tenia trabajo que pudiera darle el beneficio de guardera ya que ella no poda pagar una privada y tampoco quien se lo cuidara, fue entonces que empez a vender por su cuenta lencera inicio en el 2004 , una conocida venda lo mismo, y le paso los datos de las tiendas en donde poda compra en Guadalajara, y empez el negocio vendiendo a sus vecinas. Gracias a esto ha podido solventar los gastos de su pequeo.

Ahora requiere un apoyo econmico por US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para renovar el inventario y comprar mercanca de temporada. Con tu contribucin luisa podr darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Claudia Gabriela

texts.es:
Claudia Gabriela E. is married to Jose Enrique Betancourt Garcia who works at a local company. They have a three year old son. She has a business selling traditional sweets. She started it two years ago with the help of her mother in law and her father. She operates in a space that belongs to her mother in law and her father gave her the initial capital to start the business. Due to her hard work and dedication the business has prospered.

She now need a loan of USD $250 which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise since the upcoming holidays are a good time for sweets vendors

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Claudia Gabriela E. esta casada con Jos Enrique Betancourt Garca quien se desempea como empleado en una empresa de la localidad, son padres de un nio de 3 aos, tiene un negocio de venta de dulces tpicos lo inicio hace 2 aos, con la ayuda de su suegra y su papa; en un local que su suegra le presto y su papa le facilito el capital inicial para arrancar el negocio. Debido a su empeo y dedicacin el negocio ha prosperado mucho.

Ahora ella requiere un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercanca ya que para los dulceros las fechas que se aproximan son buena temporada para las ventas

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena T. is a widow. She started her business because she could not cover the expenses of her home with the pension income from her husband. She could not even cover the basic costs because the pension was not enough. She decided to get into something that would suit her age and increase her financial income, that is how, eight years ago, she started selling food from a cart outside of a school. Later she rented a small space and that is where she is currently operating.

She needs a financial boost of USD $750 that she will repay in six months, to buy furniture since she needs tables, chairs and benches to improve her service to her customers. With your help, Elena will continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Elena T. es un mujer viuda, emprendi su negocio porque no alcanzaba a pagar los gastos de su hogar con el dinero de la pensin de su esposo, ni siquiera podan cubrir lo bsico, debido a que la pensin es insuficiente, decidi ocuparse en algo acorde a su edad que le permitiera aumentar los ingresos econmicos fue as como hace 8 aos inicio vendiendo en un carrito de comida afuera de una escuela, despus rento un local pequeo y ah es donde opera actualmente su negocio.

Ella requiere un apoyo econmico por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mobiliario ya que le hacen falta mesas, sillas y bancas para aumentar el servicio a su clientela. Con tu ayuda Elena podr seguir adelante.

loan.use: Purchase furniture

loan.name: Riwruok Eteko Youth Group

texts.en:
Kennedys business entails buying molasses in bulk and retailing the same for profit. He came up with this idea after realizing that molasses was readily available due to availability of a sugar industry in his area and he could make use of this opportunity to create a molasses business for a living to support his family. He is the sole provider for his family and this business is the one that has supported his family for over 5 years now. He is married with 4 children.
His business location is in a suburb town within Kisumu city called Muhoroni. There is a sugar factory called Muhoroni Sugar Factory from which he gets his molasses. His business is unique in that there are few people in the area who thought of establishing a business like his. The interruptions that occurred to his business due to the post-election violence slightly affected his supply and necessitated a refinancing. This is the basis for the current loan that he is seeking.
In his group he has a leadership role as the group Chairman. His leadership style is unique in that in addition to being a strong leader, he has devoted part of his time to counseling the group members affected by the post-election violence as a way of ensuring that the group business activities pick up faster. This has endeared him to his group members who view him as a servant leader who is both concerned about their businesses and their social needs. His group leadership qualities have thus ensured that his group is among the most united in the region. Another unique feature of the group that has led to their current cohesion is his highly participative type of leadership which has encouraged members to voice their opinions openly without fear of victimization.
Disclaimer: Kiva is working with OI-WEDCO to refinance businesses disrupted by Kenya's post-election violence. The group above has received loans from OI-WEDCO in the past and is now working to rebuild their businesses and to get back on their feet.Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loan.use: To refinance their business for recovery and expansion after the post election violence in Western Kenya

payment.comment: Riwruok has now repaid $332 of its loan and is 20% complete in its repayment schedule.

loan.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu is forty six years old and a widow with four children. One of her children is currently in Junior High School. She has been selling charcoal (one of the main sources of fire for cooking in most Ghanaian home) for three years now.

Ayishetu wants to use her new loan to buy to more bags of charcoal as her stock is running out. She is so happy that Sinapi educated her to save some money from her profits in order to cater for the house needs. She is a member of the group called Gold. The group uses group guarantee principles to exert peer pressure on members to repay the loan on time.

loan.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty four years old and married with three children. Her children are currently in school. She sells onions and iodated salt to her community folks.

Mary is not able to buy and stock more salt and onions due to her low working capital. She frequently travels to Kumasi to buy her products. But the frequent travel reduces her income and working capital. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of iodated salt and sacks of onions.

She a proud member of the group called Gold. The group members uses peer pressure on members to repay the loan on time.

Mary is seen above displaying her products.

loan.use: To buy more bags of iodated salt and sacks of onions

loan.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is forty one years old and she has six children. She has been preparing and selling of local dishes like banku (meal prepared from milled maize), fufu (pounded cassava and plantain or cocoyam), rice ball, and konkonte (meal prepared from cassava flour) for the past fourteen years.

Yaa prepares and sells her dishes in the evening to her customers. She now wants to prepare and sell dishes in the morning because her customers want food to eat in the morning. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more cassava, plantain, cocoyam, and soup ingredients and also to fix a shed as an eating place.

She is a member of the group called Exodus. Members of the group guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

Yaa is shown in the photo above.

loan.use: To buy more bags of cassava, cocoyam, spices, etc

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 51-year-old father of 5. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Ahmad sells birds. This is the third time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. Ahmad wants to buy other birds to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy other birds for re-sale

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 57-year-old father of 3. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mohamad sells clothing. This is the seventh time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. Mohamad wants to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise to increase his stock

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 55-year-old father of 2. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mustafa sells yogurt and milk. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Mustafa is planning to buy another cow to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy a cow for his dairy

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a single mother of four children. She was unable to acquire basic education which made her unemployable. With her skimpy income from her odd jobs, the needs of the family could not be met. She decided to take a loan from GHAPE with which she invested in the selling of fried puffballs and beans. It also raised money to pay school fees for her children.

She plans to invest in the selling of puffballs and beans. Her business will provide the community with breakfast at a cheaper cost since she is centrally located. Also she is the only one doing the business where she is located. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and repayment shall commence from the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loan.use: To purchase flour, sugar, yeast , groundnut oil, and beans

loan.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 41 years old and is a father of 4. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Walid sells fruits and vegetables. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Walid is planning to buy a pick-up truck to develop his business.

loan.use: to buy a pick-up truck

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal is a 33-year-old father of one child. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Talal sells sweets. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. Talal wants to buy provisions and is planning to purchase an ice cream machine.

loan.use: to buy provisions for his sweets shop

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is a 45-year-old father of 3. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Amin owns a place where you can find pool, computers/internet, etc. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. Amin wants to buy computers to develop his business.

loan.use: to buy computers for his business

loan.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 36-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jamal is in the food vending business and he also paints furniture. Jamal wants to buy provisions for his little shop. The increased amount generated from his business will help him pay for his wife's childbirth expenses.

loan.use: to buy provisions for his small business

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 39-year-old father of 6 who works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mahmoud owns a bakery. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Mahmoud wants to buy utensils for his business and is planning to change his oven.

loan.use: buy utensils and an oven for his bakery

loan.name: Sowra 2022-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret P.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a reporter over the radio.

Each week, Margret makes approximately 60 Sudanese pounds in profit, and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret is joined in her small group by Rejoice A., Regina Y., Joice I. and Anjelina D.. Rejoice A. has a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Regina Y. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Joice I. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Anjelina D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loan.use: expand the charcoal business

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is the owner and operator of a beauty salon in the town of Obuasi. She has operated the store for over eight years. She wants to use the proceeds of this loan to expand her product selection to include beauty creams, clothes, and footwear. She is also hoping to save so that someday she may move her salon to a better trafficked location.

Sarah is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To expand beauty salon products to include creams and footwear

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42963

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Ali owns a household goods store. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through A. Majmoua. He needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 45-year-old woman who works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has 3 children. Mariam sells women's clothing. This is the second time she's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for re-sale

loan.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 35-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 2 children. Haytham owns a grocery store. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loan.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 32-year-old man wno works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 2 children. Rabih owns a bakery. This is the first time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to buy a car for the bakery.

loan.use: to buy a car for his business

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 3 children. Ali is a car mechanic. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material for his business. The increased income generated from the input of this loan will help him pay his children's tuition fees.

loan.use: to buy material for his auto repair business

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 54-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 3 children. Ali owns a grocery store. This is the second time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He wants to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for his business

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 50-year-old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Alia sells clothing. This is the first time she's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loan.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is the owner and operator of a general store in Obuasi. She is requesting a loan to help expand the variety of products she can sell at her general store. During the day, Diana is a schoolteacher and her mother Rose operates the store in her stead. In the evenings, Diana returns to operate the stand. Rose is pictured above.

Diana is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To expand the variety of products for her general store

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42971

loan.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a 30-year-old woman who works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has one child. Hanane is a hairdresser. This is the second time she has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy material to sustain and develop her hairdressing business.

loan.use: to buy supplies to develop her business

loan.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a forty year old mother of four children. She has been selling palm nut soup and rice for the last four years. The proceeds of this loan will help her buy rice and palm nuts in larger quantities to help guard against price hikes. Eventually, Adwoa wants to use the proceeds of her loan to build her own house.

Adwoa is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy larger quantities of rice and palm nuts

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42973

loan.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: I. is a 37-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has one child. I. owns a bakery. This is the first time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to do the maintenance of his business's roof.

loan.use: for the maintenance of the roof of his bakery

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a forty nine year old mother of four children. She has been operating a small food stand in the town of Obuasi for over ten years. She prepares and sells rice balls, fufu, and banku. Fufu and banku are traditional Ghanaian dishes. Fufu is made of cassava, plantain, and cocoa yams, while banku is made from maize. The proceeds of this loan will allow Georgina to buy rice in larger quantities to guard against price hikes. Georgina hopes the savings from her business will help her build a new structure for her stand and to buy plastic tables and chairs.

Georgina is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loan.use: To buy rice in larger quantities

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42975

loan.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 40-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 5 children. Bassam is an automotive blacksmith. This is the fourth time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to buy a car for the business.

loan.use: to buy a car

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 33-year-old woman. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has one child. Fatima sells household products and accessories. This is the second time she's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for re-sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 63-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has one child. Hussein owns a grocery store. This is the first time he's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise

loan.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 59-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 4 children. Samir owns a dry-cleaning shop. This is the third time he's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to develop and enhance his business.

loan.use: to develop and enhance his business

loan.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Welcome to Fernandos Bar!! Fernando is 56 years old and is originally from Xilembene, in the Gaza Province. He is single and father of 2 daughters (25 years old and 11 years old) who live in South Africa with an uncle, as their mother died a couple of years ago.

Fernando lived in the capital Maputo most of his life, completing primary school and working as a government employee for the FRELIMO Political Party. When he retired 3 years ago, he decided to open a bar in Ponta DOuro, a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

The bar is located near the villages central open-air market and serves only Mozambican national brands. A glass of beer costs MTn 50 (US$ 2) and a bottle of rum, his most-sold product, costs MTn 150 (US$ 6). Fernando loves his bar and to serve clients. He has become quite close to some of them, and together they recently started to sell T-shirts and hats with Fernandos brand name (Fernandos Bar Ponta DOuro). These customers produce the clothing in South Africa and bring it to Ponta for him to sell at the bar; the profit is split 50/50. A T-shirt is sold for MTn 350 (US$ 14) and hats go for for MTn 50 (US$ 2). With the bar, Fernando makes from MTn 50,000 (about US$ 2000) up to MTn 200,000 (US$ 8200) per month, depending on the season and South African holidays, and with the sale of clothes he is making up to MTn 100,000 (US$ 4100) per month, and he is incredibly satisfied about it.

On top of supporting his daughters, Fernando also helps 3 sisters and his mother who live in Zipeto, near Maputo. He goes to Maputo around once a month to buy inventory for his bar and spends around MTn 5,000 (US$ 200) in food for his family (in total around 15 people). As he doesnt have a car, he goes with the minibus and pays MTn 300 (US$ 12.50) for the round-trip ticket.

Hluvuku is part of Fernandos life. He has already had 5 loans that he used in the bar (for expansion and increase of inventory), the first one in August 2005 of MTn 6,000 (US$ 250). This sixth loan of MTn 30,000 (US$ 1200) will also be used to increase inventory and prepare for South African holidays in April. In the future, Fernando plans ask for a leasing loan to buy a good car to help him buy merchandise and sell his signature clothing at close beaches. He also dreams of building a small house in Ponta (he currently lives in the back of the bar) and a kitchen in the bar to sell food to his clients. With his motivation, charisma and will to grow his business, he is definitely going to succeed in life.

loan.use: Increase inventory

loan.name: Azarias Fernando

texts.en:
Azarias is 31 years old and is originally from Inhambane. His parents died when he was very young, so he moved with his 3 brothers to Maputo, where he went to school until 5th grade. He is married and has 4 children: the 2 oldest girls (11 and 8 years old) already go to school.

In 1998 Azarias started working at Padaria do Papa, a bakery shop in Maputo, where he learnt how to bake bread. In 2002 he decided to open his own bakery shop, but Maputo would be very competitive, so he moved to Ponta DOuro, where wood was very accessible. Ponta DOuro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Azarias worked in construction to save money to build his own oven, and in 2003 he had already started to bake bread. He bakes between 300 to 560 loaves of bread per day, depending on the season. Each loaf is sold for MTn 3.5 (around US$0.15) and they sell out very fast, as Azarias is one of the best bakers in the region (he sells to the most famous hotels and restaurants in Ponta DOuro). A sack of 10 kilograms of wheat costs around MTn 200 (about US$ 8) and is enough to make 85 loaves of bread. His oven has the capacity to bake up to 100 loaves at once, so Azarias starts very early in the morning in order to finish baking by 6-7am. Azarias makes approximately MTn 7,500 (US$ 310) per month, and after paying expenses, including his 2 employees and the lady who helps with the house, his profit is around MTn 2,000 (US$ 83).

This is Azariass third loan with Hluvuku. The first two he used to buy raw materials (wheat, salt ,and yeast). This time Azarias plans to use his loan of US$ 350 to finish building a grocery store near the oven (which is inside his yard near his house), where he plans to sell other food products. Azarias believes that he can even start buying some inventory with this loan. The lady who works at his house will work at the grocery store, and his wife will take care of the house.

In the future, Azarias would like to have a fourth loan to build another house on his land to increase his income through rent. In Ponta DOuro many people come to work during the season and rent rooms, and Azarias believes this would be a good business venture. What an entrepreneur!

loan.use: Finish construction of grocery store and buy inventory

loan.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is thirty five years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling frozen fish and meat in Obuasi for six years now. She has not been able to buy more frozen products due to low working capital.

Afia wants to use this loan to buy more frozen products, like fish and meat, to increase her stock. She has been educated by Sinapi to save some money from her profits in order to take care of her children.

Afia is member of the group called Papa Ye (meaning Goodness). The members of the group guarantee for each other in repaying the loan.

Afia is the person pictured above wearing a pink dress. Beside her is her sister Janet.

loan.use: To purchase more frozen products, like fish and meat

loan.name: Narcisio

texts.en:
Narcisio is 37 years old and is originally from Inhambane. He is married and has 4 children. He went to school in Inhambane until 5th grade (in two more years he would have finished primary school) and in 1995 moved to Swaziland to live and work with his father.

In Swaziland, his father had been working in a lodge since 1989 and his boss employed Narcisio as well. After gaining his bosss trust, Narcisio was sent in 1997 to Ponta DOuro in Mozambique to look after 3 rental houses that the boss had there. Ponta DOuro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Narcisio looks after the houses, helps manage all the employees who work there, and does any repair that is needed. He earns R1600 per month (around US$ 200) and is able to save a bit from time to time. His wife Angelica also works in one of the houses as a cleaning lady and earns R600 (about US$ 70) monthly. Narcisio and Angelica live in a room in the back of one of the houses, mainly because Narcisio is also in charge of security. Their children sleep in a house Narcisio is building, but spend most part of the day with them.

Narcisio first approached Hluvuku in 2000 asking for a loan to start a grocery stand. As the value requested was denied, Narcisio decided to postpone the idea. In 2005 he bought a piece of land and decided to start building a house, so he asked again for a loan to buy construction material, which was approved. This is Narcisios third loan and will still be used to buy construction material. The house is almost ready; this time he will buy some missing windows and doors. Before borrowing though Hluvuku, Narcisio used to ask his boss to lend him money, but the boss would make him pay at once, normally deducting from his salary, and that was too much for him. Hluvuku in his opinion is very good because he repays an amount he can afford every month and still has money to support his family.

In the future, Narcisio intends to ask for a new loan to keep improving the house and once it is ready, he hopes to start building 2 others, as he already has other land close to his house. He dreams about giving each of his children a house to live in.

The picture shows Narcisio with his 9-year-old daughter Aida.

loan.use: Buy construction materials

loan.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a mother of four children and all her children are currently in school. She is twenty nine years old and has been selling frozen fish, meat, and charcoal (one of the main sources of fire for cooking in most Ghanaian homes) in Obuasi.

She wants to use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal and boxes of frozen fish to avoid price hikes. She also wants to rent a store, as she currently shares a store with her sister who is doing the same business.

Janet is a member of the group called David. David members guarantee for each other to repay their part of the loan on time.

Janet is pictured above wearing a red dress along with her sister.

loan.use: To buy more boxes of frozen fish and meat

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42984

loan.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is thirty six years old and has one child, who is currently in school. She has been selling home products--like tomatoes, vegetable oils, eggs, garden eggs, tin fish, pastas, spices, okra, and onions--in a very busy market in Obuasi. She has very good customer care and therefore many customers buy her products. She thanks Sinapi for training her.

Vida wants to use this loan to buy more products and a greater variety because customers are always demanding them.

She is a member of the group called David. The group exerts peer pressure on members to re-pay the loan.

Vida is pictured above busy in the market.

loan.use: To buy more varieties of products like tin fish, pastas, and spices

payment.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42985

loan.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is forty four years old and a mother of six children. The children are all currently in school. She has prepared and sold kenkey (meal prepared from milled maize) with fried fish for ten years now.

Juliana wants to use this loan to buy more bags of maize to prepare kenkey and also add to her business selling fresh yams. She believes it will increase her income, which will help her take care of her six children.

Juliana is a member of the group called David. The group exerts peer pressure on members to repay the loan.

Juliana is pictured above happily frying her fish.

loan.use: To buy more bags of maize and tubers of fresh yams

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42986

loan.name: eljana

texts.en: eljana is from trpci, a small village near the town of Prnjavor. She is not married and she works in a coffee shop which she owns. eljana can earn about US$ 400 monthly. This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 500. eljana will use it for supplies. Her wish is to expand what she offers in her coffee shop in order to increase her monthly income.

loan.use: for supplies to expand her little cafe

loan.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Mr. Boubacar D. is a fashion designer originally from Guinea; he is established in Ziguinchor, where he does business that is highly valued by his customers, especially women; he is requesting a loan to modernize his sewing machine and to buy various supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr Boubacar D. est un couturier d' origine guineenne ; il est etabli a Ziguinchor ou il mene des activites tres appreciees par sa clientele , surtout les femmes ; il sollicite un credit pour moderniser sa machine a coudre et acheter des fournitures diverses .

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine and various furnishings

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Sanela

texts.en:
Sanela was born in 1975 and she is married. She is from Filipovii, a small village near the town of Gorade. Her husband has a pension from his military service; he gets US$ 240 monthly as a pension. He also does seasonal work in agriculture together with Sanela. They have two children, 13 and 14 years old.

This is Sanela's second loan at MCO WWI. Sanela will use this loan in the amount of US$ 825 to buy a cow to raise. She intends to increase her monthly household income.

loan.use: to purchase a cow

loan.name: Sabahida

texts.en: Sabahida is a 46-year-old woman from Milatovii, a suburb of the town Gorade. Her husband works as a seasonal worker. When he has work, he can earn about US$ 400 a month. They work in agriculture, too. They need additional money because they have 3 children from 7-15 years old and they are all going to primary school. Sabahida wants to use this second loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy another cow to raise. She also wants to buy more sheep.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma was born in 1988 and she is married. She lives in Gorade with her husband and their one-year-old child. Her husband does seasonal work and he can earn about US$ 400 monthly. They are doing agriculture and Elma will use this second loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy livestock. Her wish is to expand the number of sheep they raise and increase monthly income for her family.

loan.use: For buying livestock

loan.name: Mirjana

texts.en: Mirjana was born in 1986 and she lives together with her parents in Foa. Their monthly family income is about US$ 400. This is her second loan through MCO WWI. Mirjana will use this loan for reselling cosmetic in order to expand the business and to help her family with additional money.

loan.use: to purchase cosmetics for re-sale

loan.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Mr Alcides Ramn P. is married to Irene Cabrera de P.. The couple has two daughters, Viviana who is 16 years old and Lady who is 7. Both girls hope to become doctors, and Alcides know only too well how much money this will take. Therefore he is trying his very best to save in order to be able to pay their university fees in the future.

Alcides began his work as a travelling salesman, selling clothing and haberdashery items. Then, in time, he was able to rent a premises in the municipal market, and slowly but surely he began to sell electronic goods. Alcides is an example of a good man, something which others can aspire to be. He did not receive any official business training, yet today he owns a shop which sells plenty of different items and is growing day by day.

Alcides has requested a loan as he wants to buy IT supplies such as pen drives, cds, keyboards, mouse etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Alcides Ramn P. est casado con Irene Cabrera de P., la pareja tienen 2 hijas, Viviana de 16 aos y Lady de 7 aos de edad sus dos hijas suean con ser doctoras en medicina, Alcides sabe que esta carrera es muy costosa y esta haciendo sus mayores esfuerzo ahorrando para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Alcides empez a trabajar como vendedor ambulante, venda prendas de vestir y artculos de mercera; luego de un tiempo el pudo alquilar un local comercial en el mercado municipal y poco a poco empez a vender artculos electrnicos. Alcides es un ejemplo de hombre, ejemplo de que las personas pueden progresar si se proponen, ya que el solo curso hasta la primaria, no recibi capacitacin en negocios pero aun as hoy da posee un comercio que vende bastante bien y da a da crece ms.

Alcides solicita el crdito pues con el quiere comprar insumos de informtica como pen drive, cds, teclados, mause, entre otras cosas.

loan.use: To purchase sound equipment, televisions and electronic goods

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs Elizabeth Gonzlez is married with 2 children Fiorela who is 4 and Richard who is 2, who are the love of her life and her greatest hope. She hopes that they can one day go to the university of their choice

Elizabeth is the owner of a sawmill. She knows about business as she has worked in a sawmill since a very young age. Her father also had a sawmill and he is the person who helped her set up one of her own.

Elizabeth hopes to continue to develop her business and improve its infrastructure by building platform. To achieve this, she needs a loan which she is now requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Elizabeth Gonzlez es casada, tiene 2 hijos Fiorela de 4 aos y Richard de 2 aos, que son la luz de su vida y su mayor esperanza, ella desea que ellos puedan culminar el da de maana una carrera universitaria de la preferencia de ellos.

Elizabeth es propietaria de un aserradero, ella conoce del negocio ya que desde muy joven trabajo en ello; su padre tambin tena un aserradero y fue l quien ayudo a Elizabeth a montar su propio aserradero.

Ella desea seguir creciendo en este negocio, y mejorar su infraestructura, construyendo un tinglado; para lograr esto ella necesita de un crdito que hoy da est solicitando.

loan.use: To improve the infrastructure of her sawmill, building a platform

loan.name: eljka

texts.en: eljka lives in the town Foa with her 11-year-old child who attends fifth grade at primary school. She is a widow and she has monthly pension in the amount of US$ 380. This is her third loan through MCO WWI . eljka intends to use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy material to make handicrafts. She is going to sell her handicrafts in order to expand the business and increase their monthly income for her and her son.

loan.use: To buy material for handicrafts

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Gimnez is 54 years old, and has been happily married to Mr Silverio Mercado, 59 years old, for 32 years. Silverio sells cattle. The couple has 7 children, four of whom are married and have left the family home. Two have moved to Spain to find better jobs and are now working, periodically sending a small amount of money home. The youngest, who is 24 years old, is the only child still living with the couple.

Isabel has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She owns a pantry from where she sells basic everyday food products. She began working in this business with the help of her husband who helped her with savings, so that she could set up her microbusiness. Isabel depends on a well-established customer base and furthermore, she offers home deliveries and supplies other businesses in the area.

She requests this loan in order to buy stock such as sugar, rice, noodles, flour, chorizo, maize flour, drinks etc, as well as pigs and chickens to rear. As a result, she will be able to offer a better supply to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Isabel Gimnez de 54 aos de edad est felizmente casada hace 32 aos con el Sr. Silverio Mercado de 59 aos de edad; Silverio se dedica a la compra y venta de animales vacunos. El matrimonio tiene 7 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya estn casados y viven en forma independiente, dos viajaron a Espaa en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y en la actualidad ya estn trabajando y envan peridicamente un poco de ayuda monetaria a sus padres, la menor de todos de 24 aos es la nica que est viviendo con sus padres.

La seora Isabel es comerciante hace ms de 10 aos, ella posee una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ella se inici en este rubro con la ayuda de su marido quien la ayudo con unos ahorros para que pueda montar su microempresa. Doa Isabel cuenta con una clientela bien formada y realiza adems repartos de sus mercaderas a domicilio y provee a otros negocios de la zona.

Solicita este prstamo para compra de mercaderas como azcar, arroz, fideos, harina, chorizo, harina de maz, bebidas en general, tambin cerdos y pollos para criar, de este modo abastecern mejor todos los pedidos de sus clientes minoristas y mayoristas.

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, flour, chorizo, maize flour, chickens, pigs, milk, herbs, oil, drinks etc.

loan.name: Miguela

texts.es:
Miguela A. is 34 years old, and is married to Reinerio Boagrn, who is 42. The couple has two daughters aged 8 and 15. The youngest is in school, while the oldest is in secondary school.

Miguela owns a pantry where she sells all sorts of basic, everyday food products. She started up her business with a small amount of capital, which has grown thanks to loans and savings which Miguela has been acquiring.
