In time, Miguela also invested her money and bought a television set and Playstation and now, in addition to the pantry, she also rents video games, charging by the hour. This is quite a popular service for the youngsters and children, who are her main customers.

Miguela hopes to continue developing her business, and her future project is rearing chickens, but she lacks capital and the infrastructure to do this. Now she is requesting a loan to buy stock for her pantry.

Miguela is stepping up her efforts as she wants to provide her daughters with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La seora Miguela A. de 34 aos es esposa de Reinerio Bogarn de 42 aos, el matrimonio tienen dos hijas de 8 y 15 aos, la primera va a la escuela mientras que la otra ya va al colegio.

Doa Miguela es duea de una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de artculos de primera necesidad y comestibles. Ella comenz su negocio con un pequeo capital el cual fue aumentando gracias a crditos y ahorros que Miguela fue adquiriendo.

Con el tiempo, Miguela tambin invirti su dinero en la compra de un televisor y un play station, y ahora, adems de la despensa, tambin tiene alquiler de video juegos, en donde cobra por hora; este negocio del alquiler de juegos es bastante popular entre los jvenes y nios que son sus principales clientes.

Miguela desea seguir creciendo, su proyecto en el futuro es tambin dedicarse a la cra de pollos, pero para ello aun le falta el capital y la infraestructura para hacerlo. Hoy da ella esta solicitando el crdito para la compra de mercaderas para su despensa.

Miguela redobla sus esfuerzos pues desea darle a sus hijas una buena educacin.

loan.use: To buy oil, flour, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, sweets, rice, fizzy drinks, tinned products etc.

loan.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Gorade. She lives together with her husband and their child who attends secondary school. Her husband does seasonal work and he can earn about US$ 120 monthly. They are doing agriculture. They are receiving a social help in the amount of US$ 800.

Emira wants to use this loan in the amount of US$ 825 to buy necessities for spring sowing of crops. Her intent is to increase monthly income for her household and secure crops for the coming growing period.

loan.use: To buy necessities for sowing spring crops

loan.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Mr Benigno P. is 43 years old, single, and is a carpenter. He has worked for several years in large furniture stores and has gained a lot of experience. He has worked for several years in the ACHON furniture factory, one of the most widely recognised in our country.

With such experience, and a good amount of savings, Benigno has decided to set up his own carpentry workshop. Benigno exclusively produces carved beds and, luckily, business is thriving.

The loan which he is requesting is to diversify the products which he makes, as he wants to start manufacturing wardrobes, bedside tables amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Benino P. de 43 aos, es soltero, y se dedica a la carpintera. Trabajo varios aos en grandes muebleras del pas, y fue as que adquiri mucha experiencia. Trabajo por varios aos en la fabrica de muebles ACHON, una de las mas reconocidas de nuestro pas.

Con basta experiencia y buen dinero ahorrado, Benino se decidi a montar su propio taller de carpintera. Don Benigno se dedica exclusivamente en fabricar camas torneadas y gracias a Dios le va bastante bien en el negocio.

El crdito que solicita es para diversificar el producto que fabrica, pues desea empezar a fabricar tambin roperos, mesitas, entre otros.

loan.use: Para la compra de madera

loan.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents Esteban Martnez, who is a construction worker, and Mara Franco de Martnez, who owns a grocery store.

Blas repairs motorcycles and has been in this business since he was very young, when he started working as an administrator in a motorcycle workshop in his neighborhood. Because his parents are of very humble means, he had to start working at a very early age. Thanks to his great entrepreneurial spirit and responsibility, today he owns his own workshop.

The workshop runs very smoothly. He has a solid existing customer base for which he performs motorcycle repairs and maintenance. This business is very profitable being that 80% of the population of the city of Caaguz counts on motorcycles as their means of transportation.

Blas has several objectives outlined for his life. One of them is to expand and modernize his workshops infrastructure to offer his customers better service and comfort.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a compressor, with which he will be able to repair motorcycle tires and in that way, diversify his services.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Blas es un joven de 20 aos de edad, es soltero y esta viviendo con sus padres, Esteban Martnez que se dedica a la construccin y Mara Franco de Martnez quien tiene una despensa.

Blas se dedica a la reparacin de motocicletas, se inicio en el oficio desde muy pequeo trabajando como secretario en un taller de motocicleta de su barrio, ya que sus padres son muy humildes el tuvo que trabajar desde temprana edad. Gracias a su gran espritu emprendedor y responsabilidad l ya hoy da posee su propio taller.

El taller marcha muy bien, ya posee una slida clientela formada a quienes realiza reparaciones y mantenimientos de sus motocicletas. Este negocio es bastante rentable ya que el 80 % de la poblacin de la ciudad de Caaguz cuenta con motocicletas como medio de transporte.

El tiene varios objetivos trazados en la vida, uno de ellos es la de ampliar y modernizar la infraestructura de su taller, para as poder ofrecer mejores servicios y comodidad a su clientela.

El cliente solicita el crdito para la compra de una compresora, con el cual podr reparar neumticos de motos y as diversificar su servicio.

loan.use: Purchase a compressor to diversify his services.

loan.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela P. is married to Miguel Mercado and has three children (Alejandro, Alexander who is 6 years old and Tania who is 11 years old). Her husband is a carpenter and makes wood bodywork for trucks. They dream that their children become dental and nursing professionals. Currently, they all study. Graciela says that she began in her profession when she was young since she was raised by her grandmother, who sold chipas (cheese bread snack), and she helped her in the kitchen. She now has her own business and sells basic necessities. The loan that she is requesting will be used for the expansion of her shop so that she can have a pantry. They hope that their country has new politicians who are interested more in the people.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Graciela P. est casada con el Sr.Miguel Mercado y tienen 3 hijos (Alejandro,Alexander de 6 aos y Tania de 11 aos de edad). Su marido es carpintero y fabrica carrocerias de madera para camiones. Suean que sus hijos sean profecionales odontologos y enfermera, actualmente todos estudian. La Sra. manifesto que se inicio en este oficio desde muy pequea ya que se crio con su abuela, quien venda chipas y ella le ayudaba en la cosina. Actualmente ya cuenta con su propio negocio y adems vende articulos de primera necesidad. El credito solicitado ser destinado a la ampliacin de su local comercial y de esa forma tener una despensa. Esperan que nuestro pais tenga nuevos gobernantes que se interesen ms por el pueblo.

loan.use: To expand and improve her shop.

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Mara started her clothes-selling business in Tampico, Tamaulipas, where she has a stand, is well-known and has many customers. When she arrived in Reynosa, she started off by renting a house from where she also sold clothing. Because she was earning well, she started to save in order to buy the house she was renting. She bought the house with what she had saved and continues to sell clothing in Tampico and Reynosa.

In Reynosa its easier to get merchandise, since she goes to the U.S. and buys bundles of clothing as well as buys in the flea markets at wholesale prices, which helps her to earn a good profit.

She now needs a loan of US $200, which she will repay in 5 months, to buy bundles of seasonal clothing and to be able to meet all her customers requests. She trusts that with Kivas support she will get her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Maria inicio su negocio de venta de ropa en Tampico Tamaulipas en donde tiene un local establecido, con muchos clientes y conocidos. Al llegar a Reynosa empieza rentando una casa, donde tambin realiza la venta de ropa, al ver que le deja buenas ganancias empez a ahorrar, ya que la casa que rentaba le ofrecian venderla, entonces con lo que tena ahorrado la compro y sigue con la venta de ropa en Tampico y Reynosa.

En Reynosa tiene mas facilidades para la compra de mercanca, ya que va a Estados Unidos y compra pacas de ropa, asi como tambien compra en los tianguis a precio de mayoreo lo cual le beneficia mucho por que le deja buenas ganancias.

Ahora ella necesita un crdito por US $200 que pagara a 5 meses para la compra de pacas de ropa de temporada, y asi poder cumplirle a todos sus clientes con los pedidos de ropa que tiene. Ella confa que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendr su crdito.

loan.use: Buy merchandise.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mara Z. is 28 years old and has been married for 8 years to Alexis Gmez, who is 36. The couple have two children; one is 6 years old and in 1st grade in a school in the city and the younger one is a year old.

For the past 4 years Alexis has been working in Spain and comes once a year to visit his family. Mara says that this is a painful situation as she struggles to raise her two small daughters by herself. Alexis sends money from his job every month. He emigrated to Spain in search of work since there were few job opportunities in Paraguay and he was forced to take extreme measures to get ahead.

With the money her husband sent, Mara set up a general store in her house. In this way she generates extra income without having to leave home and without neglecting her children, who are still small.

Since the income from the store is good, Mara would like to invest more into it and for this reason, she is asking for a loan with which to buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, such as: handbags, candles, wallets, toys, shoes, jewelry, cushions, vases, sheets, and other things that her customers have requested on various occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Mara Z. de 28 aos de edad esta casada hace 8 aos con el seor Alexis Gmez de 36 aos, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de 6 aos que ya va a al 1er. grado en una escuela de la ciudad y el otro ms pequeo de 1 ao.

Hace 4 aos Alexis est trabajando en Espaa, y viene una vez al ao a visitar a su familia, Mara cuenta que es muy dolorosa esta situacin, pues ella sola debe luchar con sus hijas pequeas para salir adelante. Alexis le enva mensualmente dinero de su trabajo, el emigro a este pas en busca de trabajo pues la escasez de fuentes de trabajo en nuestro pas lo obligo a buscar medidas extremas para conseguir salir adelante.

Del dinero que le envi su marido, Mara monto una despensa en su casa, de este modo genera un ingreso extra sin salir de su casa, y sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos que an son muy pequeos.

Como el margen de ganancias es muy interesante, Mara desea invertir ms en su despensa y es por ello que ella solicita un crdito con el que podr adquirir una mayor cantidad y variedad de mercaderas como: carteras, veladores, kits de billeteras, juguetes, zapatos, bijouterie, almohadones, jarrones, sbanas, entre otras cosas que sus clientes ya le han solicitado en varias ocasiones.

loan.use: Buy handbags, candles, wallets, toys, shoes, jewelry, cushions, vases, sheets and other goods.

loan.name: Kjghk's Group

texts.en: jkhfgkjhg

loan.use: gkhjgkjhg

loan.name: Meregildo

texts.es:
Meregildo is 48 years old and happily married for the past 19 years to Francisca Lpez, who is 37. The couple have a 14 year old daughter who is currently in the 9th grade in a local school. Meregildo says he is very proud of his daughter, as she is one of the smartest students in the school.

Meregilda currently has his own general store where he also sells quick meals. The business is very profitable. Meregildo is an entreprising man and says he likes to start up businesses. In spite of the fact that he never had a formal education, he knows how to manage his business, invest his money and save.

His latest investment was an ice-making machine, and it is going very well since where he lives has very high temperatures and people drink a lot of cold drinks and water. The most popular drink consumed is cold "mate" tea, which is the reason why the sale of ice cubes has been so successful.

Meregildo wants to continue progressing and expanding his business. Now he is requesting a loan with which he plans to buy two freezers so he can increase the sale of cold drinks and also sell frozen foods such as meat, fish and others.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Pugisi, Kiva volunteer.

El Seor Meregildo de 47 aos de edad esta felizmente casado hace 19 aos con Francisca Lpez de 37 aos. El matrimonio tiene una hija de 14 aos y que actualmente esta cursando el 9 Grado en una escuela de la zona. Meregildo cuenta que se siente muy orgulloso de su hija, ya que es una de las estudiantes mas brillantes de la institucin.

Don Meregildo actualmente cuenta con su propia despensa donde tambin se dedica a la venta de comidas rpidas. El negocio es bastante rentable, Meregildo se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor y dice que le gusta emprender negocios, a pesar de que no pudo acceder a una formacin acadmica el sabe como manejar sus negocios, invertir su dinero y ahorrar.

Su ltima inversin fue una mquina de hacer hielos en cubos, y le va bastante bien, ya que nuestro pas se caracteriza por sus altas temperaturas, las personas aqu consumen mucho bebidas fras y agua; la bebida ms popular y consumida es el terer que es como el mate pero fro, es por ello que su venta de hielos en cubo es todo un xito.

Meregildo quiere seguir progresando y ampliando su negocio, hoy solicita un crdito con el que piensa adquirir dos freezer para aumentar la venta de bebidas fras y tambin vender alimentos congelados como carne, pescado, entre otros.

loan.use: Purchase 2 freezers.

loan.name: Miryan

texts.es:
Miryan Roln is an enterprising woman of 35, who sells frangrances for women and men. For a number of years she lived in Argentina, a country she emigrated to in search of better job opportunities

After several years, she returned to Paraguay as she could not bear to be far from her family, especially her three daughters who today are 10, 15 and 16 years old. With the money she was able to save during those years, she has invested in the purchase of different goods to sell. Today she mainly sells perfumes and cellular phones.

Miryan makes her sales by visiting her customers door-to-door. Most of her products she buys at the request of her clients. She is asking for a loan with which to buy a new lot of merchandise, as she has new buyers who are requesting perfumes and new cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Miryan Roln es una emprendedora mujer de 35 aos que se dedica a la venta de perfumes para damas y caballeros, durante varios aos vivi en Argentina, pas al que emigr en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales.

Luego de varios aos, volvi a Paraguay, ya que no soportaba estar lejos de su familia especialmente de sus tres hijas que hoy da ya tienen 10, 15 y 16 aos respectivamente. Con el dinero que pudo ahorrar durante esos aos ha invertido en la compra de mercaderas varias para vender, hoy da esta comercializando principalmente perfumes y telfonos mviles (celulares).

Miryan realiza estas ventas a domicilio, visitando a sus clientes, tambin la mayoria de sus mercaderas las compra bajo pedido de sus clientes. Ella solicita el crdito con el que podr adquirir un buen lote de mercaderas, ya que posee nuevos compradores que le han solicitado perfumes y celulares nuevos.

loan.use: To buy different perfumes and cellular phones.

loan.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an experienced, hard-working entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. For the past nine years, she has operated a small grocery sales business. She currently sells a variety of canned foods and dry goods from a little space at a market near the bus station in Melitopol. Tatyana is married and has two children. In addition to taking care of her family, she also helps care for her elderly parents.

Tatyana has requested a six-month loan to give her additional working capital so she can purchase more inventory for her business. Tatyana has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine, repaying all previous loans with no delays. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loan.use: Increase working capital so as to purchase more inventory

loan.name: Clorinda Isidora

texts.es:
Clorinda Isidora G. L. is 47 years old, she studied up to fifth grade in secondary school. She has three children but only one still is dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Per.

She sells lamb stew, chicken stew and fried fish during the mornings, in the afternoons she sells a fixed menu or a la carte, and in the evenings she sells a traditional Peruvian soup. When she lived in the district of Carabamba she had a small house where she had a store, but the business did not go well and she decided to go to Otuzco. There she started off selling candy from a small stand selling candy, later she rented a commercial space where she set up her restaurant.

Clorinda has been working since she was 12 years old when she sold fruit every morning at the market and studied in the afternoons. She also has a van with which she provides transportation service to the town of El Sauco.

She belongs for the "Luchando por el Progreso" community bank, where she got her first loan which she invested in the purchase of basic products for her store. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ingredients to make some of her stews and part of the money will be used to buy a tire for her van.

Her greatest dream is to buy a house in the city of Trujillo and reopen her general store there.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Clorinda Isidora G. L. tiene 47 aos de edad, estudio hasta el quinto ao de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad , Per.

Vende caldo de carnero, caldo de gallina, pescado frito por las maanas; por las tardes vende men variado y platos a la carta y por las noches vende aguadito. Cuando viva en el distrito de Carabamba tenia una pequea casa en la que haba instalado una tiendita, el negocio no iba bien, tomo la decisin de viajar a Otuzco, en un pequeo puesto empez vendiendo golosinas, posteriormente alquilo un local en la que instalo su restaurante.

La seora Clorinda trabaja desde la edad de 12 aos, por las maanas venda frutas en el mercado y por las tardes estudiaba. Actualmente tambin tiene una combi que hace servicio de transporte al casero El Sauco.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por el Progreso lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirti para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Con el prstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses lo invertir para comprar los ingredientes para preparar algunos potajes y otra parte del dinero para comprar una llanta para su combi.

Su mayor sueo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y all reabrir su bodega.

loan.use: Buy ingredients for making stews and soups.

loan.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia S. is 43 years of age, and she is married to Aurelio Pereira who is 41 years of age. The couple has 5 children, of which 2 are in high school, 2 in primary school, and the last one, who is the youngest in their home, is not yet in school.

Nimia S. is a peddler and started out in this profession working for someone else. After a long period of time, and with sufficient experience and a little bit of capital, she started her own business, which today runs wonderfully. She already has a very important tool her motorcycle, which helps her transfer to greater distances in a shorter period.

Her plans for the future include setting up her own stand, but to do so she will require more capital. She dreams with having her children complete their studies and becoming successful professionals and assets to society. Her greatest wish for her country is change; that there is less corruption and more work to avoid massive emigration of her people to other countries, for many families suffer greatly due to the separation that it implicates.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Nimia S. de 43 aos de edad, esta casada , su esposo se llama Aurelio Pereira y tiene 41 aos de edad, el matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 van al colegio, 2 a la escuela primaria, y la ltima, la ms pequea de la casa, an no va a la escuela.

Doa Nimia S. es vendedora ambulante, se inicio en esta profesin trabajando para otra persona, despus de mucho tiempo y ya con experiencia suficiente y con un poco de capital, emprendi su propia microempresa, en la cual hoy da le va de maravillas. Actualmente ya cuenta con una herramienta muy importante, su moto que le sirve para trasladarse a una distancia mayor y en menor tiempo.

Sus planes para futuro es tener un puesto fijo, para ello necesitara de mayor capital, ella suea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales exitosos y tiles a la sociedad. Lo que mas desea para nuestro pas es el cambio, que haya menos corrupcin y mas fuentes de trabajo de este modo se pueda evitar la emigracin masiva de personas a otros pases, pues las familias sufren mucho por la separacin que eso implica.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise such as undergarments, towels, tablecloths, coolers, pot and pan sets, casseroles, perfumes, skirts, blouses, etc.

loan.name: Leokadiya

texts.en:
Leokadiya is a seasoned entrepreneur from the city of Stryi in the beautiful western part of Ukraine. She has been self-employed for twelve years as a market vendor and has gained much experience and knowledge along the way. Leokadiya currently sells a selection of household and toiletry supplies. She is constantly renewing her inventory and takes her business very seriously, working hard to ensure its success. Over the years, she has also been able to help a few other people start businesses. One of her goals for the future is to be able to buy her own store facility.

Leokadiya has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory, including bathroom gift sets, to sell in her kiosk. Profits from her business will allow her to continue to support her family she is married and has two children, a son, 25, and a daughter, 21, who is in college and will help her pursue her entrepreneurial goals.

loan.use: Purchase new inventory including bathroom gift sets

loan.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario is married and has 2 children, they are 2 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver.

Maria del Rosario started her business 3 years ago, when a friend invited her to sell shoes from a catalogue. She now sells the shoes to friends and neighbors.

Thanks to her dedication and hard work, the business has developed well and it has allowed her to help her husband to buy a house, which they are currently paying off.

Her dream is to pay her house as she wants to leave her children a state of their own.

The loan she requests is to buy more merchandise for the pending orders she already has. With your help, Rosario will be able to continue improving her business and she will ultimately pay her house as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara del Rosario es casada y tiene 2 nios uno de 2 aos y otro de 4 aos, su esposo trabaja como chofer. Debido a la necesidad que tenia de ayudar a su marido y poder obtener una casa propia para su familia gracias a su dedicacin y esfuerzo esta meta se vio lograda y actualmente la esta pagando ya que su deseo es poder formar un patrimonio para sus hijos, tiene 3 aos vendiendo calzado por catalogo con amistades y vecinos este negocio lo inicio por invitacin de una amiga.

Ahora necesita un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca y as surtir los pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda rosario podr seguir pagando su casa. .

loan.use: To buy more shoes in order to cover her pending orders

loan.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia C. Q. is 57 years of age, and has attended school until the 5th grade. She has five children but only one still depends on her for support. She lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad area of Peru. The business involves buying and selling small animals such as pigs, "huachos", chickens and guinea pigs, which after "fattening up", she kills to sell the meat. She also sells wheat and barley, and purchases cheese curds to re-sell. She buys the cheese curds, in bulk, in the Tupac Amaru village, which is located a few hours away in Otuzco. Many of her neighbors know her, and look for her so they can place orders for her products.

Through a family member, she joined the community bank "Mujeres del Olivo", and this is how she obtained her first loan of S /. 300.00. Most of this money was spent buying cheeses and animals. This new loan of S /. 1200.00, which she plans to pay off in four months will be used to buy 4 pigs, 3 "huachos", chickens and cheese.

Her biggest dream is to own a sales post in the market of Otuzco, where she will be able to offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Florencia C. Q. tiene 57 aos de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene cinco hijos en total pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes el cual despus de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. As tambin vende grano de trigo y cebada, adems compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender. Muchos de sus vecinos ya la conocen por eso siempre la buscan para hacerle algn pedido. El quesillo lo compra al por mayor en el casero Tupac Amaru ubicado a unas cuantas horas de Otuzco. Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Olivo lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 la mayor parte de este dinero lo invirti comprando queso y quesillo y otra la invirti comprando animales. Con el prstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprar 4 chanchos, 3 huachos, gallinas y quesos. Su mayor sueo es tener un puesto propio en el mercado de Otuzco, para all ofrecer sus productos.

loan.use: With this loan she will purchase more animals to sell through her business. (Con el prestamo comprara mas animales par a su venta)

loan.name: Rosa Martha

texts.es:
Rosa Martha sells steamed tacos and also sells cleaning products. Shes had the taco business for seven years and conducts it from her houses porch. She started selling cleaning products two years ago. She has three children. Currently, they are married and no longer live with her. When she began selling tacos, she did so in order to help her husband, a builder, pay for her childrens education expenses. Thanks to her effort and hard work, she has been able to progress.

Currently, she is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a cart from which she will sell tacos since now she does it from a table on her porch. With your help, Rosa will be able to give her customers better service and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Martha se dedica a vender tacos a vapor y tambin venta de artculos de limpieza, el negocio de los tacos lo tiene hace 7 aos lo hace en el porche de su casa, y la venta de artculos de limpieza lo inicio hace 2 aos, ella tiene 3 hijos actualmente ellos ya estn casados y no viven con ella. Cuando inicio la venta de tacos lo hizo para poder ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos a su esposo quien trabaja como albail en una constructora. Gracias a su empeo y arduo trabajo ha podido progresar.

Actualmente solicita un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un carrito donde instalarse y vender los tacos, ya que ahora lo hace en una mesa que coloca en el porche de su casa. Con tu ayuda rosa podr darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

loan.use: Purchase a taco cart.

loan.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria sells shoes by catalog, a business she began two years ago, selling at first to her colleagues at her husbands work and to her friends. Her husband is a welder in a business, and she wishes to support him in paying the household expenses, primarily the schooling of their two children ages 8 and 4, in addition she would like to renovate their home to be more comfortable for her family.

She is asking for US$250 loan, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and fill pending orders for the next season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo este negocio lo incio hace dos aos, vendiendo primero a los compaeros de trabajo de su esposo y sus amistades, su marido trabaja como soldador en una empresa, ella deseaba apoyarlo con los gastos familiares principalmente escolares de sus dos pequeos de 8 y 4 aos, adems deseaba acondicionar mejor su casa para ofrecerle mas comodidad a su familia.

Ella solicita un crdito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca y surtir pedidos pendientes de la prxima temporada.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Michail

texts.en:
Michail owns a small clothing sales business in the town of Morshin, in western Ukraine. He has space at a market area near the center of town where he sells a variety of mens and womens clothing. Michail has been in business for about eight years. He has benefited from having a great location with no other serious competitors close by. Michail is married and has one daughter for whom he is helping pay college expenses.

Michail has requested a loan to purchase a supply of sportswear to sell in his business. Michail has built an excellent reputation with Nadiya Ukraine and we are happy to be able to continue assisting him with his business.

loan.use: Purchase sportswear inventory

loan.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina Ruiz Daz is a peddler and sells clothing, footwear and undergarments. Despite having a teaching certificate, she found it very difficult to find employment and thus decided to sell merchandise door-to-door. Her husband, Jorge, is a public transportation driver and together they try to carry on facing daily life. Thanks to Romina having many acquaintances, she has good sales, and her own friends help her by telling their acquaintances about the items she sells. She says that the best advertising is that done through word of mouth.

Thanks to the earnings from her sales, some savings and help from loans, she was able to grow considerably. She bought a truck in which she travels and offers her merchandise to every home, and has been able to increase the variety and quantity of the merchandise she offers. Today, she is requesting another loan to purchase more merchandise since, with Gods help, she continues to gain demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Romina Ruiz Daz se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir, calzados y lenceras. A pesar de tener un ttulo de docente, a ella le resulto difcil hallar un trabajo, por lo que decidi dedicarse a vender mercaderas a domicilio. Su marido, Jorge, es chofer de una lnea de transporte pblico y juntos tratan de salir adelante enfrentando la vida diaria. Gracias a que Romina tiene muchos conocidos, tiene buenas ventas, y sus mismos amigos le ayudan comunicndoles a otros conocidos de las cosas que ella vende. Ella dice que la mejor publicidad es la que se hace de boca en boca.

Gracias a las ganancias de sus ventas, un poco de ahorro y tambin ayuda de los crditos ella pudo crecer bastante, compro una camioneta con la que sale a recorrer casa por casa ofreciendo sus mercaderas, tambin a aumentado la variedad y cantidad de mercaderas para ofertar. Hoy da ella solicita un nuevo crdito para poder comprar ms mercaderas, ya que gracias a Dios, ella tiene cada vez mas demanda de productos.

loan.use: Purchase different brands of athletic footwear, undergarments, women's clothing, sheet sets, kitchen appliances, among other things.

loan.name: Yolanda Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs M. started making floral arrangements since a very early age. It is a work that inspires her and moreover, she has enough time to take care of her business and of her children.

She started with a small investment and until now she has been able to supply her shop with the best materials to create the floral arrangements that her customers like.

Her sister also works with her; she drives to the city, where a big part of her clients are located, in order to deliver the floral arrangements.

Yolanda Maribel lives with her 2 sons and she sustains them with the income she gets from her flower shop.

She now requests a loan to buy supplies as artificial flowers, vases, flowerpots, sponge, etc to create her floral arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra M., comenz aprendiendo su oficio D. la Floristera a temprana edad, es algo que la inspira y le da el tiempo necesario para atender su negocio y poder estar pendientes D. las necesidades D. sus hijos, inicio invirtiendo poco en la elaboracin D. flores hasta la fecha a podido surtir su negocio con materias primas ptimas para la elaboracin D. los arreglos florales mas buscados ,en el negocio colabora su hermana que se dedica a llevar los arreglos florales a la zona metropolitana ya que parte D. su cartera D. clientes esta ubicada en ese sector.

Su grupo familiar esta compuesto por dos hijos D. la solicitante que viven actualmente en su vivienda y que ella sostiene con sus ingresos ella actualmente esta solicitando el crdito ya que tendr que hacer una fuerte inversin en la compra D. materia prima para la elaboracin D. flores.

loan.use: To buy supplies as artificial flowers, flowerpots, vases, sponge, etc to create her floral arrangements

loan.name: Roma

texts.en:
Roma has his own small business offering electronics and technical repair services. He and his wife, Erika, live in the western Ukrainian city of Mukachevo, not far from the border with Hungary and Slovakia. Roma has been in business for about four years. In a typical month he makes around $300 in profit. Roma has proven to be a reliable business owner with a stable enterprise.

Roma has requested a loan to increase his available working capital. He would like to expand his business in the future. This loan will help him as he works to pursue his goals and continue providing for the needs of his wife and himself .

loan.use: Increase working capital

loan.name: Koudzo

texts.en:
Mr. Koudzo A. is 33 years old and the father of 4 children. He runs a general store in Aventonou, a small village about 120 kilometers from Lom, the Togolese capital. This proximity to the capital facilitates frequent trips back and forth to restock his store.

Mr. A. hopes to use this loan to buy 15 bags of rice, 10 bags of powdered sugar, 10 bottles of cooking oil, 15 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods to resell in Aventonou. He hopes that these purchases this will help to boost his sales so that he can support his family and provide for his community.

loan.use: To buy 15 bags of rice, 10 bags of powdered sugar, 10 bottles of cooking oil, 15 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods

loan.name: Sara Erlinda

texts.es:
Mrs R. launched her business recently. She started buying one quintal of corn (aprox. 100pounds), as that was all she could buy with the money she had. Now, she buys between 15 and 25 sacks of corn which she sells during the week.

This has been a very helpful business for Sara because her husband is sick and he can not work. Therefore, the business allows her to cover all her household financial needs as well as his medicines.

This is the first loan she requests and her credit record shows that she knows how to responsibly manage her accounts.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. R. inicio su negocio con poco, aproximadamente con un quintal de maiz ya que no contaba con los ingresos necesarios para poder invertir una cantidad mayor de dinero, en la actualidad compra los quintales a un proveedor de la zona entre los cuales anda por un promedio de 15 a 25 sacos de maz que esta vendiendo en el transcurso de la semana.

El negocio le a sido de gran ayuda ya que su esposo actualmente no trabaja por problemas de enfermedad, el negocio le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de la vivienda y los de medicamentos de su esposo este es su primer crdito con la institucin, pero en sus registros muestra ser una persona responsable con sus cuentas.

loan.use: To buy more corn and other products necessary for her business as firewood and lime

loan.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita is a young mother and entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Ukraine. She is married and has two children. Vita helps support her family with a small business selling plumbing supplies at a market in Mukachevo called the Kompact market. Vita has been in business for about three years. By offering a necessary product that is in good demand and by working hard, she has done well with her business and it has been profitable.

Vita has requested a loan to increase her working capital which will allow her to broaden her assortment of inventory and help open a new vending location. We are happy to have this opportunity to support Vita in her endeavors and look forward to how her business will do in the future.

loan.use: Increase working capital so as to expand her inventory

loan.name: Akou

texts.en:
Ms. Akou K. is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children. Fish is a staple part of the majority of the populations diet in this region and many women, like K. Akou, work in the business of preparing fish for consumption. While many women smoke these fish, Akou fries them in oil, making them crispy and tasty.

With this loan, Akou would like to purchase 10 cartons of fish and 5 bottles of oil to increase her sales and continue to satisfy her customers. By replenishing her inventory Akou will be able to continue to provide for her family by frying and reselling fish to the local population.

loan.use: To purchase 10 cartons of fish and 5 bottles of oil

loan.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Mara Magdalena T. has always been a very enterprising woman, she is married and her husband works as a security guard at Pemex (Mexican Oil Company). Together they have 2 children, who are 5 and 2 years old.

Maria started her business 2 years ago, she was with her mother and sisters and they were going through a shoes catalogue. They planned to buy 5 pairs of shoes as the prices of the normal shops seemed very high in comparison to those in the catalogue. Instead, they decided to buy catalogues and start selling shoes to their family and neighbors.

She liked the idea of selling shoes during her free time as she could keep taking good care of her children. This business has also allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses and to improve their house.

Maria asks for a 300 USD loan that she will pay within 3 months. With this loan she will buy more merchandise as she has an order of 22 pairs of shoes. Maria is very happy because her sales have been going very well and with your support, her business will keep on flourishing.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara Magdalena T. siempre ha sido una persona muy emprendedora, es casada su esposo trabaja como transito en Pemex, son padres de dos nios de 5 y 2 aos.

Su negocio empez cuando la invitaron a vender zapatos, en sus ratos libres y le agrado la idea ya que no descuidara a sus hijos. Inicio hace aproximadamente 2 aos, la idea surgi un da platicando con sus hermanas y su mama, todas ellas estaban escogiendo zapatos de un catalogo y le pareci que los precios estaban muy altos, entre todas iban a comprar cinco pares de calzado, y despus de pensarlo decidieron mejor adquirir los catlogos e iniciaron as vendiendo a sus familiares y vecinas.

Gracias a esto ha podido ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su hogar as como acondicionar mejor su casa.

Actualmente requiere un crdito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses par comprar mercanca ya que tiene pendiente por surtir 22 pares de zapatos ella esta muy contenta la ha ido bien con sus ventas. Con tu apoyo magdalena seguir prosperando.

loan.use: To buy shoes in order to fulfill a current order of 22 pairs of shoes

loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is married and has 5 children including 3 who are married and 2 who are single and still live with her and her husband. The younger children are a 19-year old son who works and a 15-year old daughter who is in school. Her husband works as a laborer at Pemex. Faced with the need for an extra income to meet all of the family's bills, she went to work reselling jewelry and shoes that she bought from catalogs. She started about 2 years ago, selling jewelry to her husband's co-workers and relatives, and later added shoes. Because of her hard work, business has been strong. Her son helps her collect money from her customers.

She's asking for your loans in order to pull together US$950, to be repaid in 6 months, for buying jewelry with cash and so be able to offer it more cheaply and to buy shoes for the spring-summer season. With your help, Maria Luisa will continue moving her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Mara Luisa es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estn casados y 2 solteros aun viven con ellos. Los menores son un hijo de 19 aos que trabaja y su hija de 15 aos que estudia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en Pemex y ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para completar con todos los compromisos de su familia fue que ella se dedico a la venta de joyera y zapatos por catalogo. Inicio hace aproximadamente 2 aos vendiendo joyera con los compaeros de su esposo, y familiares, y despus aadi la venta de calzado por catalogo. Debido a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien con este negocio, y su hijo le ayuda con la cobranza a sus clientes.

Ella solicita de sus contribuciones para reunir US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir joyera de contado y poder ofrecerla mas econmica, y comprar zapatos para esta temporada de primavera-verano. Con tu ayuda Luisa seguir adelante con su negocio.

loan.use: Buy merchandise.

loan.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Koffi K. is 34 years old and is the married father of one child. He owns a photocopying and typing services business in Adta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lom, the capital of Togo. As most people in his area do not own computers or copy machines or know how to type, his services are often in demand and keep him very busy.

With this loan, Koffi hopes to buy another photocopy machine, as his current one can barely keep up with his workload. He also wishes to buy a few reams of paper. Koffi hopes that with this loan he will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers and to use the revenue from his business to pay for his childs schooling.

loan.use: To buy paper and a new photocopy machine

loan.name: Yungueitas Group

texts.es:
The association known as "Yungueitas" has been part of the ProMujer family for approximately 6 years. They work with the Panamericana branch of the ProMujer organization, located in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. With their service consultant Ada del Castillo they form a very well organized and tight knit group.

With the association exist a number of economic activities such as carpentry (furniture, doors, picture frames), crafting of sweaters and scarves and sales of raw chicken. Some of the members also have a small store though their principal activity is sales of food they prepare themselves, which they offer in the fairs in the city of El Alto. They offer their clients a variety of delicious Bolivian dishes, such as an exquisite chicharron (deep fried seasoned pork ribs), fricase (a spicey pork stew), chayro (also a tasty stew) and other dishes, particulary traditional dishes.

The majority of the members are married with numerous children. They bring their children to work with them and help their spouses cover the household expenses. Although their children are school age and need to study and have standard comforts in their homes, the women say that the live in small living spaces, that is to say, with an average of 5 people sleeping in the same room.

The Yungueitas group needs capital for the purchase of raw materials for their businesses, with the objective of growing their businesses and thereby their incomes, so that they will be able to rent places to live that will provide their children with more comfortable environments and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

LA ASOCIACION "YUNGUEITAS" YA FORMA PARTE DE LA FAMILIA DE PRO-MUJER HACE SEIS AOS APROXIMADAMENTE, TRABAJAN EN EL CENTRO FOCAL PANAMERICANA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE RIO SECO DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO. JUNTO A SU ASESORA DE SERVICIOS ADA DEL CASTIILO FORMAN UN GRUPO MUY BIEN ORGANIZADO Y UNIDO.

EXISTEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES DENTRO LA ASOCIACION COMO SER: TRABAJOS DE CARPINTERIA ( MUEBLES, PUERTAS, MARCOS), TAMBIEN EL TEJIDO DE CHOMPAS Y CHALINAS, LA VENTA DE POLLO CRUDO, ALGUNA DE ELLAS TAMBIEN CUENTA CON UNA PEQUEA TIENDA PERO LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE COMIDA PREPARADA POR ELLAS, ESTA LA OFRECEN EN LAS FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, OFRECIENDO A LA CLIENTELA VARIEDAD DE PLATILLOS COMO SER UN EXQUISITO CHICHARRON, FRICASE, CHAYRO Y OTROS PLATILLOS POR LO GENERAL TRADICIONALES.

LA MAYORIA SON CASADAS CON NUMEROSOS HIJOS, LO QUE LES LLEVA A TRABAJAR Y AYUDAR A SUS PAREJAS EN LA ECONOMIA DE SUS HOGARES. PUESTO QUE SUS HIJOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y NECESITAN ESTUDIAR Y TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD EN SUS CASAS, ELLAS NOS CUENTAN QUE VIVEN EN PEQUEOS AMBIENTES, ES DECIR EXISTE UN PROMEDIO DE 5 PERSONAS QUE DUERMEN EN UNA MISMA HABITACION.

EL GRUPO YUNGUEITAS NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA SU NEGOCIO CON EL OBJETIVO DE QUE ESTE CREZCA Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS, DE ESTA MANERA PODER ALQUILAR AMBIENTES MAS COMODOS PARA SUS HIJOS BRINDANDOLES ASI CONDICIONES DE VIDA.

loan.use: Capital for the purchase of raw materials

loan.name: Florencia Cena

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia Cena V. D. R. is 45 years old and studied until the second graD.. She has five children but only 3 are dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the department of Libertad, Peru. In the general store that she opened in her home, she sells a variety of essential products, such as cereal grains, chicken, bread, vegetables, cleaning products, sweets, soft drinks and beer. When she began the business she began with very little and didnt have much variety. She would buy products in arrobas (units of about 25 pound), and now she buys them by the sack. She belongs to Communal Bank Mujeres del Olivo, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles (about $100), and with this money she bought a variety of products to stock her store. With this loan of 600 soles (about $225), which will be repaid over 4 months, she will buy 5 sacks of sugar, 2 bottles of oil and sweets. Her greatest dream is to open another store in the center of Otuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Florencia Cena V. D. R. tiene 45 aos D. edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero solo tres dependen D. ella. Vive en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. En la bodega que ha implementado en su domicilio venD. una variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad, granos D. cereales, carne D. pollo, pan, verduras, productos D. limpieza, golosinas, gaseosas y cerveza. Cuando se inicio en este negocio empez con muy poco no tenia mucha variedad, compraba por arrobas a diferencia, ahora compra por sacos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Olivo lugar donD. obtuvo su primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compr diversos productos para surtir su bodega. Con el prstamo D. S/. 600.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprar 5 sacos D. azcar, 2 cajas D. aceite y golosinas. Su mayor sueo es instalar otra tienda pero en el centro D. Otuzco

loan.use: Purchase more products to sell

loan.name: Justa

texts.es:
Mrs. Justa C. E. is 50 years old and studied up to the 6th grade. She has 3 children but only two still depend on her. She lives in the El Cortijo sector in the district of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru.

Justa is skilled in crafting all types of items through needlework. She makes sweaters for adults and children, matching wools sets (sweater, scarf and hat) and weaved tablecloths. Since she was very young she has worked making clothing, primarily sweaters.

Through a neighbor she learned about the community bank "Nuevo Per" where she obtained her first loan of 30000 soles (Peruvian currency), with which she purchased threads of many colors with which to make sweaters. With the loan of 80000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a larger quanity of wool, the equivalent of 60 of the spools she buys now.

Her greatest dream is to buy an industrial machine with which to make her products. The machine would allow her to improve the quality of the sweaters and produce them more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Justa C. E. tiene 50 aos de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector de El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad Per.

La seora Justa tiene habilidad para elaborar todo tipo de tejidos, elabora chompas para adulto y nios, conjuntos de lana y tapetes. Desde que era muy joven se dedicaba a tejer algunas prendas, mayormente chompas.

Por medio de una vecina pudo integrar el Banco Comunal Nuevo Per lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compr hilos de todos los colores para elaborar chompas. Con el prstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprara un moo de lana que equivale a 60 madejas de lana.

Su mayor sueo es comprar una maquina industrial para que elaborare sus tejidos, de esa manera mejorar la calidad de las chompas y elaborarlas con mayor rapidez.

loan.use: With the loan she will buy a large quantity of wool in order to make her products.

loan.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Francisca M. J. is a 49 year old woman who attended school through the third grade. She has six children, but only one is one child still at home. She lives in the Otuzco province in the La Libertad department of Peru. Maria sells items in the Otuzco market. Her business offers fruit, vegetables, and wool items. For the past 15 years she has been selling in this market, and up to the present it has worked out very well for her. She began selling only wool items and thread. Little by little her business has grown, and she has offered additional items for sale. Maria joined the Mujeres del Olivo community bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase various items to sell. With this 500 sol loan, ($200) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 15 bats of wool, 10 boxes of fruit, and a variety of vegetables. Her greatest dream is to keep working and saving to purchase her own home, as she now lives in a place which she rents.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Maria Francisca Monzn Jimnez tiene 49 aos de edad, estudio solo hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene en total seis hijos pero solo uno depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. Ella vende en condicin de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y lanas. Hace 15 aos que vende en este lugar y hasta la actualidad le ha ido muy bien, primero se inicio vendiendo lanas e hilos. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, ha variado con otras mercera. Ella integra el Banco Comunal Mujeres del Olivo lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos para surtir su puesto. Con el prstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 15 moos de lana, 10 cajas de frutas y variedad de verduras . Su mayor sueo es seguir trabajando para construir su casa ya que donde vive es alquilado

loan.use: This loan will be used to purchase fruit, vegetables and wool for sale.

loan.name: Sofia Magda

texts.es:
Mrs. Sofia Magda M. A. is a 39 year old woman who attended school through the second grade. She has one child still at home. She lives in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the La Libertad department of Peru. Sofia raises birds particularly chickens, and has set up a small farm at her home. Additionally, she prepares chicken sausage in the afternoons which she makes from the chickens that she raises. On weekends she makes cebiche (a fish dish made with citrus juice) and pasta dishes. She is well known among her neighbors for offering tasty cooking at a reasonable price. Sofia joined the Nuevo Peru community bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase chicks and feed. With this 500 sol loan, ($200) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 30 chickens, feed, and medicine to protect her chickens from sickness. Her greatest dream is to outfit a fully equipped restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Sofa Magda Martnez A. tiene 39 aos de edad, estudio hasta el segundo ao de secundaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector de El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad Per. Se dedica a la crianza de aves en especial pollos, en su domicilio ha ambientado una pequea granja para criar a los pollos; adems por las tardes prepara salchipollo, para lo cual aprovecha los pollos que ella misma cra y los fines de semana prepara cebiche y tallarines. Los vecinos ya la conocen porque aparte de tener una buena sazn lo vende a un precio muy cmodo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal Nuevo Per lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios pollos bebes y alimento balanceado. Con el prstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 30 pollos, purina y medicina para proteger a las aves de cualquier enfermedad. Su mayor sueo es ambientar un restaurante con todos los implementos, en su casa.

loan.use: With this loan 30 chickens will be purchased, along with feed and other items for the business.

loan.name: Susana Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Susana Luz Q. R. is a 45 year old woman who attended school through the sixth grade. She has 4 children, with one still living at home. Susana lives in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the La Libertad department of Peru. She sells food outside her home every weekend, offering chicken sausage, potato sausage, tallarines (a pasta dish), lomitos (a South American sandwich), and other soup-style dishes. During the week she works at a kindergarten near her home; selling food only on Saturdays and Sundays. Susana is a member of the Nuevo Peru community bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase necessary cooking ingredients. With a 1000 sol loan ($375) which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a box of oil, a sack of rice, a sack of potatoes, and a package of noodles and vegetables. Her greatest dream is to obtain a location where she can open a large restaurant complete with all of the cooking equipment.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Susana Luz Q. R. tiene 45 aos de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene cuatro hijos en total pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo departamento La Libertad Per. Vende comida todos los fines de semana fuera de su casa. Prepara salchipollo, salchipapa, tallarines, lomito y otros potajes. Entre semana trabaja en un jardn de nios cerca de su domicilio. Desde aos atrs venda men diariamente pero debido a que consigui el trabajo en el jardn, solo vende los sbados y domingos. La seora Susana integra el Banco Comunal Nuevo Per lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el prstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual ser cancelado en seis meses comprar una caja de aceite, un saco de arroz, un saco de papas, un paquete de fideos y verduras. Su mayor sueo es conseguir un local en donde instale un gran restaurante con todos sus implementos.

loan.use: The loan with be used to purchase rice, oil, etc. for the business.

loan.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia P. D. R. is a 62 year old woman. She attended school through the second grad, and has 5 children, who all now live independently. She resides in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the department of La Libertad, Peru. Teodocia operates a small convenience store in the living room of her home, which she opened with money that she saved while working at the school near her home. She began by purchasing just a few products, and over time she has added a greater variety of items. She is a member of the Nuevo Peru community bank, where she obtained her initial loan of 300 Soles. With this money, she purchased a various products to sell in her store. With a loan of 800 Soles ($300), which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase of 5 cases of beer, rice, sugar and oil. Teodocias greatest dream is to equip and modernize her store.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Teodocia P. D. R. tiene 62 aos D. edad. Estudio hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene en total cinco hijos y ninguno ya depenD. D. ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en el distrito D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad Per. Ella tiene una pequea bodega en la sala D. su casa en la que venD. productos D. primera necesidad, gaseosas y cerveza. Su negocio lo inicia con el dinero que iba ahorrando cuando trabajaba en un colegio cerca D. su casa, empez comprando pocos productos con el tiempo ha ido teniendo mayor variedad. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Per lugar donD. obtuvo su primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro diversos productos para surtir su bodega. Con el prstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en seis meses lo invertir comprando 5 cajas D. cerveza, arroz, azcar y aceite. Su mayor sueo es implementar y modernizar su bodega.

loan.use: With this loan, she will purchase additional items for sale

loan.name: Vicky Nila

texts.es:
Vicky Nila Lzaro Chvez is 34 years old, she studied administration but for personal reasons was unable to practice her profession. She has one child who is dependent on her. She lives in the El Cortijo section of the district of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Per.

In her mother-in-laws house she has set up a spacious general store where she has a variety of groceries, candies, gifts, supplies, CDs, soft drinks and beer. Most of her neighbors come to her store to buy because they always find what theyre looking for. Her business started off with just a few products, in a small space in her mothers house. Later she started increasing her products and needed to find a larger space.

Vicky belongs to the "Nuevo Per" community bank where she obtained her first loan with which she bought different products so that she could have some variety in her store. With another loan, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy school supplies since that is what is always in demand at the start of the school year and she will also buy groceries and soft drinks.

Her greatest dream is to buy a van so she can provide school transportation and in that way have another souce of income for her household. She also would like to buy a home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Vicky Nila Lzaro Chvez tiene 34 aos de edad, estudio la carrera de administracin pero no ejerci su carrera por motivos personales. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad Per.

En la casa de su suegra ha instalado una bodega muy amplia, en la cual tiene una variedad de abarrotes, golosinas, regalos, tiles, CDS, gaseosas y cervezas. La mayora de sus vecinos recurren a comprar en su tienda ya que siempre encuentran lo que buscan. Su negocio lo inicio con muy pocos productos , en un pequeo espacio en la casa de su mam. Posteriormente fue incrementando sus productos y tuvo la necesidad de conseguir un local ms grande.

La seora Vicky pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Per lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro diversos productos para tener variedad en su tienda. Con el prstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprar tiles escolares ya que por campaa escolar siempre le solicitan y tambin comprar abarrotes y gaseosas.

Su mayor sueo es comprar una combi para hacer movilidad escolar, de esa manera tener otro ingreso en su hogar. As tambin desea comprar una casa.

loan.use: Buy more goods for her general store.

loan.name: Vilama Del Rocio

texts.es:
Vilma del Roco T. C. is 33 years old and studied as far as sixth grade of primary school. She has one child who is still dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Per.

Her business is the purchase and sale of small livestock, such as pigs, calves, chickens and guinea pigs, which after fattening them up, she slaughters and sells the meat. She also sells wheat and barley grain as well as buys curd and cheese which she resells.

Through one of her relatives, she was able to join the "Mujeres del Olivo" community bank, where she obtained her first loan which she used to buy a sack of wheat grain, a sack of barley grain and small livestock. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.

Her greatest dream is to have her own house in the city of Trujillo

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Vilma del Roco T. C. tiene 33 aos de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per.

El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes los cuales despus de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. As tambin vende grano de trigo y cebada, adems compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender.

Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Olivo lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compr un saco de grano de trigo, un saco de grano de cebada y animales menores. Con el prstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 4 chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.

Su mayor sueo es tener una casa propia en la ciudad de Trujillo

loan.use: Purchase pigs, chickens and guinea pigs for resale.

loan.name: Cira Asteria

texts.es:
Ciria Asteria Gmez R. is 53 years old; she studied as far as second grade in primary school. She has six children but only three are still her dependents. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Per.

Every Saturday and Sunday she works as a traveling vendor at the Otuzco market, selling vegetables such as: carrots, green onions, coriander and others, as well as medicinal plants and flowers. During the week she works on her farm, where she raises small amounts of grains and potatoes; part of this she consumes and the rest she sells.

She is a member of the "Sagrado Corazn de Jess" community bank, where she obtained her first loan with which she bought all types of vegetables. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy carrots, onions, coriander and flowers.

Her greatest dream is to buy land where she can build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Cira Asteria Gmez R. tiene 53 aos de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene seis hijos en total pero solo tres aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per.

Ella vende los das sbados y domingos en condicin de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco, vende verduras como: zanahoria, cebolla china, culantro y otros; as tambin plantas medicinales y flores. Entre semana se dedica a la chacra en la cual cosecha un poco de granos de cereales y papa parte de estos productos los consume y la otra parte los vende.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazn de Jess lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro verduras de todo tipo. Con el prstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual lo pagara en un periodo de cuatro meses comprar 4 arrobas de zanahoria, dos cientos de cebolla, un paquete de culantro y tambin flores.

Su mayor sueo es comprar un terreno para construir su casa.

loan.use: Purchase carrots, onions, etc. to sell

loan.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Digna Emerita Gmez Martnez is 37 years old and studied as far as third grade of primary school. She has three children, but only two still are her dependents. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Per.

She sells medicinal herbs such as: camomile, HBK herb, plantain, etc. in addition to selling honey, garlic and hot peppers. She has a small place outside the Otuzco market where she sells her products. She started off with just a small amount of goods, but little by little she increased her business.

She is a member of the "Sagrado Corazn de Jess" community bank, where she obtained her first loan; with this money she bought a variety of medicinal herbs. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy honey, hot peppers, garlic, lemon verbena and HBK herbs and a few kilos of curd.

Her greatest dream is to acquire a fixed space inside the market where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Digna Emerita Gmez Martnez tiene 37 aos de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene tres hijos en total pero dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per.

Se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales tales como: manzanilla, panizara, yanten, etc. adems vende miel de abeja, ajos y rocoto. Tiene un pequeo lugar en las afueras del mercado de Otuzco en el que vende y ofrece sus productos. Empez con un poco de mercadera poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio.

Es integrante del Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazn de Jess lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro una variedad de yerbas medicinales. Con el prstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara una caja de miel, un ciento de rocoto, 8 arrobas de ajos, 1 paquete de hierba luisa y panizara, y algunos kilos de quesillo.

Su mayor sueo es conseguir un puesto en el mercado en donde ofrezca todos sus productos.

loan.use: Purchase goods for her business.

loan.name: Eufemia Magna

texts.es:
Eufemia Magna C. V. is 49 years old; she studied up to second grade of primary school. She has two children but only one still depends on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Per.

Her business is the purchase and sale of curd, vegetables and raising barley, wheat, corn and potatoes. The people who know her always look for her to ask for these products. She offers vegetables as a ambulatory seller at the Otuzco market. She started her business with a small amount of curd and a small amount of grains that she harvested. As time went on and with loans she acquired through the "Sagrado Corazn de Jess" community bank, she has been able to make some profit and expand her business.

She used all of her first loan to buy curd. With another loan, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 200 units of curd, a variety of vegetables and fertilizer for her planting.

Her greatest hope is to have a stand at the wholesale market in the city of Trujillo because on the coast, business is better.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Eufemia Magna C. V. tiene 49 aos de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per.

Su negocio es la compra y venta de quesillo, verduras y siembra de granos de cebada, grano de trigo, chochos y papa. La gente que ya la conoce siempre la buscan para pedirle algunos de estos productos. La verdura la ofrece y vende en condicin de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco. Su negocio se inicio vendiendo con un poco de quesillo y con poco cereal que cosechaba; con el pasar del tiempo y con los prstamos que adquiri en el Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazn de Jess ha podido hacer un capital propio y ha incrementado su negocio.

Su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 lo invirti todo comprando quesillo. Con el prstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 200 unidades de quesillo, una variedad de verduras y abono para sus siembras.

Su mayor sueo es tener un puesto pero en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo ya que por la costa hay mayor negocio.

loan.use: Buy curd and various other products.

loan.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia sells various brands of cosmetics. She is divorced, has 4 grown children, and does not receive a pension so she had to begin a business in order to meet her expenses and maintain her house. She began her business 2 years ago with some neighbors and to date has a good number of customers.

She needs a loan of US$475, which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase a display case to show and store her products. With your help Hortencia will be able to continue to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hortencia se dedica a la venta de cosmticos de diversas marcas su estado civil es divorciada y como sus 4 hijos ya son mayores de edad, ya no recibe pensin, por lo que tuvo que comenzar un negocio para poder sobrellevar sus gastos, y sostener su casa, inicio hace dos aos con sus vecinos y a la fecha cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes

Ella requiere un crdito por US $ 475 que pagara en 6 meses el cual ser destinado a la compra de una vitrina para exhibir y guardar sus productos. Con tu ayuda doa Hortencia seguir teniendo un ingreso para subsistir

loan.use: Purchase a display case

loan.name: Maria Simona

texts.es:
Mara Simona has been divorced for 2 years. The financial support she received for food for her 4 children was not sufficient to meet their expenses, so she saw the need to start a business. She has always been good at flower arrangements, so she began with this activity 25 years ago and two years ago turned her space in to a flower shop.

She is seeking a loan for US$475, which will be repaid in 6 months, to air condition her flower shop. Lets contribute to the development of Mara Simonas business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Mara Simona se divorcio hace 2 aos, y la pensin alimenticia que recibe por sus 4 hijos no es suficiente para solventar los gastos, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de iniciar un negocio, siempre se le ha facilitado la confeccin de arreglos florales, ella empez con esta actividad hace 25 aos pero hace dos aos acondiciono su local para una florera.

El crdito que esta solicitando es por la cantidad de US $ 475 que pagara en 6 meses para acondicionar su florera. Contribuyamos al desarrollo del negocio de Simona.

loan.use: Air condition her business

loan.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Chayo, as she is affectionately called, has been a seamstress for over 20 years. Today she offers her services to the schools to make school uniforms, and therefore has good seasonal work.

The loan she is seeking for US$750, which will be repaid in 4 months, is to purchase another sewing machine to build her shop and not have to leave her home to go to work. With your help Chayo will be able to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Chayo como cariosamente la llaman se dedica desde hace mas de 20 aos a ser modista, actualmente ofrece sus servicios en las escuelas para la fabricacin de uniformes, y as tener muy buenas temporadas de trabajo,

El crdito que nos esta solicitando es por US $750 que pagara a 4 meses ya que desea comprar otra maquina de coser, para ir formando su taller de costura. y as no tener que salir a trabajar fuera de su casa. Con tu ayuda Doa Chayo podr seguir desarrollndose.

loan.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loan.name: Manuel Roman

texts.es:
For more than 15 years, Manuel Arvalo has operated his small business in central America. He buys bulks of clothing and sell them to this family a good prices. This business became familial since his family members all work in the business. In addition to his children, he has other employees during the weekends.

He seeks a loan of $850 which will be repaid in 6 months. The loan will be used to invest in summer apparel and to upgrade the store so it will be ready to be stocked with new styles. With your help, this family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel Arvalo tiene mas de 15 aos de tener su pequeo local en un centro comercia, el compra pacas de ropa para toda la familia y las vende a buenos precios este negocio se volvi familiar debido a que todos trabajan en el negocio. Adems sus hijos tienen otros empleos los fines de semana para ayudar.

El solicita un crdito por US $ 850 que esta dispuesto a pagar en 6 meses para invertir en ropa para el verano y acondicionar el local. Tener surtido el negocio para la nueva temporada. Con tu ayuda esta familia podr salir adelante.

loan.use: to buy merchandise

loan.name: Felipe Teonila

texts.es:
Mrs. Felipa Teonila M. G. is 56 years old and lives in Otuzco province of La Libertad, Per. She only had three years of schooling. She has three children, two of whom are still dependent, and she also cares for a granddaughter she has raised from birth.

Mrs. Felipa dedicates herself to selling bread, honey, and cheese, and she knows how to weave very well. She makes tablecloths and bedspreads which she sells in Tacna street in Otuzco. She also buys animals including sheep, pigs and chickens, fattening and selling them.

She is a member of the communal bank, "Sacred Heart of Jesus." She took advantage of her previous loan by buying bread and sweets to sell in December during the celebration of "the Virgin of the Gate," which went very well for her. She had many sales, so she now has greater resources.

With this loan for $375, which she will repay within four months, she will buy 120 loaves of bread, 100 ring-shaped rolls, salads, desserts, and honey. Felipa dreams of finishing with selling in the street and having a place of her own, as well as having her own bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Felipa Teonila M. G. tiene 56 aos de edad, vive en la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad - Per. Ella tuvo solo 3 aos de estudios; tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 aun dependen de ella y esta a cargo de su nieta que la ha criado desde que naci. La seora Felipa se dedica a la venta de pan, miel de abeja, quesos y tambin sabe tejer muy bien; hace tapetes, colchas y los vende en la calle Tacna de la provincia de Otuzco. Adems compra animales como: ovejas, cerdos, gallinas los engorda y los vende. Es socia del Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazn de Jess, con su prstamo anterior aprovech en comprar pan y dulces para vender en diciembre en la fiesta de la Virgen de la Puerta, el cual le fue muy bien, tuvo muchas ventas, por lo tanto le quedo mayores utilidades. Con el prstamo de S/.1000.00 para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, comprar 120 panes, un ciento de roscas dulces y saladas, pastelitos y miel de abeja. La seora Felipa suea con dejar de vender en la calle y tener un local propio as como con tener su propia panadera.

loan.use: Purchase of breads, cackes, and other products for sale

loan.name: Ceberiana

texts.es:
Ceberiana has operated her general store for more than 20 years. Starting 6 years ago, she began to apply for loans that have allowed her wood and laminate "estanquilla" (hut or stand with a counter for selling food) to be rebuilt with cement block and concrete. She's also expanded her house and bought a food cart because, along with the general store, she started selling flour tortillas and tacos. Her two daughters and her husband help her tend the business and even though her grandchildren are still very young, they occasionally help out, as well.

She now needs a loan for US$750, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy a food cart and put it outside of her store so that she can sell food there. With your help, Celebriana can continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ceberiana tiene mas de 20 aos con su miscelnea, pero desde hace 6 aos principi a tramitar crditos que le han permitido que su estanquillo de madera y lamina lo fuera construyendo de block, y cemento, adems su casa la amplio, y ahora adquiri un puesto rodante, porque adems de la miscelnea empez a vender tortillas de harina y taquitos maaneros. Sus dos hijas y su esposo le ayudan a atender el negocio, y como sus nietos ya son jovencitos, ocasionalmente tambin le ayudan.

Ahora requiere un crdito por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un carrito y colocarlo afuera de su tienda y as vender la comida ah. Con tu ayuda Ceberiana podr seguir creciendo.

loan.use: Buy a food cart.

loan.name: Eliza Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Eliza Mercedes Z. C. is 35 years old, and studied through her second year of high school. She has five dependent children, and lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad, Per.

For her business, she sells soups in the morning and a set meal in the afternoons on a cart through the street of Santa Rita in Otuzco. With her excellent taste and convenient price, she has earned many customers.
