She started her business selling fried pork in small quantities, and as she became better known, others recommended she try other dishes, and she did. Currently, her business is going very well and she has more customers everyday.

She joined the communal bank "Mujures de Olivo" where she received her first loan for $100, money she used to buy all the ingredients she needed for cooking.

With this loan for $200, which she will repay in four months, she will buy a package of noodles, vegetables, potatoes, 12 kilos of rice and other ingredients for making different dishes.

Her greatest dream is to own a car so she can travel through various homesteads and buy fruit to sell in the Otuzco markets.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Eliza Mercedes Z. C. tiene 35 aos de edad, estudio hasta el segundo ao de secundaria. Tiene cinco hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. El negocio que tiene es la venta de caldos por las maanas y por las tardes vende men en condicin de ambulante en la calle Santa Rita de la provincia de Otuzco, con su buena sazn y el precio cmodo que ofrece se ha ganado muchos clientes. Su negocio lo inicia vendiendo frito de cerdo en pocas cantidades, con el tiempo se fue haciendo conocida y le sugeran hacer otros preparados y as lo hizo. Actualmente le va muy bien y cada da tiene mayor clientela. Ella integra el Banco Comunal Mujeres del Olivo lugar donde recibi su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el prstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprar un paquete de fideos, verduras, papas, 12 kilogramos de arroz y dems ingredientes para elaborar diferentes potajes. Su mayor sueo es tener un carro para transportarse por varios caseros y comprar frutas para vender en el mercado de Otuzco.

loan.use: Purchase ingredients for her business selling soups and other meals.

loan.name: Nelida Enriquela

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelida Enriquela C. is 55 years old and she completed her primary education. She has two dependent children. She lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad, Per.

Nelida has a variety of businesses; she dedicates herself to buying and selling pigs that she fattens before slaughtering them and selling the meat. She also spends time weaving sweaters, scarves, ponchos, tablecloths, and dolls' dresses. In addition to this, she has a small farm where she grows potatoes that she sells with each harvest in a market. She sells all of these at a traveling cart.

She is a member of the communal bank "Sacred Heart of Jesus," where she received her first loan for $100, money that she invested in buying piglets.

With this loan for $300, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ten baby pigs, wool and thread for her weaving, fertilizer and medicine for her planting.

Her greatest dream is to open up a shop out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Nelida Enriquela C. D. C. tiene 55 aos D. edad, estudio primaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total que aun dependen D. ella. Vive en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. La seora Nelida tiene varios negocios, se dedica a la compra y venta D. cerdos los cuales los engorda por un tiempo para luego sacrificarlos y vender la carne, tambin se dedica al tejido D. chompas, chalinas, ponchos, tapetes y trajes D. muecas. A parte D. eso tiene una chacra en la que siembra papa la cual en cada cosecha lo venD. en el mercado en condicin D. ambulante al igual que sus tejidos y la carne D. cerdo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazn D. Jess donD. recibi su primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirti para comprar cerdos pequeos. Con el prstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual ser pagado en un periodo D. cuatro meses comprar 10 cerdos pequeos, lanas e hilos para hacer sus tejidos, abono y medicina para sus sembros. Su mayor sueo es ambientar una tienda en su domicilio.

loan.use: Purchase pigs for her meat sales, wool and thread for her weaving, and fertilizer for her crops.

loan.name: America Miriam

texts.es:
Mrs. America Miriam R. E. is thirty-three years old and has an elementary education only. She has two dependent children. She lives in the village of Bellavista in the Salpo district of Otuzco province in La Libertad, Per.

Mrs. America has set up a spot in her home where she runs a general store and sells basic necessities, soda, candy, and beer. She also has a small bakery where she makes sweets, biscuits, and bread. She carries her products to the city of Trujillo in a truck that she rents.

She began her business by making bread, and she started her general store with very few products, which she has increased over time.

She is a member of the communal bank "Working Woman," from whom she obtained her first loan for $100. With this money, she bought the goods she needed to stock her store.

With this loan for $375, which she will repay in four months, she will buy two sacks of rice, two bags of sugar and a case of oil to stock her store, and to make bread she will buy a sack of flour, butter, yeast, and firewood.

She is a member of social project, Vaso de Leche ("Glass of Milk") "Maria Parado de Bellido.", a program similar to food stamps that provides food to vulnerable citizens in Peru. Her greatest dream is to build a home in the city of Trujillo and start a business there.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora America Miriam R. E. tiene 33 aos de edad, estudio solo educacin primaria. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el centro poblado menor de Bellavista en el distrito de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco departamento La Libertad Per. La seora America ha ambientado un lugar en su casa para colocar una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas y cerveza. Adems tiene una pequea panadera en el que elabora dulces, bizcocho y pan. Los productos le traen desde la ciudad de Trujillo en un camin el cual tiene contrato. Su negocio inicia con la elaboracin de pan, con su bodega se inicio no hace mucho con pocos productos, con el tiempo ir incrementando. Ella integra el Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras en el que obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo lo necesario para surtir su bodega. Con el prstamo de S/.1000.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprar dos sacos de arroz, dos bolsas de azcar y una caja de aceite para surtir su tienda y para la elaboracin del pan comprar un saco de harina, manteca, levadura y lea.. Es socia del programa vaso de leche Maria Parado de Bellido. Su mayor sueo es construir una casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y all instalar un negocio.

loan.use: Purchase more stock for her general store and ingredients for her bakery

loan.name: Anselma Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Anselma Jess Garca R. is 35 years old. She began studying for a career in nursing, but wasn't able to finish. She has three dependent children. She lives in the El Milagro sector in Trujillo province of La Libertad, Per.

Mrs. Anselma has set aside space in her home for a general store where she sells basic necessities, sodas, sweets, and beer. Seventeen years ago she opened her store with just a few products that she has increased over time. Three years ago she closed for a brief time due to poor health, but in spite of that she has continued ahead and reestablished the shop.

She belongs to the interim group "Amor y Paz" (Love and Peace) where she received her first loan for $100. With this money, she bought the basic goods she needs to stock her store.

With this loan for $200, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a can of oil, toilet paper, a package of noodles, and other groceries.

Her greatest dream is to open a cevichera, a restaurant serving the typical Latin American seafood dish ceviche, a service demanded by many people.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Anselma Jess Garca R. tiene 35 aos de edad, estudio la carrera de enfermera pero no la pudo terminar . Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Milagro en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de la misma en el departamento La Libertad Per. La seora Anselma ha ambientado un lugar en su casa para colocar una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas y cerveza. Hace 17 aos que abri su bodega con pocos productos con el tiempo fue incrementando. Hace tres aos cerro por un tiempo debido a que se haba puesto mal de salud. A pesar de eso ella sigue adelante y se ha reestablecido. Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Amor y Paz lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos de primera necesidad para surtir la tienda. Con el prstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual ser cancelado en cuatro meses comprar un saco de arroz, un saco de azcar, una lata de aceite, papel higinico, un paquete de fideos y dems abarrotes. Su mayor sueo es poner una cebichera en su domicilio, ya que mucha gente le ha solicitado.

loan.use: Purchase additional necessities to stock her general store, particularly groceries.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Approximately 8 years ago Julia had the idea to begin selling food from her home, in addition to the business she already had in the market. This is when she aquired a carrito sanguchero (a mini kitchen on wheels) and decided to sell food as a street vendor near her home in the evenings. Since then, Julia left her job in the market to dedicate herself full time to this business and today she has two kitchens. Today with the support of her daughter Esperanza she has more time in the mornings. So Julia took advantage of this to look for additional work, so she works in the mornings taking care of an aged woman. Julia and her daughter are thinking about the future and want to obtain a locale to be able to open up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Aproximadamente hace ocho aos atrs, a Julia se le ocurri empezar a vender comidas en su casa, aparte del negocio que tena ya en un mercado. Fue cuando adquiri un carrito sanguchero (una mini cocina con ruedas) que decidi vender comida como ambulante cerca de su casa por las noches. Desde entonces, Julia dej su trabajo en el mercado para dedicarse a tiempo completo a este negocio y hoy en da ya tiene dos cocinas. En estos das con el apoyo que ahora su hija Esperanza le brinda cuenta con ms tiempo en las maanas. De este modo, Julia aprovech en ocuparse de buscar otro trabajo, es as que actualmente trabaja en las maanas cuidando de una anciana. Su hija y ella estn pensando en un futuro conseguir un local para poder abrir un restaurante.

loan.use: Obtain a locale to open a restaurant

loan.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa G. M. is 32 years old, and only finished through primary school. She has two children, but only one depends on her. She lives in the small town of Cruz de Pargo in the Salpo district of the Otuzco province in La Libertad, Per.

Mrs. Carmen Rosa has a small general store where she sells daily necessities. Also, she buys and sells small cheeses, which she distributes through Carabamba and to the settlers that pass through the area. She and her husband also grow potatoes, which they sell by the sack to people coming from Trujillo.

She was able to join the communal bank "Luchando por el Progreso" (Fighting for Progress) through a neighbor, where she received a previous loan for S/.1200 soles. This loan was very useful to her as she was able to invest it in her business, which has gone very well.

With this loan for $550, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 150 kg of cheeses, groceries and candies.

Her greatest dream is to expand her general store even further.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Carmen Rosa G. M. tiene 32 aos de edad, estudio solo educacin primaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el centro poblado menor Cruz de Pargo en el distrito de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. La seora Carmen Rosa tiene una pequea bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, adems, se dedica a la compra y venta de quesillo el cual distribuye por Carabamba y a los pobladores que llegan por la zona. Junto con su esposo tambin se dedica a la siembra de papa, el cual vende por sacos a las personas que llegan de Trujillo. Por medio de una vecina pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal Luchando por el Progreso lugar donde le recibi un anterior prstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual le fue de mucha utilidad ya que pudo invertirlo en su negocio el cual le ha ido muy bien. Con el prstamo de S/. 1500.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprar 150 kilogramos de quesillo, abarrotes y golosinas. Su mayor sueo es implementar mas su bodega.

loan.use: Purchase more merchandise for her general store.

loan.name: Deyci

texts.es:
Mrs. Deyci Jaico P. is 24 years old and is studying the specialty of dental prostheses in an institute. She has two dependent children. She lives in the sector El Milagro in the district and province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad, Peru.

Deyci has set up a bakery in her home, and has made room to put in a store where she will take the opportunity to sell the bread that she makes.

She is part of the Interim Group Amor y Paz (Love and Peace) where she obtained her first loan of 300.00 PEN (about $120.00 ), money to buy the ingredients to make all types of breads.

With this loan of $200.00 (500.00 PEN) which will be paid in four months she will buy two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, and the rest of the money she will invest in buying groceries to stock her store.

Her biggest dream is to implement and modernize her bakery in order to offer better quality bread for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Deyci Jaico P. tiene 24 aos de edad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando en un instituto la especialidad de prtesis dental. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Milagro en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de la misma en el departamento La Libertad Per.

La seora Deyci ha instalado una panadera en su domicilio, como as tambin ha ambientado un lugar para poner una tienda en la que aprovecha en vender el pan que elabora.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto Amor y Paz lugar donde obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el cual comprara los ingredientes para la elaboracin del pan de todo tipo.

Con el prstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual ser pagado en cuatro meses comprar dos sacos de harina, 1 saco de azcar y el resto de dinero lo invertir para comprar abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Su mayor sueo es implementar y modernizar su panadera, de esa manera ofrecer un pan de mejor calidad para su comunidad.

loan.use: With the loan she will buy flour, sugar, etc. for her business

loan.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Mrs. Domitila A. R. is 50 years old; she studied up until second grade primary school. She is married with no children. She lives in the rural area of San Luis in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco in the Department of La Libertdad, Peru.

Her business started with the raising of small animals, and in parallel to this she made a living from farming. Later she learned how to refurbish and make shoes by way of her brothers, who made their entire living from this work. At the beginning when she started to make footwear she had a tough time, but over time and with practice she was making better quality shoes.

She belongs to the Communal Bank Mujeres Trabajadoras (Working Women) with whom she received her first loan of 2300.00 PEN which she paid back in 4 months; this loan served to invest in her businesses; it was distributed in one part to purchase the necessary materials to make the shoes (leather, glue, needles, synthetic material, etc.) and the other part to buy seed in order to plant potatoes and cereal crops (barley, wheat, and corn), which because it was quite profitable has gone very well.

With this loan of $850.00 (2300.00 PEN) which she will pay in four months, she will again buy the necessary materials to make footwear. Her biggest dream is to buy a stand in the city of Trujillo where she will sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Domitila A. R. tiene 50 aos de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Es casada pero no tiene hijos an Vive en el casero de San Lus en el distrito de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco departamento La Libertad Per.

Su negocio se inicia con la crianza de animales menores, paralelo a eso se dedicaba a la chacra. Posteriormente aprendi a renovar y fabricar zapatos por medio de sus hermanos que toda una vida se dedicaron a eso. Cuando empez a elaborar el calzado al principio tuvo dificultad, con el tiempo y la prctica fue elaborndolos de mejor calidad.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras en el que recibi su primer prstamo de S/.2300.00 el cual fue pagado en un plazo de 4 meses, le sirvi para invertir en sus negocios; lo distribuy una parte en comprar los materiales necesarios para poder fabricar los zapatos (cuero, pegamento, agujas, material sinttico, etc.) y la otra parte para comprar las semillas para poder sembrar los cereales (cebada, trigo, maz) y la siembra de papa, el cual todo le ha ido muy bien ya que tuvo bastantes utilidades.

Con el prstamo de S/. 2300.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprar tambin el material necesario para la fabricacin del calzado.

Su mayor sueo es comprar un stand en la ciudad de Trujillo en el que ofrezca el calzado.

loan.use: With the loan she will buy materials to make footwear

loan.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina sells clothing. About 20 years ago she and her husband opened a tailor shop. At that time they distributed their clothing to various points of sales, traveling to various states in Peru outside of Lima. Everything was going well until, after a few years, her husband had an accident while traveling on one of his trips. So she tried to take over the business but by herself it was impossible. After a year she abandoned the shop and began to sell clothing. For five years she sold clothing from her house, then house to house. Four years ago, thanks to a loan from EDAPROSPO, she was able to acquire a stand in the Gamarra commercial center to sell her clothing. Today her husband sells home textile products. The business is going well, yet Adelina dreams of having her tailor business again and this is her objective for the next few years.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Adelina se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa. Hace mucho tiempo, aproximadamente veinte aos, ella y su esposo abrieron un taller de confeccin de ropa. En ese entonces ellos salan a distribuir su ropa en distintos puntos de venta, viajando por diversos departamentos del Per fuera de Lima. Todo iba bien hasta que despus de unos aos su esposo se accident mientras iba en uno de sus viajes. Es as que ella intento llevar el negocio del taller por su cuenta pero le fue imposible. Despus de un ao abandono el taller y empez a vender ropa. Durante cinco aos estuvo vendiendo ropa en su casa, luego lo hizo a domicilio, ofreca de casa en casa sus productos. Hasta que cuatro aos atrs, gracias al prstamo que le brindo EDAPROSPO, pudo adquirir un puesto en el centro comercial de Gamarra para la venta de ropa. Su esposo hoy en da vende por su cuenta lo que es productos textiles para el hogar. A pesar de que la va muy bien en su negocio, Adelina afirma soar con tener nuevamente su taller, ese ser su objetivo en los prximos aos.

loan.use: Buy new sewing machines to reopen her tailoring business

loan.name: Julia Nelsa

texts.es:
Julia Nelsa R. G. in 46 years old, and completed primary school up to the second grade. She has six children but only two that are dependent on her. She lives in the middle of the small town of Bellavista in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco and the Department of La Libertad, Peru.

In her store that she has set up in a second house that she has just purchased, she sells basic items like candies, sodas, and beer. As well, Julia also earns a living raising cattle, pigs and huachos which she fattens for a time to then sell later at a better price. Her business started with the raising of small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and small pigs; later she sold cereals such as wheat, barley and others.

With her first loan of 300.00 PEN that she received from her Communal Bank Mujeres Trabajadores (Working Women), she invested in the purchase of two ram sheep.

With this loan of $725.00 (2000.00 PEN) which will be paid in four months, she will buy two large bulls. Her biggest dream is to set up her store to have a larger variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Julia Nelsa R. G. tiene 46 aos de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de educacin primaria. Tiene seis hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella. Vive el centro poblado menor de Bellavista en el distrito de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco departamento La Libertad Per.

En su bodega que ha ambientado en su segunda casa que acaba de comprar, vende productos de primera necesidad, golosinas, gaseosas y cerveza. As tambin la seora Julia se dedica a la crianza de ganados, chanchos y huachos el cual engorda por un tiempo para luego venderlo a mayor precio. Su negocio empez con la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos pequeos, luego venda cereales de trigo, cebada y otros.

Con su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi en su Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras lo invirti en la compra de tres carneros.

Con el prstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprar dos toros grandes.

Su mayor sueo es implementar su bodega, teniendo mayor variedad de productos.

loan.use: With the loan she will buy two bulls

loan.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha M. R. is 37 years old, and studied up to the fifth grade. She has four children but they solely depend upon her. She lives in the minor central neighborhood Bellavista, in the district of Salpo, province of Otuzco, in the area La Libertad - Peru. Mrs. Martha has renovated a place in her house to place a shop in which she sells items of necessity, sodas, sweets and beer. What's more she offers board to some inhabitants of the area and to the doctors from the local health clinic. In her remaining time she also breeds small animals such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, etc. Her shop began with few products; with time it has grown. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras (communal bank, "Working Women") from which she obtained her first loan of S/.300.00; with this money she bought everything necessary to start up her shop. With the poan of S/.600.00; the one that will be settled in four months, she will travel to Otuzco to buy a dozen molinos, marmalade, yogurt, tuna, noodles and other products. She is secretary of the cup of milk program, "Maria Parado de Bellido." Her greatest dream is to implement and increase her shop with the sale of clothes and shoes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Pax Bobrow

La seora Martha M. R. tiene 37 aos de edad, estudio hasta el quinto ao de secundaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella. Vive el centro poblado menor Bellavista en el distrito de Salpo provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Per. La seora Martha ha ambientado un lugar en su casa para colocar una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas y cerveza, adems, brinda pensin a algunos pobladores de la zona y a los doctores del puesto de salud de su localidad. En el tiempo que le sobra se dedica tambin a la crianza de animales menores tales como: chanchos, carneros, cuyes, etc. Su bodega inicio con pocos productos, con el tiempo ha ido incrementando. Ella integra el Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras en el que obtuvo su primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo lo necesario para surtir su bodega. Con el prstamo de S/.600.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses viajar a Otuzco para comprar una docena de molinos, mermelada, yogurt, atn, fideo y otros productos. Es secretaria del programa vaso de leche Maria Parado de Bellido. Su mayor sueo es implementar y ampliar su bodega con la venta de ropa y zapatos.

loan.use: With the loan, she will buy more merchandise for her shop. - Con el prestamo comprara mas mercaderia para su bodega

loan.name: Tulia

texts.en:
Tulia M. D. R. has a business selling chickens in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She has been selling chickens for 11 years and has many loyal customers. She sells to restaurants, the military, and individuals. On average Tulia buys 100 live chickens a day to prepare and sell in the Bellavista Market. Tulia always gives the best service and can deliver her poultry to any client using a motorcycle taxi.

Tulia is a 56-year-old widow with five children. She has no other support, so her business is everything to her. She currently rents a stand in the Bellavista Market, but her goal is to be able to buy her own store where she can work with her children and sell chickens.

A member of the community bank Frey Martin, Tulia is requesting a loan of $725 to repay over four months. She needs the extra capital to buy and sell the number of chickens her clients demand.

loan.use: To buy more chickens to sell to her clients

loan.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela R. P. is a hardworking businesswoman in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. Manuela owns some land where she has a fish farm and also raises pigs and chickens. Her goal for this year is to raise 1,800 chickens and create four fish farms. A fish farm is 40 meters wide and will support bocachico and carachama. She also plants different crops on the five hectares of land she owns.

Manuela is 43 years old, has five children, and is happily married. She loves working, farming, business, and helping her family. Her goal is to provide all the opportunities in life for her children that she never had.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Manuela is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy 500 chickens, plus feed and vitamins.

loan.use: To buy 500 chickens, as well as feed and vitamins

loan.name: Lisania Karm

texts.en:
Lisania Karm M. T. helps run a family carpentry business making custom furniture and doors in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. Lisania does the majority of the buying and selling, while her husband is a skilled carpenter. They have invested in different woods, mainly capiona and cimilla.

Lisania is 24 years old with one child and is happily married. She loves working with her family, building relationships, and making deals with her clients. Lisania has experience selling clothing and chickens in the main market of Pucallpa. Her goals are to educate her children and continue to grow the business.

A member of the community bank Fray Martin, Lisania is requesting a loan of $725 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to purchase more wood and cover some operational expenses. She recognizes that purchasing modern tools would help the family business as well.

loan.use: To purchase more wood and cover some operational expenses

loan.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila is a very energetic and hard working woman. Since 2002 she works at a photography studio which offers services as photo sessions and special events filming.

She tells us that she has always worked as a photographer, but before she would work as a free-lance photographer, taking photos at events whenever she had a special request.

When her mother inherited the house where she now lives, she decided to open a studio because of its good location. Little by little, she has put showcases and photocopy machines and she has also bought filming equipment.

These are her achievements until now and she says she owes it all to her mother and to the strength her only son gives her everyday.

Her plans are now to expand her business hiring personnel to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Lila es una persona muy vivaz y trabajadora. Desde el 2002 trabaja en su estudio fotogrfico donde brinda el servicio de tomar sesiones fotogrficas y filmacin de eventos.

Ella cuenta que siempre ha trabajado como fotgrafa, no obstante, anteriormente solo tomaba fotos en distintos eventos cuando la solicitaban.

Cuando su madre le heredo la casa donde vive actualmente fue que se anim a abrir su estudio ya que estaba bien ubicado. Poco a poco lo ha ido implementando con vitrinas y mquinas fotocopiadoras, adems ha comprado un equipo de filmacin.

Esos son sus logros hasta ahora, todo se lo debe a su madre y a las fuerzas que su nico hijo le brinda a diario.

En sus planes esta hacer crecer su negocio contratando personal que la ayuden.

loan.use: To expand her photography studio

loan.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel sells clothes since 3 years. She is a street vendor and sells the clothes door-to-door or at the market. Mostly, she sells tennis shoes and pants.

Before, she would spend more time at home and she would sell desserts from time to time, whenever she received orders from people who knew her.

She started her business after getting divorced from her husband. After separating, she needed to work because she did not receive a pension from her ex-husband and she had to raise 5 children still under-age.

Fortunately, she is doing well now, that is why she would like to see her children finish college and to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace tres aos Maribel se dedica a vender ropa ofrecindola de puerta en puerta, ya sea a domicilio o en el mercado. Por lo general, ella vende zapatillas y pantalones.

Antes de esto ella se dedicaba ms a su casa, por temporadas venda postres segn reciba pedidos de personas que la conocan. Su negocio de ropas empez a raz del divorcio de su esposo. Cuando se separo de l tuvo la necesidad de trabajar ya que no reciba pensin de su esposo y deba mantener a sus cinco hijos aun menores.

Felizmente le va bien por ahora, lo que ms quisiera ella es ver a sus hijos terminado el colegio y poder crecer en su negocio.

loan.use: To buy more clothes

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es:
For eight years, Nancy made a living selling food. She made Peruvian sweets and light meals that she took from her house to sell to her customers. During that time, she and her daughter were excited by the idea of setting up a workshop to make briefcases and backpacks because they saw that the the business of selling briefcases and backpacks was going very well.

That's how they came, little by little, to making a few and selling them, first at the shop of Nancy's daughter. Once they got enough money to invest in better materials, they began to produce more. And so they've managed to put their products in different places around Lima. Lately, Nancy has also been able to count on the help of another of her daughters and so increase her production. However, the lack of sewing machines has hindered their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Durante ocho aos Nancy estuvo dedicada a la venta de comidas. Preparaba dulces peruanos y comidas ligeras para venderlas afuera de su casa. Luego de este tiempo ella y a su hija se animaron a implementar un taller para la confeccin de maletines y mochilas. Ya que vieron que el negocio de venta de mochilas y maletines iba muy bien.

Fue as que comenzaron, confeccionado de a pocos y vendiendo, al inicio, en la tienda del hijo de Nancy. Una vez que consigui el dinero para invertir en mayor cantidad para los materiales, ambas se dedicaron a producir ms. De este modo, han logrado colocar sus productos en distintos puntos de venta en Lima. ltimamente Nancy cuenta tambin con la ayuda de otra hija, gracias a ello han logrado aumentar su produccin; sin embargo, la falta de ms maquinas no permite que crezca su produccin.

loan.use: Buy a new sewing machine.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es:
The general store that Maria runs everyday from morning to night has been in operation for a year. Before starting the store, she worked as a street vendor, selling sneakers. For six years, she maD. her way around different markets to sell them. Before that, she used to work in a commercial area until street vendors were forced out.

When her son suggested that she open a shop, she decided to stop selling shoes and, with her family's support, open a general store. Her son loaned her money and her daughters help her tend and manage the store. In the future, Maria would like to increase her sales and grow her business. Happily, she can count on the help of her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La bodega que Mara maneja a diario desD. la maana hasta la noche tiene un ao D. inaugurada. Antes D. dedicarse a este negocio ella venda zapatillas como ambulante. Durante seis aos visito distintos mercados con tal D. vender. Los aos anteriores venda en un centro comercial hasta que desalojaron a los ambulantes.

Una vez que su hijo le propuso abrir una tienda, ella se decidi por dejar la venta D. zapatos y D. inmediato, con el apoyo D. su familia abri la bodega. Su hijo le prest el capital y sus hijas la ayudan con la atencin D. la bodega y el mantenimiento. Ms adelante Mara quisiera aumentar sus ventas y crecer en su negocio, felizmente cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijas.

loan.use: Add merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina lives in the small Batey de Palav community of San Cristobal. Shes the proud mother of a son who is in his twenties.

Miguelina owns and operates a cafeteria within her house. The entrepreneur explains that the cafeteria is her familys main source of income. She would like to boost her business. Miguelina wants to increase her sales volume so as to put aside money for her sons studies.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy various goods to supply her cafeteria.

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials for a small cafeteria.

loan.name: Yuderca Altagracia

texts.en:
Yuderca or Yudy, as friends and family affectionately call her, is an active and hard-working woman who lives in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal. She has four children that range from 1 to 10 years old, three of whom go to school.

Yudy sells an assortment of pants, blouses, shirts and underwear to the men and women of her community. Shes still running the store within her house, but she is thinking about renting a local before long to operate the business.

Yuderca is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of new styles of pants and shirts. The entrepreneur hopes that her business can grow so that she can buy a house with the profit from her store. Yudercas business supports her childrens educations.

loan.use: To purchase pants, shirts and underwear to supply a store.

loan.name: Esperanza Moya

texts.en:
Esperanza is a 30-year-old woman and a proud mother of two schoolchildren. A few months ago, Esperanza started a small business selling mens and womens clothing in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal.

Esperanza explains that she wants to diversify the line of products shes offering to the customers. With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk in order to satisfy the clienteles demand, and increase her income. Esperanza wants to become a very well-established supplier of clothing in her area.

loan.use: To acquire clothing in bulk to resell in her community.

loan.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia spent 27 years making tamales and selling them from her house at weekends. Some months ago, working with a government program called "vaso de leche" or "glass of milk" (that provides free breakfasts for people with few economic resources), providing products for making breakfasts, she got the idea to open a small store when the people charged with cooking asked her to get not only the things they needed for breakfasts but also other products and supplies.

That's how, two years ago, she came to open her general store, always with the idea of getting ahead. With passing time, she's been able to stock her store with more groceries and other products. She invests what she earns from the business back in the store unless circumstances require that she spend part of her earnings on some household necessity or other. Her goal is to build a larger store in a more central location.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Silvia lleva 27 aos haciendo tamales y vendindolos por su casa los fines de semana. Hace unos meses, colaborando con un vaso de leche (programa estatal de reparticin de desayuno gratis a personas de bajos recursos econmicos) proveyendo productos para la elaboracin de desayunos se le ocurri abrir una pequea tienda, ya que poco a poco las personas encargadas de cocinar no solo le pedan lo necesario para un desayuno si no otros productos e insumos que ella se encargo de conseguir de a poco.

Fue as que hace dos aos ella abri su bodega, siempre con la idea de salir adelante. Con el paso de los aos ha podido abastecer su tienda con ms abarrotes y otros productos. Lo que gana por ahora lo vuelve a invertir salvo en algunas circunstancias que necesita para algunos requerimientos de su hogar. Su meta es construir un local ms amplio para su tienda que se encuentre en un lugar ms cntrico.

loan.use: Increase merchandise and earnings.

loan.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario has had a small store just outside her house for 3 years. She has 4 children who help her with the store. Her husband works as a welder, but he works on contract, so he also helps at the store on free days. Among other things, she sells hamburgers that she makes nights on her stove at home, but she'd like to increase her hamburger sales and she wants to buy a grill so that she can make more.

She is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy a grill for her business. With your contribution, Rosario can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Rosario tiene una pequea tienda en las afueras de su domicilio desde hace 3 aos, tiene 4 hijos quien la ayudan en el local, su esposo se desempea como soldador pero esto lo hace por contratos por esto en sus das de descanso tambin ayuda, en el negocio actualmente empez a vender hamburguesas en su casa esto lo hace por las noches, las hace en la estufa de su casa, pero su intencin es formalizar mas el puesto de hamburguesas por lo que euiqer comprar un aplancha para poder producir mas.

Ella esta solicitando un crdito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una plancha para su negocio. Con tu contribucin Rosario podr progresar.

loan.use: Buy a hamburger grill.

loan.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles is married and has 4 children. Some years ago, her husband found himself unemployed and struggling to get work. While this was going on, their outlays, from school fees to utility bills, went on rising. The situation was very difficult which is why she began reselling cosmetics that she bought from a catalog along with merchandise that she sourced from the city of Monterrey. Later, she set up a stall in a flea market. She now has two places for selling, one in the flea market and another in her house. Bit by bit, her business continues to grow.

She's applying for a US$950 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, Maria de los Angeles will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Mara de los ngeles es casada y tiene 4 hijos. hace algunos aos su esposo se encontraba desempleado, y estaba batallando para conseguir trabajo, mientras esto pasaba las cuentas por pagar ese iban incrementando entre los gastos de la escuela y recibos de servicios la situacin era muy difcil por lo que ella empez a vender, productos cosmticos por catalogo y as empez a surtir mercanca en la ciudad de monterrey para revender, despus se estableci en un local de la pulga, actualmente ya tiene dos locales uno en la pulga y otro en su casa, poco a poco su negocio sigue creciendo.

Ella solicita un crdito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca. Con tu apoyo ngeles seguir prosperando

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: San Juana

texts.es:
Some years ago, Juany went through a difficult situation in her marriage after which she decided to divorce. Because of her former husband's financial instability, she started reselling cosmetics that she bought from a catalog. Thanks to her efforts, she now has a wide customer base to whom she can sell and her business has prospered.

She's now applying for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy a glass case for displaying her products. She'll set this up at her house in order to avoid objects going missing when she has showings and people come to look. Let's contribute to Juany's progress by supporting her application.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace unos aos Juany paso por una situacin difcil en su matrimonio por lo que decidi divorciarse debido a la inestabilidad econmica que tenia su ex esposo entonces ella empez a vender productos cosmeticos por catalogo, gracias a su esfuerzo ahora tiene una cartera de clientes amplia a los que sigue atendiendo hasta la fecha y su negocio ha prosperando,

Actualmente ella solicita un crdito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una vitrina donde exhibir sus productos, esta la colocara en su casa y as evitar perdida de objetos cuando hace demostraciones y la gente va a verlos. Contribuyamos al progreso de Juany apoyemos su caso.

loan.use: Buy a display case.

loan.name: Laura Veronica

texts.es:
Laura began her business because her husband's earning were becoming ever too small to cover their expenses. Their growing daughters also contributed to their increasing expenses so she began to resell lingerie that she bought from a catalog. The business went well and she soon had a strong list of customers. She now sources the lingerie from a distributor which gives her a better earnings margin and her business grows bigger each day.

Laura needs a loan for US$575, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Laura Vzquez emprendi su negocio debido a que con los ingresos de su esposo cada vez completaba menos, entonces al ir creciendo sus hijas tambin se incrementaban mas los gastos, por lo que empez a vender lencera por catalogo, le fue bien y pronto tuvo su cartera de clientes, a la fecha ya surte dicha lencera en una distribuidora que le da mayor margen de ganancia y su negocio crece cada da mas.

Ella requiere un crdito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca. Con tu ayuda Laura continuara su negocio.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana considers herself to be a hard-working and responsible person. She's married to Luis Terrazas Nunez, 32, and has 2 children, Luis Fernando, 8, and Victor Manuel, 6, both in elementary school. She started the business because she wanted to help with household expenses. Her husband's salary doesn't always cover their expenses and they wanted to be able to better provide for their children. She also very much enjoys sewing. She began on February 14, 2000 when she got her first sewing machine, after following a friend's advice to take a course in sewing skills. She was able to get the sewing machine thanks to a "Tanda" (an informal group in which members can borrow and lend money) that she joined. From there, she began doing work for neighbors and, little by little, her customer base grew and business has been strong.

Susana is applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, so that she can buy materials that will allow her to fill the orders that her customers have placed for things such as bedspreads, quilts, pillows, towel sets, etc. and so that she can provide good service and complete the orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Susana R. se considera una persona muy trabajadora y responsable esta casada con el Sr. Luis Terrazas Nez de 32 aos, tiene 2 hijos Luis Fernando de 8 aos y Vctor Manuel de 6 aos estudiantes de primaria. Inici el negocio por el deseo de ayudar con los gastos de la casa ya que a veces no alcanzaba con su sueldo de su marido y queran darle lo mejor a sus hijos, adems de que a ella le gusta mucho la costura. Comenc el 14 de Febrero de 2000 cuando le regalaron su primera maquina de coser a raz de que una amiga la convenci de que ingresara a un curso de corte y confeccin y de manualidades y sigui su consejo. La mquina la pudo adquirir gracias a que entro a una Tanda de dinero, y fue as como empez haciendo trabajos entre los vecinos y poco a poco fue creciendo el nmero de clientes y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien.

Solicita un crdito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir materiales que le permitan elaborar los trabajos que tiene encargados por sus clientes tales como, colchas, edredones, almohadas, juegos de bao, etc. y as poder darles un buen servicio cumpliendo a tiempo con dichos pedidos.

loan.use: Buy stock for sewing business.

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita considers herself to be an honest person, hard-working with a strong desire to get ahead. She started the business because she needed an income and also because she likes pastries and sales. Plus it's something that she learned many years ago because her family is in the same business. She began making and selling bread 20 years ago when her family had a long-established bakery, a business they closed two years ago due to her father's advancing years. He could no longer work and it was then that she decided to make bread and sell it from home, something that she liked doing. Her business is now going strong and she has a lot of customers.

Margarita is applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy basic ingredients, containers and baking tins so that she can make more and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Margarita D. se considera una persona honesta, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante; inicio el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso adems de que le gusta la repostera y las ventas, ya que es una actividad que aprendi hace muchos aos porque su familia se dedicaba a eso. Comenz a elaborar y vender pan hace 20 aos, en aquel entonces su familia tena una panadera establecida la cual cerraron hace dos aos por la avanzada edad de su pap que ya no poda trabajar y fue cuando decido elaborar el pan en casa y venderlo a domicilio, lo cual le agrada hacer y en la actualidad le ha ido muy bien y tiene muchos clientes

Solicita un crdito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir materia prima, recipientes y moldes que le permitan elaborar ms y de esta manera puedo incrementar mis ventas.

loan.use: Buy basic supplies for bakery business.

loan.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura is single and defines herself as a likeable person, hard-working and responsible. She started her business because she wanted to have her own money, be independent, be able to buy things herself and also to help her mother with household expenses. In September 2004, she began selling, with her mother's help, from a small stand in front of her house. She did well and the opportunity to buy a larger stand for making tortas soon came along, something that gave her more room and helped her to sell more. Because she did this at night, she was able to spend days working at selling clothes to friends, neighbors and relatives. This, too, has gone well.

Rosaura needs a loan of US$300, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy basic ingredients for making dinners so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rosaura D. Hernndez es soltera y se define como una persona muy simptica, trabajadora y responsable emprendi su negocio Porqu le gusta tener su propio dinero, ser una persona independiente, poder comprar sus cosas y adems ayudar a mi mam con los gastos de la casa. Comenz en septiembre de 2004 vendiendo en una mesita al frente de su casa con la ayuda de su mam, fue entonces que le empez a ir bien y se le present la oportunidad de comprar un carrito para elaborar tortas, lo cual le ayud a tener mas espacio y a vender mas. Como esta actividad es solo por las noches, en el da aprovecha para dedicarse a vender ropa entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, y tambin me ha ido muy bien.

Ella requiere un crdito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir materia prima que me permita elaborar mas cenas tales como sopes, tostadas, gorditas, tortas, etc. lo cual me permitir incrementar mis ventas

loan.use: Buy basic supplies.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To continue buying merchandise and to buy a freezer

loan.name: Mouna Market 2010-1-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mary A.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan for buying a car.

Mary is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant . She has four children, ranging in age from 8 to 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately 375 Sudanese pounds in profit, and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to pay for her children to go to school.

Mary is joined in her small group by Diana B., Lilian Maricello, Joice N. and Cecilia Y.. Diana B. has a business in brewing alcohol and wants to expand the business. Lilian Maricello is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to expand the hotel. Joice N. operates a business selling breads and wants to expand her business. Cecilia Y. is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loan.use: for buying a car

loan.name: Maritza Esther

texts.en:
Maritz Esther, an untiring woman and mother of two schoolchildren, lives in San Cristobal where she runs a small business.

Maritza Esther has been selling underwear and silver jewelry for more than seven years in her community. Maritza Esther says her business is the main source of the familys income. She also says its hard to keep up with two children and that she has to work hard to proviD. them with food and education.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy new styles of underwear and jewelry for her customers. Maritza Esthers dream is to have a big "Boutique.

loan.use: To get new styles of fashionable jewelry for her business.

loan.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Mxima lives with her two children in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal. To make a living and provide food for her two sons, Maxima sells silver jewelry to the women of the community. The entrepreneur says its very important for her to see her children go to school and get ready for the future.

With her loan, Maxima will buy some customer-recommended chic necklaces, bracelets, earrings and rings. The businesswoman hopes that her business can grow so that she has enough money to buy a house in the future.

loan.use: Purchase of silver jewelry in order to supply her business.

loan.name: Mara Ramona

texts.en:
Mara Ramona is 42 years old, and she and her husband have a unique 12-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a security agent in a commercial bank.

To supplement the familys income, Mara Ramona sells a collection of shoes, slippers, and also beauty products to women of the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal, her hometown. Ramona operates the business predominantly from her house, but sometimes she visits some friends and other women in the neighborhood to offer and sell her products.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy beauty products and shoes so as to continue satisfying her customers needs.

loan.use: To invest in the purchase of perfumes, beauty products and other goods to resell in her community.

loan.name: Mara Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mara Del Carmen, a single mother of four school-going children, lives in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal, her hometown.

Mara Del Carmen has a lot of experience in running a business. She had been owner and operator of a grocery store, an auto repair shop and other small businesses.

Currently, she is running a clothing store. People visit her store each day to purchase fashionable pants, shirts, slippers, beauty products and the like.

The entrepreneur wants to increase her earnings from the business. With her loan, she will buy products that are running low in the store and also new products in order to attract new people.

loan.use: Purchase a large quantity of clothing to supply a small business.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is an older and experienced entrepreneur who lives in the Batey D. Palav community of San Cristobal. Her five children are grown and are not living with her.

From her house, Carmen operates a small store, and she offers various products to the clientele, such as perfumes, deodorants, slippers, shirts, pants, beauty products and the like. Carmen explains that her business allows her maintain an adequate lifestyle and support her husband who cannot work anymore.

With her loan, Carmen will buy more products to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and her income. The entrepreneur says it is important for her to continue doing her business, because she likes to feel independent and not to wait for money from her children or other people.

loan.use: To buy various products such as perfumes and beauty products for a small store.

loan.name: Ayalibby Altagracia

texts.en:
Ayalibby Altagracia is 25 years old, and she lives with her mother and father in the Batey of Palav community of San Cristobal. To supplement her familys revenue and support her university studies, Ayalibby wants to start a call center, which will offer its services to the neighborhood. Ayalibbys father has already acquired a small local, and the business will be operated there.

Ayalibby has a lot of experience in doing business, and shes very popular in her community. Her dream for the future is to have a cyber caf and to allow the people of her community have access to the ICTs (Information and Communication Technologies). But in the meantime, she'll start with a small call center and she's requesting a loan to buy goods in order to achieve her goals. The entrepreneur thinks that people of low income have the right to know about these technologies and be able to use them.

Ayalibby wants to have enough money to support her studies and improve her lifestyle.

loan.use: Purchase of materials to start a call center.

loan.name: Mara Trinidad

texts.en:
Mara Trinidad is 43 years old and the mother of three daughters that range from 14 to 19, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as electrician for a company.

Mara Trinidad has been selling beauty products for more than 12 years. She operates the business from her house, and people visit her showcase every day to get her products. The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to add new lines of makeup, hair care products and perfumes so that she can attract new people to her business.

Maras business supports her childrens educations.

loan.use: Purchase of beauty products for a small business.

loan.name: Sitope

texts.en: Bar Mokpoko is a small restaurant run by Sitope A., the woman on the right in the photo. The other woman is her mother, who helps her daughter run her business. Sitope is the married mother of one baby, who comes with her to work each day (another reason why her mother is there to help out!) Sitope benefits from the location of her shop, in the middle of the bustling central market of Adta, attracting hungry customers as they do their weekly shopping. Bar Mokpoko specializes in Fufu Chevre, a traditional Togolese dish made from yam paste in a sauce made with goats meat (chevre.) With this loan, Sitope would like to buy more yams and goats meat with which to make Fufu, to increase her productivity in order to provide for her new family.

loan.use: To buy more yams and goats meat

loan.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina M. is 49 years old and the married mother of 4 children. Nina sells "sandelettes" (flip-flops) in a small boutique located in the central market Adta. These comfortable and inexpensive shoes are very popular among Togolese in this region and are always in demand. Ninas children are mostly grown and she will soon have the responsibility of contributing to their marriages and weddings. It is for this reason that she is requesting this loan from Kiva.

She hopes to use the money to make her shop look more professional by creating a display of her flip-flops, which will attract more customers and better compete with other vendors. With the profits from her business she will be able to continue to support her children in their new families and improve all of their quality of life.

loan.use: To build a display for her products

loan.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Ms. Akouvi T. is 42 years old, married, and pregnant! To support herself and her husband, Akouvi sells childrens clothes and shoes. Her boutique is located in the central market Adta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from Lom, the capital of Togo.

With this loan, Akouvi would like to change her display and make her shop look nicer to attract more customers. She would also like to restock some of her more popular shoes and baby clothes. With the money she will earn from this upgrade Akouvi will be able to provide for her new baby and maybe even buy some of her best-sellers for him or her to wear!

loan.use: To change her display and buy more shoes and baby clothes

loan.name: Agate

texts.en:
Ms. Agate A. is 31 years old and the married mother of two children. She lives and works in Adta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from Lom, the capital of Togo. Agate buys children's clothing and shoes in Lom and then resells them in the central market of Adta.

She is requesting this loan to buy more children's clothes so that she can increase the size of her business. She hopes to diversify her inventory as well. She hopes that this expansion will enable her to better provide for her family, send her children to school, and improve the quality of all of their lives.

loan.use: To buy more children's clothes

loan.name: Nazareno Group

texts.en:
The community bank Nazareno has recently completed one four-month loan cycle. The bank now has seventeen members. All of the associates are happy with the community bank. They feel that they have the support they need and enjoy the regular group meetings.

Through the community bank these associates receive training on a variety of subjects. During their first cycle associates learned the importance of savings and how to manage a loan. They also mentioned learning the importance of responsibility and punctuality.

The members of Nazareno have a variety of business. Many sell basic food staples from their homes or small stores. Another associate owns a tailor shop. Still others own printing shops or restaurants.

The associates need loans of different sizes. Some need 400, 800, or 800 soles reaching a total of 7200 soles in loans from the communal bank. All associates plan to use their loans to increase the amount of merchandise available to sell.

Their dreams are to continue improving their business and moving forward in life. They hope that their children have more opportunities then they had.

loan.use: To increase the amount of merchandise available to sell.

loan.name: Mujeres Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
The program called the Committee of Enterprising Women is a group of 15 women that is asking for a joint loan that they will pay back together as a group.

This particular group formed after one of the members heard very positive comments from her neighbor about the activities she and her friends had become involved with through the help of Fundacin Paraguaya. That is how this group came to be known as Mujeres Pojoaju which means Women taken by the hand in Guarani language.

The group is made up of 17 women, almost all of them from the same area of the city. They are involved with a variety of activities including the sales of fruits, vegetables, and clothing. Other members work in hair shops and doing cleaning work with a weekly or monthly salary.

The women are asking for a loan of 800,000 to 1,000,000 Guarani for each one of them (approximately $180 - $230 US dollars per person.) They will use the loan to invest in their various activities; buying merchandise or the necessary tools in order to carry out their jobs. Some of the things that they will buy are: clothing, barbershop supplies, fruits, vegetables, and other goods of primary necessity.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

El programa llamado Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras es un grupo de mujeres de 15 integrantes como mnimo y que retiran un crdito en forma conjunta y lo pagan de forma solidaria.

Para la formacin del presente comit una seora integrante de otro comit comento a una de sus vecinas sobre las ventajas del programa que estaba desarrollando junto con otras amigas en la Fundacin Paraguaya. Fue as que naci este grupo llamado Mujeres Pojoaju que en el idioma guaran significa Mujeres tomadas de la mano.

El comit esta constituido por 17 seoras casi todas de la misma zona las seoras tienen actividades diversas como venta de ropas, venta de verduras, frutas, peluquera, despensa, otras trabajan como limpiadoras y cuentan con un ingreso fijo semanal o mensual.

Las seoras retiran un crdito entre G. 800.000 a G.1.000.000 cada una. El crdito lo utilizan para invertirlos en sus diferentes actividades, comprando mercaderas o herramientas necesarias para realizar sus trabajos. Algunas de las cosas que compran son: ropas, materiales de peluquera, frutas, verduras, artculo de primera necesidad y otros.

loan.use: Purchase of clothing, barbershop supplies, fruits, vegetables, cleaning products, and other goods.

loan.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
This committee pertains to a group of entrepreneurial women in the city of Minga Guaz, a city a few minutes for the city of Este where one of the largest offices of Fundacin Paraguaya is located. There are already various groups of women taking loans in this area, and it was through these committees that the women in this group were able to find out about Fundacin Paraguaya.

This particular group is made up of 17 women and is called Divina Misericordia (Divine Compassion). All of these women have unique skills which help them to generate larger incomes for their families. Their husbands work but the money that they earn is not enough to support their families. Among the diverse business activities that these women are involved are clothing sales, cosmetics, beauty shops, pantries, dress shops, and the sales of various food items.

This program committee of entrepreneurial women is developing through the help of Fundacin Paraguaya, which allows these women to take loans in the form of a joint group, paying their quotas together. They also receive training to promote responsibility, savings, and other skills. Each one receives a loan of about 900,000 Guarani (about $200 US dollars) that they invest entirely in the purchase of goods and merchandise for their micro-businesses.

They are asking now for a new loan which will help them to acquire: clothing, shoes, meat, fruit, vegetables, flour, oil, dairy products, sweets, creams, perfumes, brushes, combs, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Este comit pertenece a un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras de la ciudad de Minga Guaz, esta ciudad queda a escasos minutos de Ciudad del Este en donde se encuentra unas de las oficinas ms grandes de Fundacin Paraguaya. En dicha zona ya exista varios comits, por los que las integrantes de este comit tuvieron conocimiento del mismo atravs de las mujeres de los otros grupos.

El comit esta constituido por 17 seoras y se llama Divina Misericordia, todas poseen actividades distintas que les sirve para generar mayores ingresos a sus familias ya que a pesar de que sus esposos trabajan el dinero no es suficiente para mantener a toda la familia. Entre las diversas actividades existen vendedoras de ropa, cosmticos, peluqueras, otras tienen despensas, modistas, venta de comidas, entre otros.

El programa comit de mujeres emprendedoras desarrollado por la Fundacin Paraguaya, les permite a estas mujeres retirar crditos en forma conjunta pagando sus cuotas de forma solidaria, tambin reciben capacitacin para fomentar la responsabilidad, el ahorro entre otras cosas. Cada una lleva un monto aproximado de G. 900.000 que los invierten exclusivamente para la compra de insumos y mercaderas para sus microempresas.

Ellas estn solicitando hoy da un nuevo crdito con el que podrn adquirir: ropa, zapatos, carne, frutas, verduras, harina, aceite, productos enlatados, golosinas, cremas, perfumes, cepillos y peines, etc.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, meat, fruit vegetables, flour, oil, dairy products, sweets, creams, perfumes, brushes, combs, etc.

loan.name: Una Disculpa Por Err

texts.es: Una disculpa por error S. S. otra vez E. caso D. la Sra. Patricia Guadalupe Granados porF. eliminar.

loan.use: Invertir en mi negocio.

loan.name: Pascual

texts.es:
"As you can see, the walls in my house are very deteriorated due to their age, and I would like to repair them before they collapse and cost more money to repair. I am requesting $600 to repair the walls of my home.
Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.
Como pueden darse cuenta las paredes de mi casa estn muy deterioradas debido a los aos, me gustara repararlas antes de que se caigan ya que despus tendra que invertir ms. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para reparar las paredes de mi vivienda.

loan.use: Repair walls

loan.name: Maricela

texts.es:
I prepare some delicious empanadas in my home and I sell them to malls, who then sell them to their customers. Thank God I am doing well but now I would like to invest a little more and if its possible, buy a little car to be able to transport myself to sell my empanadas. I am requesting $1,200 in order to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Yo preparo unas ricas empanadas en mi casa y las vendo en centros comerciales para que a su vez ellos las vendan a sus clientes, gracias a dios me va bien pero ahora me gustara invertir un poco ms y si es posible comprar un carrito para poder trasladarme a vender mis empanadas. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loan.use: Invest in my business.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundacin para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Carlos Omar

texts.es:
The rooms in my home are very small and I would like to build a closet in my childrens room, but with the household expenses I havent been able to raise all the money. I am requesting $600 for the construction of a closet in a room in my home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Los cuartos de mi vivienda son muy pequeos me gustara construir un closet para el cuarto de mis hijos pero con los gastos de la casa no he podido tener el dinero completo. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para la construccin de un closet en un cuarto de mi vivienda.

loan.use: Construction of a closet

loan.name: Faustino

texts.es:
I would like to make my home more secure. I want to make the fence higher on one side, and Ive also wanted to paint the house for years because the humidity has deteriorated the walls. I am requesting $800 for the construction of the fence and to paint my house.
Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.
Me gustara darle a mi vivienda ms seguridad por eso quiero levantar ms la barda que esta a un lado, tambin quiero pintar la casa ya que los aos, la lluvia y la humedad han deteriorado las paredes. Solicito $ 800 para la construccin de la barda y pintar mi vivienda.

loan.use: Construction of a fence and paint the house

loan.name: Antonio

texts.es:
The roof of my home is not in good condition, due to it being made of wood, and for this reason Id like to put in a concrete slab. In the rainy season water leaks through the wood and causes a lot of humidity inside the house. I am requesting $1,000 to put a concrete slab in my home.
Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.
El techo de mi vivienda ya no esta en buenas condiciones, debido a que es de madera por eso me gustara poner una losa de concreto ya que en pocas de lluvias el agua entra a travs de las maderas y provoca humedad adentro de mi casa. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner losa de concreto en mi vivienda.

loan.use: Construction of a concrete slab

loan.name: Sofia

texts.es:
I am very happy as I was granted my house. Its from the social interest project, and small, but my husband and I have plans to make additions to it, in order to live more comfortably. We presently need to build a big fence to the front and put bars on the windows, for our family to be safer. I am requesting $ 900 to put the fence and bars.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Estoy muy contenta porque ya me dieron mi casa. Es de inters social y est muy pequea, pero mi esposo y yo tenemos planes de ampliarla para vivir ms cmodamente. Ahora lo que necesitamos es poner una reja grande al frente y tambin en las ventanas para que est ms segura para nuestra familia. Solicito 900.00 dlares para poner rejas en mi vivienda.

loan.use: Place bars on the windows of the home, and a fence.

loan.name: Jesus Carlos

texts.es:
I need to build a room in the back of my house. I will have to build it in the patio area, as placing it on the top of the house would require a hefty investment. Mi house is very small and we are very uncomfortable as there is little room for the furniture. I am requesting $ 800 to build this additional room.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo la necesidad de hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrs de mi vivienda. Voy a tener que construirlo en el patio, ya que si lo hago arriba de mi vivienda tendra que invertir mucho dinero. Mi casa es muy pequea y estamos muy incmodos porque hay poco espacio para los muebles. Solicito 800 dlares para construir un cuarto atrs de mi vivenda.

loan.use: Building an additional room in the back of the house.

loan.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Last year I was granted the house where I presently live with my family. I would like to start the construction of an additional room, as the space is very limited. I intend to make additions to the house, but it will have to be little by little, as I dont have the required capital. I am requesting $ 1000 to build the additional room.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El ao pasado me entregaron mi casa, donde vivo con mi familia, y me gustara empezar con la construccin de un cuarto adicional, ya que los espacios son muy pequeos. Tengo pensado ampliarla ms, pero tendr que ser poco a poco ya que no tengo el capital completo. Solicito 1000 dlares para la construccin de un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loan.use: Building of an additional room in the house.

loan.name: Ral Rodolfo

texts.es:
I need to build a fence in the backyard of my house, as I feel my home is not safe and I want to offer protection to my family. I work the night shift at an in-bond factory and Im not at ease knowing my family is unprotected. I am requesting $200 to build the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo la necesidad de levantar una barda en la parte de atrs de mi vivienda, ya que la siento muy insegura y quiero darle proteccin a mi familia. Trabajo de noche en una maquiladora y no estoy tranquilo sabiendo a mi familia sin proteccin. Solicito 200 dlares para levantar una barda en mi vivienda.

loan.use: Building of a fence/

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundacin para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Sara

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished room in my home, which I need to finish urgently to be able to use it. In order to plaster and paint the walls, I am requesting US$ 500".

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

"Tengo la construccin de un cuarto sin terminar en mi vivienda, me urge terminarlo para poder habitarlo, ya que solo me falta enjarrar y pintar. Es por eso que solicito su apoyo con US$ 500, para terminar la construccin en mi vivienda.

loan.use: Finish construction of a room in her home.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundacin para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
The group "Mujeres Luchadoras CD." (Hardworking Women CD.) is 1 year old and has good savings accumulated due to the hard work and dedication from the women members, who are the group's strongest foundation.

The women who make up this group are engaged in various productive activities. They will use the loan as working capital to buy more goods, in some cases, or will use it as capital for product development.

The businesses featured incluD.: sale of cosmetics (creams, makeup, colognes), selling clothes, selling fast food, selling chipas (typical meal Paraguayan maD. based on starch, cheese, flour and eggs), sale of purses maD. from polythene bags, etc.

These women yearn for a better future for their children - this is why they strive twice as hard to generate sufficient income to enable them to pay for their children's education. They want the country to move forward and to decrease the number of people who must migrate to other countries in search of job opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El comit Mujeres Luchadoras D. CD. tiene 1 ao formacin posee un buen ahorro acumulado gracias al trabajo y dedicacin D. estas mujeres, que son las bases mas fuertes D. este comit emprendedor.

Las seoras que componen este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, ellas utilizan el prstamo como capital operativo comprando mas mercaderas en algunos casos o insumos para la elaboracin D. productos en el caso D. las seoras que se dedican a la venta D. comestibles.

Entre las actividades que realizan podemos citar: venta D. cosmticos (cremas, maquillajes, colonias), venta D. ropas, venta D. comidas rpidas, venta D. chipas (comida tpica paraguaya hecha a base D. almidn, queso, harina y huevo), despensa, venta D. bolsas D. polietileno, entre otros.

Estas mujeres anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar suficiente ingresos que les permita pagar los estudios D. sus hijos. Desean que el pas salga adelante y que disminuya el nmero D. personas que debe emigrar a otros pases en busca D. oportunidades laborales.

loan.use: Loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, shirts, T-shirts, shoes, bags made of polyethylene, vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, sugar, flour, oil, etc (Compra de telas, hilos, botones, camisas, remeras, calzados, bolsas de polietilenos, verduras, frutas, carne, productos enlatados, azcar, harina, aceite, etc.)

loan.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Remansito Group

texts.es:
This group is named "Mujeres Trabajadoras de Remansito" (Remansito Working Women). When one of its members heard of the program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs from a participating neighbor, and realized its benefits of and the progress attained, she decided to contact her neighbors to get their own committee together. The information sessions were a success and the group was formed. Its members, hard working and active women, are devoted to different activities, such as sales of natural medicines, bijouterie, cosmetics, ice cream, fast food, spices, meat and entrails, as well as clothes confection.

The group has 16 members and is located in the Remansito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, a city in the border with Brazil characterized by great commercial activity.

These women, apart from being housewives and micro entrepreneurs, also organize diverse activities to raise funds in order to improve their neighborhood. They are a united group that pays the loans timely. They know that responsibility in making payments is crucial, as is communication between them and solidarity. The requested loan will be used in the purchase of merchandise to sell in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Trabajadoras de Remansito. Se inici gracias a que una de las integrantes tuvo conocimiento del programa Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras, a travs de una vecina que ya formaba parte de un comit. Al ver el progreso logrado y los beneficios del mismo, esta seora decidi contactar a sus vecinas para formar su propio comit. Las reuniones informativas fueron un xito y se logr formar el grupo que est compuesto por seoras muy trabajadoras y activas. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como venta de medicinas naturales, bijouterie, cosmticos, helados, comidas rpidas, carne y menudencias, especias o condimentos y confeccin de ropas.

El grupo est conformado por 16 integrantes y se encuentra localizado en el Barrio Remansito de Ciudad del Este, una ciudad en la frontera con Brasil, caracterizada por el gran movimiento comercial.

Estas mujeres, adems de ser amas de casa y microempresarias, tambin realizan actividades con el fin de recaudar fondos para mejoras en su barrio. Es un grupo unido y muy puntual en sus crditos, ya que ellas saben que es primordial la responsabilidad en los pagos, la comunicacin entre ellas y la solidaridad principalmente. El crdito retirado ser utilizado para la compra de mercaderas para la venta en sus negocios.

loan.use: Purchase of clothing items (shirts, pants, skirts, etc.), ice cream, sugar, meat, spices, natural medicines, bijouterie and other merchandise.

loan.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessicas first experience with business was the sale of beauty products as a consultant for a recognized brand. Little by little, she realized that she enjoyed and was good at selling products. When she separated from her husband, she decided to open her own business so she could increase the income that she was accustomed to. Today, she sells juices in a small soda fountain attended from morning to night. Temporarily, she continues selling beauty products as she receives orders from some customers. She uses the earnings that she obtains from her work to educate and feed her children who are 12 and 5 years old. With the necessary capital, Jessica would like to open a stamping workshop for different types of clothing and locate it in a commercial center.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El primer acercamiento de Jessica con los negocios fue la venta de productos de belleza como consultora de una reconocida marca. Poco a poco, se iba dando cuenta que le gustaba y era buena vendiendo productos. Cuando se separo de su esposo ella decidi abrir un negocio propio para poder contar con un ingreso econmico mas grande lo habitual.
