Hoy en da ella se dedica a vender jugos en una pequea fuente de soda atendiendo desde la maana hasta la noche. Temporalmente ella contina vendiendo los productos de belleza segn le lleguen pedidos de algunas clientas. Las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo las destina bsicamente para la educacin y alimento de sus hijos de doce y cinco aos. De tener el capital necesario a Jessica le gustara abrir un taller de estampado para diferentes tipos de ropa y ubicarlo en un centro comercial.

loan.use: Establish her soda fountain.

loan.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Always seeking progress, since she was young Zoila has dedicated herself to selling. Before working in her shop, she sold cheese and beef to different customers. At the same time, she also worked as a cosmetics consultant. Neverthless, she thought it wasnt profitable to dedicate her life to these jobs. As a result, with the help of her husband, she opened a shop. Currently, she continues her two previous jobs; however, she dedicates more of her time to increasing her sales in her one and a half year old shop. She is focused on working hard so that in the future she may have a better space for her store and can increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Buscando siempre el progreso, Zoila desde muy joven se ha dedicado a vender. Antes de trabajar en su bodega, ella reparta quesos y carne de res a distintos clientes. Paralelo a eso tambin trabajaba como consultora de cosmticos. Sin embargo ella pens que no era muy rentable dedicarse de por vida trabajando solo en ello. Es as que con la ayuda de su esposo se animo a abrir una bodega. Actualmente, ella continua con sus dos oficios anteriores pero el tiempo lo dedica ms a aumentar sus ventas en su tienda de tan solo ao y medio. Ella piensa seguir trabajando duro para en un futuro tener su tienda en un local propio e implementarla con ms productos.

loan.use: Increase her inventory.

loan.name: Erica

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, 31 years old Erica has become a successful micro entrepreneur. For 15 years she has been manufacturing, selling and even exporting bijouterie. She learned the craft as a teenager, helping her uncle elaborate jewelry.

From the beginning she was receiving orders from different clients. When she first got an order from a US client, she decided to start exporting every time she had the chance. She has supplied big jewelry stores and renowned department stores.

She splits her profits between reinvestment in her business and maintenance of her home, as she is the single mother of two small children. She would like to receive training, in order to make her business grow and continue exporting.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

A pesar de ser muy joven, Erica, a sus 31 aos, se ha convertido en una exitosa microempresaria. Hace quince aos que produce, vende e incluso exporta bijouteria. Para ella todo empez cuando an era una adolescente. Ayudando a su to a confeccionar joyas fue aprendiendo el oficio.

Desde un inicio ella produca para diversos clientes quienes le hacan pedidos. Lo mejor fue cuando recibi un pedido de un cliente norteamericano. A raz de eso, ella decidi empezar a exportar cada vez que tena una oportunidad. Ella ha llegado a ser proveedora de tiendas grandes de joyas y de tiendas por departamentos conocidas.

Ella reparte sus ganancias en la reinversin y en el mantenimiento de su hogar, pues debe ser madre y padre de dos hijos menores. Lo que ella quisiera es recibir capacitacin para crecer en su empresa y poder seguir exportando.

loan.use: Receive training for her business.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working woman and a good mother. She has not always been dedicated to her business. She always considered herself a homemaker until four years ago when she needed to make her own income because she separated from her husband. As a result, although her husband continues to help her with housing expenses, when her youngest daughter finished high school and she decided to prepare herself to start university, Rosa decided to give her that opportunity. For this, she opened a small shop where she currently sells breakfasts and sometimes, if theres demand, also lunches. Little by little, she has been growing her business despite the difficulties with the national economic situation. She dreams about a future when she can have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y buena madre. No siempre se ha dedicado a ocupar de su negocio. Ella se ha considerado siempre una ama de casa hasta hace cuatro aos que tuvo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso econmico propio. Ella esta separada con su esposo. Por eso, aunque l an contine ayudndola con el mantenimiento del hogar, cuando su menor hija termino el colegio y decidi prepararse para ingresar a una universidad, Rosa decidi darle aquella oportunidad. Fue as que abri un pequeo local donde actualmente vende desayunos y a veces, segn la demanda, tambin almuerzos. Poco a poco va creciendo en su negocio a pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa la situacin econmica nacional. Ella suea en un futuro con tener una fuente de soda.

loan.use: Convert her shop into a soda fountain.

loan.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a budding entrepreneur and the proud mother of two school-going children. To make a living and provide food and education for her children, Miriam sells a collection of chic pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes. Recently, the entrepreneur took a loan from FSMA which she used to add new styles of shoes and slippers to her stock. The investment was successful and Miriam managed to attract new people to her business and increase her income.

With this second loan, the entrepreneur will buy new fashionable pants and shirts to add to her inventory. Miriam wants to keep working hard in order to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loan.use: Purchase of women's clothing to supply her business

loan.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha runs a mini-market in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. Each day she receives visits from hundreds of customers who want to purchase different kinds of products, ranging from fresh chicken meat, rice, beans, and vegetable oil to bread, peanut butter and the like. Her store also offers alcoholic and energizing drinks.

Bertha plans on using her loan to purchase more products so that she can significantly increase the sales volume and her revenue. That way, the entrepreneur will be able to improve her familys lifestyle.

loan.use: Purchase of a lot of goods for her little grocery store

loan.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is twenty-six years old and mother of four daughters who range in age from five to eleven, three of whom attend school. Her husband works as a security agent for a company.

Francia has been operating a small cafeteria for almost three years. She started her business with a loan she took from FSMA. Currently, her business is growing and she hopes that this growth can be constant. The entrepreneur also explains that she would like to have enough money to keep providing good education for her children and to buy a house in the future.

With her loan, Francia will buy products she needs to prepare her delicious typical Dominican food and satisfy her customers' demands.

loan.use: To acquire products and materials to prepare food for a small cafeteria

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hard-working and untiring entrepreneur who strives to provide food and education for nine children. She sells womens clothing in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur explains that her childrens education is very important for her future, and that shed do anything to support them so that they can lift themselves up out of poverty.

Carmen is requesting a loan (actually the second one shell take from FSMA) to purchase clothing in bulk to continue her business activity and increase her income. The entrepreneur will do her best to improve her familys lifestyle.

loan.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail in her community

loan.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is forty years old and the mother of two boys and one daughter. Her husband works for a construction company. To supplement the familys income, Guillermina sells used and new pants, shoes, shirts, blouses, and the like.

Guillermina would like to have money enough to support their childrens university studies, and also to buy a house some day. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more clothing to supply her business and increase her revenue.

loan.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail

loan.name: Sana Gul

texts.en: Sana Gul lives with his own family in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of four children. He works in agriculture. Gul started his business one year ago. During this time he has worked hard to cultivate his land. Now he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock of agricultural necessities and to buy more seeds so that he can take good benefit from his land and so that he can help his family. He is happy about the process of loans in Afghanistan.

loan.use: To complete his stock and buy more seeds

loan.name: Hafizallah

texts.en: Hafizallah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of two children who are both in school. He is the only breadwinner for his family. He works in agriculture. He has lots of land to cultivate but he is unable to take the best advantage of it, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock of agricultural necessities and be in a position to make good income. In this way, he believes that he can better help his family. He is happy with all members of his family.

loan.use: To complete his stock of agricultural necessities

loan.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi T., 46 years old, is one among 20 first members of TYM Fund. In 1992, TYM Fund of the Vietnamese Women Union came to Minh Phu town to put their microeconomic programs to help Vietnamese women into trials. With 20USD borrowed money, Mrs. T. invested in breeding pigs. Even though she did not earn a lot of profit at first, she realized the convenience in being able to repay weekly and she also appreciated the knowledge she learned from their meetings. She continued to be a member of the Fund and borrowed more more money. Her family situation got better over time and she was able to send her children to school. Her oldest child is now the Director of a software company. Because of the current trend, together with the help of her oldest child, she invested in opening an Internet caf. Mrs. T. had lots of customers, especially young people. Her current income is 220-250 USD/ month. In the future, she wants to expand her Internet caf to serve more customers. This time she intends to borrow 1200 USD to buy more computers

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ch Dng Th T., 46 tui, l 1 trong s 20 thnh vin i vo lch s ca Qu Tnh thng. Nm 1992, Qu Tnh thng ca Hi lin hip ph n Vit Nam v vi x Minh Ph ni ch sng th nghim m hnh cho ph n ngho vay vn pht trin kinh t. Vi 20USD vay c t Qu, ch T. u t vo chn nui ln. Sau vng vn u tin, s li T. c tuy khng nhiu nhng ch T. nhn thy c s T.n li trong vic hon tr tun cng nh nhng kin thc ch hc c trong nhng bui sinh hot cm. Cc vng vn tip theo ch tip tc tham gia v xin vay nhng mc vn cao hn. i sng gia nh dn c nng ln, ch c iu kin nui con n hc t t. n nay 2 con ch u i hc v c cng n vic lm n nh. Chu ln hin l Gim c cng ty xc tin thng mi chuyn v lnh vc phn mm. Trc nhu cu tm hiu thng tin ca th trng v s T.n li khi c con lm trong lnh vc ny ch T. u t vn m ca hng internet. Khch hng n vi ca hng ca ch rt ng, c bit l gii tr. T. nhp hng thng ca ch T. khong t 220-250USD. Trong tng lai ch mun ca hng ca mnh ngy cng m rng phc v nhn dn c tt hn. Vng vn ny ch ngh xin vay 1200USD mua thm my tnh.

loan.use: Buy computers

loan.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi N., 46 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Minh Phu, Soc Son. When the TYM Fund came to her village in 1992, she participated in the program and borrowed 30 USD to invest in breeding pigs. In the first year, her family situation experienced positive changes. Since then, she borrowed more money to expand her breeding plan. Her income from breeding pigs increased over years and as a result, she was able to send her children to school. Currently, her family income is 330 USD/month. Because of her successful business, in 2004, Mrs. N. was able to have her own well-furnished house built. During recent years, she always borrow the maximum allowed money. Her plan is to borrow 1200 USD to buy more pigs, ducks, fishes and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ch Ng Th Ngi, 46 tui, sng cng chng v 2 con ti Minh Ph, Sc Sn. Nm 1992 khi c Qu Tnh Thng v thn ch xin tham gia v c vay 30USD u t vo chn nui. Trong nm u tin kinh t gia nh c nhng s thay i, cc vng vn tip theo c vay mc cao hn ch Ngi u t m rng d n. Thu nhp t chn nui tng dn ln qua cc nm gip ch Ngi c iu kin cho con ci hc hnh n ni n chn. Hin nay mi thng gia nh ch thu 330USD. Nh lm n hiu qu n nm 2004 ch Ngi xy c nh mi bng khang trang c y tin nghi sinh hot. Trong nhng nm gn y ch lun vay mc vn ti a. D nh ca ch l s xin vay 1200USD mua thm ln, vt, c v thc n gia sc.

loan.use: Buy pigs, ducks, fishes and food for them

loan.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ng Th Tip, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1993. She is married with 5 children. Four of children are still in school. Funds from the loans are used to invest in her livestock also help to her childrens education expenses. The familys economy improves. Since 2003, shes been expanding her livestock business. Now she has 800 ducks for eggs, 100 pigs and a fish pond. The average monthly income is $300. After 14 years with the TYM Fund, her family has a 3 storey house with all modern appliances. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to invest in her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Ng Th Tip, 40 tui, tham gia Qu nm 1993. Gia nh ch gm 2 v chng v 5 ngi con, trong 4 chu ang trong tui n trng. ng vn vay t Qu c ch Tip s dng vo kinh doanh bun tru, b, v dnh mt phn u t cho con i hc. Ngun thu nhp t d n kinh doanh to c hi cho kinh t gia nh ngy cng pht trin. Sang nm 2003 ch Tip chuyn sang m hnh lm kinh t trang tri. Hin nay gia nh ch c 800 con vt , 100 con ln, 2 so ao th c. Thu nhp bnh qun t 300USD/thng. Thnh qu sau 14 nm tham gia Qu ca ch Tip l ngi nh 3 tng vi y tin nghi. D nh ca ch Tip l vay thm 1200USD mua thc n cho n gia sc, gia cm ca mnh.

loan.use: Invest in livestock

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyn Th L. is 50 years old and her husband is 52. They have 2 children who are grown up. Her main occupation is selling grocery and raising pigs. With her first loan of 30 USD from TYM in 1995, she started her pig raising business which had yielded good results. In 2000, she opened a grocery store and it really picked up. After more than 10 years with TYM, she was able to build a house for her family. Selling grocery and raising pigs are suitable to enabling weekly payment. Her husband is an electrician, he helps her out whenever she needs help. This time Mrs L. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy feed for her herd of 14 pigs. Her family monthly income is 300 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Ch Nguyn Th L. nm nay 50 tui cn chng ch 52. Anh ch c hai con trng thnh. Cng vic hng ngy ca ch l chn nui ln v bn hng tp ha. Vi s vn 30USD vay t Qu nm 1995 ch u t cho chn nui mang li hiu qu kinh t cao. Sang nm 2000 ch m thm ca hng tp ha nn kinh t ngy cng pht trin. Sau hn 10 nm tham gia Qu ch L. xy c mt ngi nh khang trang vi y cng trnh ph. Vic bn hng kt hp vi chn nui ln rt ph hp vi m hnh hon tr tun. Bn cnh anh c chng ch, mt th in, lun h v mi khi c kh khn. D n tin trin thun li, vng ny ch L. xin vay 1200USD mua thc n cho n ln 14 con, ng thi mua hng bn. Mc thu nhp hin nay ca gia nh ch L. l 300USD/thng.

loan.use: Buy goods for grocery store and buy food for pigs

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs. Nguyn Th Luyn, 40 years old, has a store front right on the Highway 13. It is the main artery of H Ni - Cao Bng. The area has high concentration of population, many industrials and businesses. With a good location but lack of funds, she joins the TYM Fund which has a convenient weekly payment plan that fits her needs. The familys economy improves. She acquires more lot to expand her store and hires 2 clerks that she pays $50 a month each. The net income is 8-10USD a day. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to replenish her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Gia nh ch Nguyn Th Luyn, 40 tui, c ca hng ngay mt ng quc l 3, trc giao thng huyt mch H Ni - Cao Bng, ni tp trung ng dn c v cc c quan x nghip nn rt ph hp cho vic kinh doanh. Vi iu kin thun li nh vy nn vn nn nm 1994 ch quyt nh tham gia vo Qu c vay vn. iu ch cm thy thch nht l vn vay ca Qu hon tr theo tun. ng nh ch ngh s vn vay t Qu qua nhiu nm u t gip kinh t gia nh ngy cng pht trin. Ch Luyn tch ly tin mua thm t m rng ca hng. Hai con ang trong tui n trng cng c ch cho hc hnh n ni n chn. Hin nay trung bnh mi ngy ca hng ch li t 8-10USD. Cng vic bn rn, ch Luyn thu thm 2 nhn cng gip vic v tr lng 50USD/thng. Sp ti ch tip tc xin vay 1200USD mua thm thc phm v ung phc v khch hng.

loan.use: Buy food and drink

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)
